Reviews.Title: “Awsome service, clean rooms and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Mariko-SGP
Reviews.Content: Staffs was prompt, helpful and friendly. When we arrive they greeted us and quickly help us with our baggage. There is also a goodie bag and DVD for kids. Hotel is just 10 mins walk away to the Olympic MTR, convenient if you are going to Disneyland. Hotel shuttle is also available to nearby shopping malls but it would be great if they can increase the frequency of shuttle service. The hotel is also near to several good eateries. Only bad point is the wifi keep getting disconnected in the hotel room. Overall we had a plesent stay and I would recommend the quad room if you are travelling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Have no regret, great and friendly service from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: clementlim80
Reviews.Content: Recently I've put up my stay at this hotel for few days, the room there was a bit small but it's alright as it's a clean and comfortable place to stay.. the Shuttle bus will be at the entrance of the hotel every hour, therefore we have no problem to go around town even place beyond Mongkok.. On one occasion, i'm trying to get a cab outside the hotel, the staff came out, asked us to stand under the shade, he himself wear his coat trying to get a cab for us for almost half an hour (it was a peak time) I've really appreciate the friendly and heart warming service from the hotel staff, from front desk staff to the bellboy and the room keeping staff.. their service really made our trip a wonderful and memorable. and also their wanton mee recommendation at 沾仔记。nice...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean rooms, great value for Families with small kids!”
Reviews.Author: adrianchoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely situated, 10 mins walk away from the MTR station. Lots of good eateries around the block. The Service is unbelievable - from the time we got off the taxi, the team rushed out to greet us and grab our bags - one even held my 4 yr old daughter's hand when he saw we were all busy with the bags and payment to the taxi driver - just in case she should run across the street! The rooms are clean and neat - high ceilings and big windows make the room seem bigger than it is. On the 3rd night, my daughter ran a 40 deg fever - the Manager, Yannick, came up with with a thermometer to loan us, and 15 minutes later, appeared at our door with fever packs and a container of ice and wet towels, just in case!! The service is excellent...friendly staff, and the breakfast is pretty decent too. I recommend this place for family trips!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Tzanev
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect for couples to stay. The location is good, the rooms are very clean and the service is perfect. Child may stay free of charge, but the double rooms are quite compact for more than two, even if it is a child. The hotel is not quite suitable for business stay, as if you intend to make a meeting there it has no convenient place to meet. However I met perfect assistance from one of the guest services manager Mr. Yannic Lau with arranging some business matters and needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AGB1983
Reviews.Content: Me & my best friend, we stayed 10 days at this very nice hotel in MongKok, which is not in HK city center, but thanks to the Olympics station of Subway 5 minutes away or even more thanks to the super Shuttle service every hour (whole day!), you're easily connected to the rest of Kowloon and Hong Kong, as well as Airport Express. The service at entrance, both reception and concierge were amazingly friendly and helpful. All hotels should have people like this! Thanks! We pre-booked also breakfast, and it was a good decision, seen the choice of fresh fruits, juice coffee & tea, cereals, chinese breakfast (noodles, dim sum, etc) and european breakfast (croissant, toast, jam, etc). Waiters were always attentive and gentle. It's a great choice for it's very attractive price.The only thing I would change is the pre-paid airport shuttle service which costs 140HKD each person, but in fact you pay less with combination of subway Olympics-Kowloon and then Airport Express from Kowloon to Hong Kong Int'l Airport....no wonder that we didn't use taxi or hotel shuttle service for the transfer back at the airport when we were leaving Hong Kong... All in all, in any case, I would suggest other people to stay at this nice and friendly hotel, suitable for all kind of types of guests (in fact, we could see all types of customers, from business people, to couples, to little & big families, from Western countries, but also a lot of Asian people).

Reviews.Title: “Great service staff but Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: hicheerios
Reviews.Content: I have decided to stay here for 4 nights after reading positive reviews online. However, to my dismay upon checking into my room. Everything is just not what I wanted and read. I have requested for a room far from the elevator, and guess what happened? They have actually gave me a room right infront of the elevator. The noise level during Peak hours in the morning is just bad as the walls are quite thin. This is the tiniest room I have ever stayed in HK. The walking space is little where at any point of time, you can only have 1 person walking around in the room. Bathroom is also tiny. As for the location wise, it is not that near to Mongkok ladies street area. However, the shuttle bus service does helps to get to Mongkok faster. If not, it is also walking distance of about 15-20mins. The hotel area is near to many food areas where you can find McD, Cha chang tengs, market food.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Cosmo Hotel MongKok”
Reviews.Author: Bunnies_Toronto
Reviews.Content: I spend 7 days in Cosmo Hotel Mongkok. It gave me a clean and friendly impression of the hotel. They responded to me quickly as my flight was delayed for almost 6 hours to Hong Kong. That give me confident my room would be hold until I showed up. Definitely Cosmo is mt first choice while back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “modern,excellent and wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: galxuz
Reviews.Content: my whole family enjoyed the stay at Cosmo hotel mongkok, service is good, staffs are friendly, accessible to mtr, customer oriented and manager received us personally and brought us to our room..love this hotel and definitely if we are coming to hong kong again, this hotel will be our choice...

Reviews.Title: “Quick respond for help”
Reviews.Author: HallyJP
Reviews.Content: Room was cosy and comfy for me and partner. Everything was complete and well sufficient. One time I couldnt open my safe. Yannick who was on duty was at my door in less than 5min. Also presented me a corporate gift to me as goodwill gesture. Unexpected. Thumbs up for that. I will definitely consider this good for value, new and very wlecoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's my first time staying in Cosmo Mongkok Hotel. Picture and reality looks the same, very comfortable too. We were having problem with our safe deposit box, called the concierge and their manager, Mr Yannick came to our room within 5 mins. Service was superb! I will definitely stay there again on my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “6th August - 9th August 2012”
Reviews.Author: R G
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by very friendly and smiling hotel staff and on first impressions the hotel looked clean modern and inviting atmosphere with very cold air conditioning which was greatly appreciated. We were checked in by Augustine,the office manager,who was very polite and checked us in efficiently who also upgraded our room which was a surprise. Augustine was very knowledgeable and spent time to advise us on where different markets etc were which was invaluable. On entering our room,which we were expecting to be small in view of the country we were in so no surprise,on the 23rd floor and yes it is compact but very clean with LCD TV,alarm clock, iPod dock and tea/coffee making facilities with a mini bar. The bed was very comfortable with light switches all over the place and an electrically operated blind when up the view was excellent.The shower / WC was compact but functional and clean which was replenished with clean towels daily if required along with complimentary toiletries ,tooth brushes and complimentary two bottles of water. There was a free shuttle service every hour from the hotel and back from various destinations,the only negative about the free shuttle was the over zealous fast driver. We could not comment on hotel dinning as we eat out every day. I read the lifts were very slow but we had NO problem having to wait no more than a few mins. Yes the lobby area did get busy but you must remember it is just that 'a lobby' where guests check in and out and make use of the free WiFi. We did not find this to be an issue at all. The hotel is within walking distance from the many MTR Stations and a good short cut to Olympic station is via the HSBC building. Would we go back again YES.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL CITY HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: Muhd N
Reviews.Content: Really enjoy my staying here. Small room doesnt matter, because the name is Hong Kong. I love to user private lounge at level 1 which is private to guest. The shuttle is very useful to guest that like to travel around the city. Vibrant staff at the front desk. Good location for guest that travel without travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good concierge service”
Reviews.Author: FairyMantra
Reviews.Content: Stay in Cosmo Hotel Mongkok for 2 days. The room is pretty small (but it is quite common in country such as Hong Kong). In general, my room decor is quite modern and look new. The interior design is quite good to fully utilize the existing space. Something I'd like to give compliment is the concierge service. I arrived the hotel using airport transfer in MPV. I got more than 7 pieces of luggages in the car. The moment i stepped down the car, a few strong (and handsome..) guys already waiting out there to assist me in arranging my luagage to the hotel room. They even recommended some nice dim sum restaurants nearby the hotel (within walking distance). As far as the location is concerned, I don't really like it (there are some better choice). As far as the service, no complaint about.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Chingfordian2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in mid August 2012. The hotel is great although their room service menu needs to be expanded to include more than just Thai food and a couple of pasta dishes. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The free shuttle bus is helpful for going out. The MTR is not far and it's approx a 5 - 10 min walk to the Ladies market (not just for Ladies but a fine selection of things you don't need but can't help buying!) When we're back in Hong Kong, we'll likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: manilabiker
Reviews.Content: staying in this hotel was an experience for me since its my first time to stay in a botique hotel. the lobby was nice and clean with free wifi. when we got off the elevator i was surprsed since the door of the room was already there. its the first time ive seen a setup like this. then once i got inside the room it was really small, i remember the time when i was in an inside cabin in a cruise ship. there was not really a lot of room to move at, the bathroom was about 2 square meters in size. the room was clean and the view was nice. the location was ok since there was a convenience store near and the olympic mtr station was just 10 mins walk from the hotel. the food establishments near were good and inexpensive. there was also a shuttle to take you to the mall and to tsim sha tsui area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barnettsj
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Cosmo Hotel and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and the quality of the rooms very good. The rooms are daily cleaned and the hotel is located in an exciting part of Hong Kong and close to all services and markets. They have a nice Thai restaurant in the hotel. We also found the rooms to be well air conditioned and quiet. Looking forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little decent hotel......”
Reviews.Author: purseee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. Check in process was fast and had an early check in. Was provided with complimentary Wi-Fi. Given a room on the 18th floor- which was pretty nice. Don't be shocked by the size of the room, even though it was small, the space was cleverly set up, Housekeeping was good- room was always cleaned/ properly and up to par. Concierge was really helpful and willing to help. The only downside was when I was trying to ask a staff from the front desk to show on the map or landmarks where the pick up point for the shuttle bus from Mongkok as we missed the bus & wanted to take it when coming back from MK - he got impatient with me and explained that even if tried to explain to me, I wouldn't know where cause it's too complicated. I was pretty taken aback by that. Hotel provided free shuttle service to various places like Mongkok MTR/Langham Place, Kowloon AEL and China Macau Ferry Terminal which was very convenient and fast. Shuttle bus service always leaves on schedule- so a tip is to be there at least 10-15 min before the scheduled timing as at times there will already be a long queue. I felt that the nearest Olympic MTR was a little far from the hotel (especially after a long day of shopping), at least a 10 min walk and a hassle if it rains or missed the shuttle bus. There's not much shopping around this area, but if you really explore, there are really awesome and alot of restaurants/cha chaan teng around the area! (Food is good around this area!) :) There's also convenience stores & Macdonalds just opposite the hotel! Might consider another hotel, maybe nearer to Mongkok (if you're here for the shopping!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in vibrant part of city”
Reviews.Author: DianeFromLondon
Reviews.Content: Modern, smart hotel with comfortable rooms in a exciting part of HK. The service was excellent with staff always wanting to help, providing advice on a local cheap eat or the best way to get anywhere. The rooms are compact but I've had a lot smaller in HK before. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Accessible, great service, value for the money, the only hotel that provides a Family Quad room”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler293
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through my internet search engine for my accommodation need of family of four in one room in this congested city. My daughter received a complimentary welcome gift- a cute Cosmo bear. Though the room is small with two twin single beds clamped close, and no chairs in the quad room, it's clean and sufficient for each adult/teeange kid to sleep in their own bed and be in the same room with their parents..., We got breakfast daily on the house! I was surprised by a complimentary bottle of wine and fruit tray on my birthday during my stay !! Food is abundant around the neighborhood with all kinds: from local mama-papa shops to international favors. Though surrounded by tall buildings, we were on one of the higher floors with a nice tall window and the view of the city was great... they included free hotel shuttle service, and the hotel staff were very courteous with excellent service

Reviews.Title: “Accessible, good service and value-for- money hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ndianah
Reviews.Content: I'd go back to Cosmo Mongkok any time I go back to Hong Kong. It may take a bit of navigational skills at first to get there but just ask around and the people will direct you there, or you can even get the hotel staff to speak to the taxi driver if they are confused. A 5 minute walk to Olympic station, you're easily connected to the MTR (subway) and at a quite central location. Food is abundant here- you can try the local delights at the neighbourhood shops around the area or the ever familiar McDonalds across the street or restaurants at the huge mall by Olympic MTR station. There's a noticeable Watsons nearby too in case you need off the counter medicine or any personal care items. The hotel room may be small but it is clean and sufficient. The sitting deck by the tall window is just awesome to sit by and watch people go by. The hotel staff are really friendly and helpful, always ensuring that you have a pleasant stay ahead. With all their promotions, it's a great place to stay and it's definitely worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with easy access to many food outlets”
Reviews.Author: serseri
Reviews.Content: Had a group of 15 who stayed in the hotel from 9th Aug to 12th Aug. Other than the rooms being small, we had a very enjoyable stay at the hotel. The staff at the Concierge definitely deserves a pat on their shoulders for being prompt and helpful at all times!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly local hotel good for its value”
Reviews.Author: psvso
Reviews.Content: We like it because: Excellent value--compare to general cost in Kowloon area Friendly and helpful staff throughout our stay--Even it is industry standard, this hotel can maintain it. Clean and tidy environment-We stayed for around 2 weeks and it is consistant. Convenient location--Close to Mong Kok and Olympic Station(SUBWAY), also provide shuttle to nearby. Quite restaurant--Buffet breakfast serves the purpose. But we don't like: Small lift with a long wait; Crowded lobby with free WiFi users esp. during check-in time--and very limited sofa available; Hourly shuttle bus schedule will disappoint lots of riders. Suggest providing more than one bus when on demand.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: sklek
Reviews.Content: We booked the Cosmorganic and family quad room through Cosmo website. No hassle and flexible to make modifications online before check in. The rooms are bright and tastefully designed within the limited space. Our family had the quad room and hence slightly more spacious than the standard room. The housekeeping did a fabulous job making sure the rooms r clean and replenished with the amenities. Complimentary water and children DVD are very appreciated. Location is not in central mongkok but is compensated by their free shuttle, convenience stores, McDonalds and local eateries. Olympic station is about 8 min walk away, which is linked to a shopping mall. If taking shuttle, be sure to arrive 10 min before the bus schedule time as they leave very promptly. Free wifi available at lobby. Hotel staff are friendly and has a approachable smile. We had some issues with the Aircon and safe box, both occasions are promptly serviced within 5 min of requests. The quad room Aircon seems rather cold even though we tune to 28 degrees and fan 1. Lift service can get a little slow during peak hours even though there are 3 lifts. Overall experience has been good and will consider staying here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “5/5”
Reviews.Author: zahs17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week back in January with a friend. We paid about $100AUD a night, not bad for Hong Kong. Excellent service and free shuttle bus to Mongkok and to the ferry terminal. Rooms were very clean and well kept. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “"Sleep is Good"”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights and were spoilt the first night as the room was upgraded from standard to deluxe. If you want more space then this is the way to book. Standard rooms are small but still adequate when all you really want to do is sleep there. The staff are friendly and want to be helpful. They will go out of their way to make sure all is well and are prepared to the little things to make your trip as enjoyable as possible. Location is good and within walking distance of Olympian Mall and if you really like walking you can get around most of the locale even as far as the Ferry Terminal and Night Laser Show. Otherwise, a shuttle bus is provided to local places which is very convenient. Overall this hotel provides what you need and a few little extras with their friendly and helpful staff being available at all times. Remember, hotels are mainly for sleeping and the "Sleep is Good".

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: PeterChan_SG
Reviews.Content: The GOOD: The competitive advantage of this hotel lies with its high service level. We received top-notch service standard from check-in to check-out and everything in between! The staffs are very knowledgeable with the local district and are more than happy to give recommendations such as places to eat and things to do. If you cannot speak in Canto, the staff will even help you flag a cab and direct the taxi driver to your destination! Room wise, we had a family room (for 4) and a deluxe room (for 2). The family room is much more spacious and comes with a huge toilet! The deluxe room is relatively smaller but still comfortable nonetheless. Lastly, the rates are competitive and value-for-money considering the hotel is close to Olympic and Mongkok MTR. The NOT so good: Lift. The hotel is being served by 2 lifts in the main lobby and can be a little frustrating if you are staying above 20th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Mi123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the comfort room for 10 days and it was a very pleasant stay. The receptionist men were polite and helpful and the bell boys were so attentive, opening doors, helping with luggage and greeting everytime (not bad on the eyes either). Also the housekeeping was very good, clean rooms and always stocked with amenities. The room itself is quite small but I think the beds are really comfy although they can be quite wobbly if you're not careful. All in all I think it is very good value for money! Also location was not bad, about 8 minutes walk to Olympic MTR or 10 minutes walk to MK, if not then the shuttle bus is useful. The only thing is the sliding doors of the bathroom, there was a little gap left when fully closed so me and my friend could see each other on the toilet.. Yeah so that can be a little awkward at first. Also the ladies behind reception may need more service training, openly sneering at customers is not professional.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: 5BM
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Friendly staff. Nice restaurant. Stayed for 5 nights. Room is small. But good for this price. Location is good. Easy to take taxi. Convenient store just nearby. Restaurant in hotel is good. Good Italian food. Simple food. Good pasta.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, but staff at breakfast lounge needs serious improvements”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaThong
Reviews.Content: Period of stay: 4 days, Jul 2012 Overall Feedback: Pleasant stay, hotel with a personal touch but staff in breakfast lounge needs serious improvements! Service: Bell Captain, King Li and Director of Rooms, Andrew deserves compliments. Both of them serve the hotel guest proactively and with great attitude. This can be felt from the moment we check into the hotel lobby on our first day. They were quick in taking care of our luggage and even when the extra mile for us on a few occasions. Service is very consistent despite the more hectic work days when there is typhoon. Both of them really lead by example. Lady Manager and egg station chef needs serious improvement. In fact, they should be sacked! The latter can’t even prepare a proper egg omelette. The lady manager drags her feet when she walked with no smile on the face or anything. No sense of integrity when we feedback to her about and unidentified particles in the glass of orange juice and refuted our claim by saying there’s nothing inside the OJ after she inspected it. Room: Quad room on 20th floor. Double kings bed was very comfortable. Single twin beds were a little shaky. Location: Near to Olympic MTR station. Free shuttle bus to Mongkok MTR station but we didn’t try it as we were commuting mainly via Taxi. Other service: Free WI-FI. Umbrellas not on loan during typhoon signal 8 but was compensated with poncho. We should have been offered adult size poncho rather than children size poncho though.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: msLooLoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in May 2012. In general the hotel is pleasant, though I expected more from 4-star hotel. Service-wise; the bell boys deserve compliments, they are quick in taking care of our luggages (right after we got off the taxi, amazing!), and they always open the door for us every time we come or leave the hotel. the staffs in the restaurant were not that friendly. at some point, i wonder if they were really trained in service, as they hardly smiled or being service-y. however I did notice that they were more friendly towards caucasians.. hmm.. Room: stayed in Quad room on 24th floor, the bed was sooo comfortable, I could just lie down the whole day on it! Location: near to Olympic MTR station, and they also provide shuttle bus to Mongkok MTR station which we made use of as often as possible. For more detailed review, and some pictures, please visit my blog page: http://dayswithlooloo.blogspot.com/2012/07/hong-kong-cosmo-mongkok-hotel-tai-kok.html

Reviews.Title: “never seen a smaller room!!”
Reviews.Author: Paolo B
Reviews.Content: I spent a night in Hong Kong during a business trip. Despite a very good service and a friendly staff, I experienced living in less than 9 squared meters.. Even if I'm not used to it it was not bad. Prices are high compared to hotel and room standards of Greater China, but, you know, we are in Hong Kong and hotels are never cheap

Reviews.Title: “"Good experience"”
Reviews.Author: WS Y
Reviews.Content: In general, our family of four had a good experience with this hotel. The staff there were super good and provided us with excellent service. The bell boys were amazing and they always opened the door for you...every single time. However, the staff in the restaurant were not quite good. They had no smile and therefore customers don't feel welcome. The breakfast was not good...the menu was always the same...the chef at the cooking station was always invisible...because he's not at the station most of the time. I think they need more staff there in the morning so the chef can focus in cooking at the station. The housekeeping in this hotel is wonderful. The lady paid attention to every detail so she would arrange everything in the way that we want after one or two days. Better yet, we stayed there in two separate periods with four days in between because we travelled to Macau. When we came back from Macau, she even prepared the slippers that suited our needs, two pairs with adult size and two pairs with child size...very thoughtful. The location is not a good one but I must say it's quite convenient. The Olympic subway station is just 5 minutes away and once you cross the street and go into HSBC centre, you can actually walk through buildings to get to the subway station without going outside. The lobby is small and crowded with people using wi-fi. The elevators were slow...the shuttle bus was only once an hour and not enough space for peak hours...so be prepared to losing your ride even though you were there on time. The New Kowloon Indoor Plaza is closeby and there's a dry cleaner in there. So if you need laundry service, it's much cheaper. There's a restaurant on the second level called "Tai Hing" with excellent food...BBQ pork, roasted pig and much more...yum! I would recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Rummni G
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay here as the staff was very attentive and frienly towards our every need. Beds and rooms are small but this is standard no matter where you stay in Hongkong. I highly recommend this hotel, close to Olympic station and within walking distance to ladies market etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Cosmo Hotel Mongkok from 16 to 20 July 2012. The lobby is nice and front line staff is very good and helpful. Although the room is small but it is cozy, clean and nice. Especially the bathroom, I like it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Geoff W
Reviews.Content: This has been my only stay in HK, (8 days in July) so I found the Cosmorganic pkg room small and the bed way too short (I'm 185cm). Against, only 2 things - the lifts are painfully slow and the breakfast fell short of my expectations. I had hoped to rememdy that with the on floor chef, but one clearly did not enjoy his job. We included breakfast in the booking so were committed and I prefer to eat in, but next time would mix it up with somewhere else. I found the staff generally very helpful ( - not unusual in the industry!). On the other hand, it is convenient, comfortable and mostly quiet. I slept well. The free in-room and lounge wifi (options we took) with free real coffee was appreciated and extra water every day in the room was great. The shuttle bus is handy, taxis are cheap and trains fast and nearby. Take a hotel card (with address in Chinese) with you, as taxis don't know it. I'd go back but I'd like to see an extra lift in use! Real coffee with Australian cooked breakfast/lunch can be found at Coco Espresso, Sheung Wan, Central. Johnson is a legend.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel, extraordinary staff”
Reviews.Author: iShare
Reviews.Content: I spent 40 days in HK and tried different hotels. In this one, I booked a comfort room. No problem of noise as mentioned in other reviews, probably because the floor of my room was high. I often travel and must say the Cosmo staff is the best I've never seen. Cammo84 is right: all employees look always so happy to help. I've no idea where they find their energy, they look like always hoping you will ask them sth and they are constantly focusing on your well-being, from the beginning till the end of your stay. Approach the hotel, 5 employees will open the doors for you, they propose you to store your suitcases the last day before you ask for it, the cleaning ladies arrange the room with cute personal attentions after knowing your habits, etc. etc. non stop surprising great attitude. This high quality staff can unfortunately not cover the average level of the hotel itself. The room was clean but too small (even if you can see that the architects have been working well to optimize the space). The bathroom was nice but you are a bit tight on toilet and the door system makes you feel a lack of privacy. I agree with JENNIFERLELACHEUR about the problem of the lift: one lift for all the hotel cause unwanted waits. There is a free shuttle bus service, but it is totally unefficient (1 per hour!), it's better to go by walk to Mongkok MTR Station (15 minutes, easy way) (I don't recommend the Olympic MTR Station because only the expensive lines pass there). HK travellers tell you that it's common in HK to have small rooms. It's true but it doesn't mean that you have to choose a "common HK Hotel". I recommend the Harbour Plaza 8 Degree (review coming soon): spacious rooms with same budget, the location isn't perfect but its free shuttle service is very efficient (1 per approx. 20 min.). About Hong Kong: The safest and most civilized city of China with Beijing: tons of things to do, of shopping malls and tourist points that will blow up your mind, non stop delicious flavors in the restaurants, highly recommended city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good area”
Reviews.Author: Robert R
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel multiple times and found it to be a good deal. Pros - Hotel is modern and clean. The rooms are small but you come to expect that in Hong Kong for this price. - Bar and restaurant is nice, but a little expensive - Location is good. Short walk to the Olympic Mall which has Western food including a Starbucks. - Shuttle takes you to the area close to the Ladies Market - Staff is polite and efficient Cons - As mentioned in other reviews the sound proofing could use some improvement. I stayed there shortly after the start of Chinese New Year and it was quite noisy for most of the evening (expected) but the door did little to buffer the sound. - It is slightly confusing for drivers to find the entrance which isn't the hotels fault but should be noted - Views from the rooms are not much. My last room looked straight into the building next door - It is in the Mongkok area which is a good trek away from the Kowloon area and the Night market, Elements, Shopping, and the ferries to Hong Kong Island - Be sure you book with this hotel and not their sister on Hong Kong Island. I have done this and had to take a taxi to the other hotel, which by the way is quite nice Overall this is a good deal for a couple of nights. I usually book one night before my flight to the US after business in Mainland China. its a good detox before the long trip and I can prepare and relax, have a good meal, and maybe do a little walking around town. I would say that if you are going on Holiday or for an extended stay you would probably be happier staying in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: JENNIFERLELACHEUR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in July 12 for five nights in the standard comfort room. Positives first (it will be quicker).....location is great! A few mins walk to Olympic MTR Station which also has a great food hall and shopping mall aswell as close to Ladies Market etc. The rooms were pleasant enough. Size is whats expected of Hong Kong. Bad points...upon arrival the receptionists were rude and abrupt and demanded a HKD$1000 deposit to be kept until departure. This seems totally unreasonable and i do not recall anything being made clear about this upon time of booking. When the paperwork was sorted, nothing was offered, ie excursions, details of the area, maps, details of transfers, where our room was etc etc. Not a good first impression at all. Breakfast was awful and expensive. There was a small selection of fruit, congee, dumplings (sweet and savoury), sausages, boiled eggs, rice parcels, beans and a chef who made omelettes/fried eggs, none of which were labelled btw. Hardly a varied menu when the price is so high. The saving grace was the toast maker! I filled up on toast to start the day then decided to go elsewhere for breakfast on the remaining days. Rooms were small but clean which is fine. However, they are not sound proofed very well at all. Every noise in the corridor can be heard and the staff didnt seem to understand discretion and could be heard bellowing at all hours (mainly via a walkie talkie which sounded like it was set on the highest volume). The aircon was great but noisy so it was a choice of sleeping and being hot or having the aircon on and not sleeping......... Lifts were SLOW! If you need to get to the lobby for a transfer, I would suggest leaving your room at least ten mins before time. We were stuck in one lift for a while as it went to every floor except ours! Gym was tiny and most things were broken! All in all I would not recommend for anyone to stay here as I strongly believe there are other hotels in the area which would be better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in an interesting area”
Reviews.Author: cammo84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cosmo Hotel Mongkok for 5 nights in late June. The hotel is very modern and the rooms are comfortable (although a little small), mine had a fantastic view of the city with a mountainous backdrop. The bed was a little short for my liking, I'm only 5'9 but I had to lie diagonally across it. This wasn't an issue as I was on my own, but if I were sharing it with someone else it may have been uncomfortable. The ipod dock was a cool touch - it's hard to charge my mp3 player whilst travelling with no computer, so this feature came in handy. The staff were very helpful. Several times I asked them to write addresses in Chinese for me to show taxi drivers and they were always happy to help out. The wifi in the lobby was fairly quick. The location isn't exactly central, but they do run a regular shuttle bus which goes to the southern end of Kowloon, so it's not terribly inconvenient. I liked the Mongkok area though, it is full of character and you get the feeling that it is a real neighbourhood, not just a big city. There were plenty of nice Chinese restaurants within walking distance, and several convenience stores. I would definitely stay there again if I come back to Hong Kong. Although not a perfect hotel, it is good value for money and had everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: lucy_eddie
Reviews.Content: Staff where lovely, The room was a bit on the small side but comfortable. MRT is about a 10 min walk from the hotel There is a shuttle that leaves the hotel every hour (I think) which is very handy. Buffet breafast has a quite a varity of both western and eastern foods.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and nice hotel for Mong Kok”
Reviews.Author: ETBANGKOK
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 2 nights and was upgraded to a deluxe room which was a nice touch. staff were always helpful in giving directions and room was clean and had modern touches such as IPOD dock and electrical blinds and 2 LCD TV's. Only negative would be the breakfast which would need to be improved if you decide to stay more than 2 nights. especially if you wake up late there is not much left. Overall pleasant stay and enjoyed the hospitality of the hotel. Great location as well if you want to go to HK island.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: rabbitoh08
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights and think its a great hotel! Rooms are very small but are very well designed and has a nice large window. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from olympic mtr and the hotel also offers a free shuttle to mongkok mtr as well as local malls. The hotel is also within walking distance to fast food outlets and hawker/market style eateries. Shopping in the the area is very good, particularly for homewares and local designers. The only thing i didnt like was that the bed was too hard, but then again i got a really good nightly rate through agoda, so i can't really complain. Hotel staff were very helpful and extremely friendly. I would definitely come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Salim S
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very small, hotel is in a great location, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Stay with the Cosmos Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: Agnes W
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room for my friends (a couple) from Germany staying for 4 nights, (28 June to 2 July). The room though compact in size, has all the required facilities, clean, quiet and with the most impressed is the hotel is a non-smoking one. The staff are very helpful and nice manner. The hotel's location is good, it is easily accessible to Olympian City, a large shopping mall, and shuttle service to Langham Place in Mongkok and the Elements at the Kowloon Station. Also there shops, supermakets and fast food shop including McDonald in teh vincity. Anyway I would like to recomend this hotel to visitors looking for a budgeted and boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with smaller rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jin S
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights last june 2012 and the experience was awesome. For the price, ti's really worth it. The quality is 5 star, only the size is a bit too small. The space is just enough (literally), you have space for 2-3 luggages, and enough space for one person to move around the room at a time. Comments; 1. Shuttle : We availed of the free shuttle from the airport upon arrival. It was very punctual all the time (atleast during those times we used it). 2. Room : Upon arrival we were upgraded for free to a superior room. The room was nicely decorated, and well thought of to maximize all the space available. The air conditioning was perfect and the room is squeaky clean. 3. Comfort room : I love the rain shower. the water pressure is really really strong, it's so comfortable. The space is small though just enough for an average person to bathe, with just enough space to put your toiletries. The comfortroom walls were translucent so it's best to be roomies with people you're comfortable with. 4. Beds - it's clean and comfortable, just enough for one person though (single beds), we tried sharing (because we were 3 adults in a room supposedly for 2), so it was a bit comfortable because the beds were smaller than the standard single bed. 5. Breakfast buffet - it's cheap if you choose the one bundled with the room, but i don't think it's enjoyable to eat it daily for more than 2 days because the selections don't change that much. plus there are a lot of bakeries and restaurants around the hotel that you can try. From what i can remember the selections are 2 kinds of fruit, salad, ham, potato wedges, 4 kinds of dimsum, rice, noodles, sausage, egg/omelet, juices, breads, give or take 3 more dishes that vary per day, i couldn't remember the others. 6. location - it's about 10-15 minutes leisure walking from the olympic station mtr. it's not so difficult to get there because more than half of the walk is a covered bridge. Near the mtr olympic station there's the olympic mall, a 3 building mall like glorietta (if you are familiar with the philippines malls). 7, service - the staff is very approachable and responsive about inquiries and requests. they are very polite as opposed to most staff (of restaurants and stores) that we met there throughout our stay. overall, it's really worth it for the price. especially for those people who just plan to shop around hongkong and have a comfortable sleep at night. It's not advisable though for those people who want to stay long in hotel rooms (like those with kids that need space to play around, coz this hotel has everything but space).

Reviews.Title: “. . .just what we were looking for !!”
Reviews.Author: b h
Reviews.Content: Not-too-far taxi ride from airport; very clean room; friendly and helpful staff; neighborhood stores for munchies, fruit, or a quick meal; short and safe walk to the Olympian shopping complex; great shuttle service; competitive price; easy internet booking; quiet ~~ perfect for recovering from jet lag. Thank you !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Julius_Chew
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days 4 nights in this hotel. Hotel staffs are professional, friendly and helpful. Room is clean meet our prior requests for high floor, amazing city view and fast free wifi. Size of the room is small but we knew we were in HongKong. Hotel location is accessible to Olympic and Mongkok station. We shopped almost every night in Mongkok and walked back to hotel around 12am. Numbers of restaurants are around the hotel and had no problem to find and taste local foods. Room rate is reasonable. Definitely choose this hotel again for our next trip to Hong Kong! Only comment: Shuttle bus service is great but number of seats (28) could not satisfy the morning demand from hotel customers.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel w/ easy access to anywhere in HK...”
Reviews.Author: JARVINA
Reviews.Content: ...This hotel is very cumfy & comfortable...its a home away from home....lots of supermarkets, mcdonalds w/in the vicinity....walking distance to mongkok - ladies market, fa yuen street, mtr....the building is like a gem surrounded by stones...hehehe...bottom line, the hotel's design stands out from the crowd w/in this area(belive me 'cause im an Architect by profession...). We'll be back next year....price is good & worth it....book earlier to avail their promo....more power to cosmo...

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kitty-kat-nz
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Cosmo Mongkok between 6-11 June - and absolutely loved it! As everyone before me has said, the service is second to none! Nothing was too much trouble for reception and concierge staff, and housekeeping were prompt at delivering extra pillows etc. When I arrived back home in Oz I realised I had left one of my belongings behind in the room, and after an email to the hotel they located the item and gave me a quote to post the item to me. They charged this to my credit card and emailed me a copy of the receipt - they charged no extra fee for going out of their way - and I received it back in the post within a week of departing! Another example of brilliant service. The rooms were good - the bed is slightly firmer than I personally like, but I've found that at many hotels around the globe. I loved the small mosaic bathroom with rain shower and was happy to see they even equip each room with a travel adaptor - which was lucky as we had forgotten to bring ours! The free shuttle service offered is extreemly handy, although make sure you get to the bus 5-10mins before it leaves as it is first in first served. We found it very easy to get around using the bus service, and the MTR stations were about a 12-15 min away. We used the bus service to head down to TST and catch the ferry to Hong Kong Island, go shopping at Langham Place and get to Kowloon Station for our trip back to the airport. We walked to Olympic Station to look around the shopping mall, and to Mongkok East station for the train to Shenzhen. The rate we booked online included breakfast, and it was a meal I looked forward to each day. There was a mix of cereals (incl yummy bircher), fruits, egg station, local food (incl amazing steamed pork buns) and your standard bacon and hash browns. Overall I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! For the price, location and service this place is a bargain! Cosmo Mongkok is a hidden gem! I would definely stay here again if I return to Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: MickBMarieR
Reviews.Content: Cosmo Hotel was excellent and their shuttle bus service fantastic – saved us heaps on bus fares. The room was small but the décor, service, views and cleanliness made up for size. This was my third trip to Hong Kong, three different hotels all with different good and bad's, but I will definately go back to Cosmo when I holiday in HK again. Thank you to all the staff @ Cosmo - you certainly made my stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but Practical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wp87
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in Cosmo Mongkok last week. The room is compact but the fittings in the room are top notch. Service from the concierge is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, okay location but some hiccups”
Reviews.Author: kittycookie
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very prompt and the receptionist was very polite. Stayed in the suite room which we managed to get for a very reasonable price. Room size was great, and the sofa can be converted to a sofa bed if required. Whilst overall the service was good (bed was promptly cleaned everyday, etc), there were some oddities. I had my dinner in the room one day and the cleaner didn't clear the plates away. I thought this was just an oversight, but the dirty plates remain in the room for 3 days till I told the receptionist about it. Breakfast was okay. There is a McD across the road if you're craving for some fast food. Hotel has shuttle service which leaves promptly at the designated time. If you miss it you can walk to the nearest station which is approx 15 minutes away, an okay distance for me but I was travelling with an elderly and she found the distance to be a bit far. Overall nice place to stay but hope that they sort out the small hiccups.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: aca_08323
Reviews.Content: Booked 3D/2N stay at Cosmo Hotel Mongkok. For the price, I thought it was a pretty good deal. Promo was through the hotel website. They respond promptly to emails which was good. I had a number of requests for the room (on one of the higher floors, facing the McDonald's side, away from the elevators). Got the first 2, but was placed in a room in front of the elevators. We arrived in the morning, but were allowed early check-in (check-in is at 2pm). I'm thinking that's the reason why we got the room in front of the elevator, maybe it was what's readily available when we arrived. Since we were going to spend most of our time outside, figured that it was not a problem. Check-in was quick. There was a bit maintenance work going at the time of our stay, there was a notice of apology in the room about work going until 5 or 6 pm. Again not really a big problem, but there were a bit of banging noises i guess with the repairs. Room was small, bathroom was small, but was just fine, again with the price. Wifi in the room had additional charges so was careful not to use it - there's free wifi in the lobby, so most guests would hang out there. The hotel can add more sofas for sitting there, as it can get crowded. Location was okay, with a number of eateries and restaurants around the neighborhood. Good thing about the hotel shuttle, though try to be early before departure times as it can get filled quick. The Olympic station MTR is a bit of a walk, but not that far. Overall, the hotel was a good base during our stay. It may be a bit out of the way, but it also gives you a local neighborhood feel. The staff were helpful. I would recommend this hotel as value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and good services”
Reviews.Author: ChengL1
Reviews.Content: We have a 3 nights stay in this hotel. The staff is very helpful and friendly. There will always be people there to open the lobby door and also to hold the lift door for you. When we come back from Macau, they give us a family room with handicapped toilet facilities which we don't quite like it. We requested for a change and they attended to our request immediately and managed to make the necessary arrangement for us which we are quite happy with it. On the 2nd day, my dad accidentally pressed on the "do not make up" light and they did not come to do the necessary cleaning for us and we call the housekeeping services and they come to make up the room with out any complain. Their services is really excellent. The only problem the shuttle bus from hotel to mongkok station is always full. If you did not come down early to get a seat, then you will left with no choice but to walk to mongkok station. I may consider to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in hongkong, beyond expectation.”
Reviews.Author: Sweetheart19
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Cosmo Mongkok last week. Booked it through hotel website 30 days in advance so we got a really good rate compared to other hotels in hongkong these days. We booked superior room which also included breakfast in the room rate. Going to the hotel from Kowloon airport express station, you can take hotel free shuttle bus which runs every hour. However, we took taxi cos our arrival time wasn't match with the bus schedule. The taxi costs about 50 HKD, 10 for the luggages I think. Anyway, you can take the bus but make sure you arrive about 10 minutes at the right spot before the schedule time cos the bus will stop only few seconds there. The hotel itself is nice and clean. The lobby is full of bellboys who's willing to help you with your luggages and always open the door for you. Check in process is fast. I already let them know through mail before that we needed late check out as our flight was in the late evening and they responded back quickly that they allow us to check out as late as 4 p.m. This is really a big plus for us. Our superior room is small as expected and looked exactly like the pictures in their website. The bathroom is small but very functional. I really like its rain shower. Not recommended for two people who are not couples though (unless you are really close to each other), as the bathroom is not private at all. The bathroom door cannot be closed tightly and there's a hole between the door and the wall that allow person in bedroom to see person in bathroom. But we have no problem with that and I found it's nice to hear tv while taking bath. :) Breakfast is nice. There's variety of food to choose, congee, dimsum, eggs, bacons, sausages, noodles, breads, salad, cereal and juices. For this price, what can you expect more! The complimentary shuttle bus is quite handy. But beware of the crowd in the morning and late evening. Be sure to arrive at the bus before its departure time about 15 minutes. We once waited for the bus at china hongkong city stop at 10.45 p.m. which is the last round to find out that it was already full from the langham stop. Quite disappointed, but we can always take either taxi or metro back to the hotel. Our stay here was a pleasant experience and we would surely stay here again if we visited hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: viv12_12
Reviews.Content: Although the Olympic station is said to be 4 mins walk from the hotel, we took about 10 mins to walk there. However they provide free shuttle services to Mongkok station and the Kowloon station. The staff there were really friendly and helpful! The hotel replenished the toiletries and bottled water everyday. Moreover the room was really clean. We enjoyed our stay there and will definitely stay in the hotel again the next time we go Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn2012
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy to access. Nice & Clean room. Hotel employee are friendly & helpful. It will be great if there is an outdoor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: The Cosmo Mongkok is a very nice, clean property, and a good value. The lobby is attractive and the rooms, while very small, are functional and stylish. I did notice a musty odor in the room, which seems to be a common complaint. The downside is that the hotel is located in a grimy, out of the way area away from Mongkok. Not a pleasant location for a stroll. The hotel it is close to Olympic MTR station (about 10 minutes walk, not the 4 minute walk advertised) and about 15+ minutes from Mongkok Station. A GPS unit is helpful as it is easy to get lost in the area while walking. I didn't take the shuttle service; it didn't run frequently so it was not a good use of my limited time. Also, while most or all of the staff spoke good English, the area is definitely not frequented by tourists so few people on the nearby stores or restaurants could communicate in English. It is a good choice for budget travellers looking for a nice place for the money, but next time I would stay in a less isolated location. I would pass on the buffet breakfast, as it was quite bland. Food nearby was a lot better. The staff were all pleasant and professional.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to return to!”
Reviews.Author: LKCLPJJB
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. Although the rooms are small (which is expected for a boutique hotel), it is however, adequately designed in comparison to others for a few days stay. For longer trips, we would probably have felt a bit cramped. We booked the superior room, which includes breakfast with a wide selection of food. The hotel is located some 10-15 minutes walk away from Mongkok but the hotel does provide a free shuttle bus service there. if you feel a bit peckish in the early hours, there is the good old Chinese fast food outlet across the road together with a 24 hr Mcdonalds, This is not to mention the numerous convenience stores (7-Eleven and K-Circle) dotted around the area. We were particularly impressed with the customer service, think this makes any stay at any hotel welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: julesandjase
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an easily accessible location in Mongkok. As stated by other reviewers, we found the hotel shuttle to be a good option to get to the MRT, ferry and so on. Some days we opted to walk and this was a simple option. The rooms are well appointed and spotlessly clean. We were a little concerned we were going to be out the "action" in Mongkok but we found that everything we wanted to do was easy due to the transport options and the trade-off was cheaper rates but without compromising quality. We would highly recommend the Cosmos to any traveller to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: christocar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2012 for 5 days. Rooms were really nice and clean, and about the expected size for Hong Kong hotels, which are generally pretty small. The design was nice, and the bathroom rain shower was a great way to cool off after the heat of exploring HK. Had a high-floor room (recommended for getting away from street noise level) with a great view, and could see the bay. The location is pretty good, with 2 MTR stations within easy reach: Mongkok and Olympic. Depending on where you need to go, these stations will both get you there nicely. The free hotel shuttlebus is another handy way to get around - stopping at Mongkok station and finishing at Kowloon station. It goes every hour, but watch out as the morning ones can be pretty full. The only thing that took marks down for me was the lack of free wifi in the rooms, which should be done these days, especially somewhere like HK. The result of this is that people are constantly in the lobby on the free wifi there, and there are rarely seats for you to check your own email. Might be an idea for the hotel to set up more chairs and tables down there, and maybe some complimentary drinks - would make the reception area a lot more welcoming. Staff on reception are pretty helpful, and will help you out with a map of anywhere you need to go. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JaniceIan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4D/3N with my family and we enjoyed our stay here Excellent customer service, good location (a bit far from the MRT Station but they have a shuttle service every hour) The staff is friendly and accommodating, the room is clean (though a bit small) Nice location if you're traveling with kids since there is a playground just beside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: YenH
Reviews.Content: Decent clean rooms and location was excellent. Appreciated the shuttle bus service but was disappointed when it didn't arrive one night as scheduled. Raised a brow when checking out as I was told I will not be given a full refund on my key deposit because I booked for a shuttle pick up service from the airport. I thought I have already paid for it initially with my credit card when I paid for the room (because it shows the total amount of room and transportation on the invoice) but apparently the staff informs me that the amount has not been deducted. I had to rush to the airport then and did not have the time to check my online banking statements to see if this was true. After a long flight home, I went on the internet instantly to check on my credit card statements and yes it is true they didn't deduct the airport transfer. Would have appreciate it if the staffs informed me earlier when I first arrived and that part of my key deposit would be for the transportation payment. Other than this incident I think it is a great convenient hotel. Perhaps they might want to consider changing their sofa's at the hotel lobby as well! It is all sunken in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ANTIFRANK
Reviews.Content: I do not think the previous comments made by Bebe M is fair. Should sufficient research done she will know what she is checking into. My stay at Cosmo Mongkok is not fantastic but certainly not bad. The staff are all very very helpful and obliging. Go all the way to help you. Downside, sewer smell exude out from the plug holes in the bathroom. Thankfully hotel keep the aircondition on to ensure circulation. Just dont switch off the aircondition. Having said that, I stay in room 1705 (corner room) and my friend stayed just next door room 1703 did not seem to have the smell. Despite of the smell, i still enjoyed my stay because the of the friendly service. All the staff that i spoke to speaks perfect english. Front desk manager Augustine was most polite. I think its most value for money for the price i paid.

Reviews.Title: “compact and cute”
Reviews.Author: wellie-shs79
Reviews.Content: as was expected, it's small. but interior very nicely laid out. rain bath enjoyable to a fault (water used 3x my normal shower). enjoyed first two breakfasts but repetitions took its toll. we took advantage of the free shuttle but have to be early because it is often full and it is not peak season yet. maybe should add more runs of the shuttle service to accommodate more! everyone of us impressed and happy. cheaply priced but good service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Angilove
Reviews.Content: I cannot find fault to this hotel. Although rooms are small its very clean just dnt forget to push the button for them to clean up. They change the towels, give extra toiletries and bottle waters everyday. The receptionist speak very good english and i think everyone of them even the bus driver are very helpful and accomodating. Good location too, the olympic station is a 5 min walk. Definitely will go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “they have bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: dorothyingrid
Reviews.Content: the hotel is not really walking distance from olympic station. its quite a long walk. especially when youve got parents who get tired easily. wifi was free only in the lobby. so whenever you want to use it you need to hang around in the lobby. the corridors were very narrow and 2 people cant walk together especially when carrying bags. we stayed in a family quad room and with 2 luggages it wasnt very spacious to walk around in the room. the bathroom was big enough but we wondered why they installed a baby sink. the sink was too small! you can't even put the soap near the tap without it falling. they only had 2 elevators and our room was on the 23rd floor so we always had to wait for a long time for the lift. it was impossible for us to take the stairs going up or down. when we checked out, we asked the bell boy to help us with our bags. it took quite a while for him to come up so we decided to go down on our own with our luggages. we had to wait for the elevator again and that was when the bell boy showed up! we stayed for 2 nights and availed of the 24 hours check in/check out which was very good even if we came later than the time we stated on the check in form. breakfast was ok. not that many selections though. and ive noticed that the omelette chef doesnt really stay in his station. a couple of times i had to wait for him to come out to his station. on our last day in hong kong, 3 of us felt that our legs were itchy. my sister got 44 insect bites on one leg and i dont know how much more on the other leg. i myself got 29 bites on both legs. and we dont know where they came from. we searched the web and realised we got bed bugs bites!!!!!!!!!!!! seriously?! why do they have bed bugs in the hotel. its not a very pleasant experience! up till now we still have the bite marks on our legs. boooo!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Irenelpl
Reviews.Content: The Cosmo hotel overall is good but the only things that very bad is the breakfast , the cleanlier of the food was bad, we found the cockroach on the cheese n still moving, that was really disgusting. we did complained to the staff, bit noting much they can do, besides, the eggs chef 's attitude also bad n always show his sour face.

Reviews.Title: “how about NO STAR”
Reviews.Author: Bebe M
Reviews.Content: Seriously.... all peoples gave this hotel 4stars+???? are you guys making joke or WHAT!!! i did reach on tripadvisor then book this hotel. i saw this hotel got very good comments and i spent last 2 night in hong kong stay in this hotel! BUT.................... but we had very terrible time in this hotel!!! All is joke and HUGE time mistake :( why i chose this hotel, because we stayed in hong kong almost 12 nights. we spent almost 10nights stay in the other hotel before. then we're change this hotel. WHY..... because we did like the 24hours-in service and other reason is close to my mom's house. that why we stay there. we paid for almost USD$99+ /per night, see what i had for our 2nights. 1) We're required what we wanted (we wants highest level and non smoking) before we check in this hotel. but they did make the mistakes and we spent around 20+mins for check-in at the poor renovations lobby...... are you SERIOUSLY???? 2) The room was smaller i never see in Hong Kong. poor toilet with the weak rush, the shower room is super smaller and the shower room floor is broken. (please see the pictures) when i called them ask about the shower room floor, they're answer is it's the style...... WHAT!!!! also the chair got some dirty markn and toilet floor got some dirty mark :( 3) Most important is our room got some bugs. something were bite us and itchy all night long (please see the pictures) they did changed our room, but they keep to said before a guest stay in that room a long time, never have that happen..... so what???? he sounds like we laid or what is the service???? 4) we call the housekeeper to ordered extra pillows, few mins after..... a man ring my door and i open it. he didnt say anything, go straight in my room to set up the pillows. my hubby was on bed and the room is small. a man not gentle to set the pillows on bed..... are you guys seriously???? 5) those towels isnt not clean and got a hole :'( 6) We did reach on tripadavisor and this hotel got many good comments, also know got many peoples comments talked about the hotel room is small. we know it!!!! OK, we're confused and i called them to ask about the room type's questions, like the room is called Superior room (we know they have 5 different type of room. but the Superior and CosMorganic is same size 20 square meters)..... so what is the different???? but they never answer my questions and always said the room can stay/fix 2 persons. Sighs....... the staff cant speak English really well!!!! so we paid Superior room, but the room still way too small and like the hotel reply comment said if pay USD$200+ for the Suite Air, be honest we wont choice this hotel...... 7) we paid the room included buffet buffet! they close before 10am..... also the buffet breakfast is weak. the waiters doesn't care refill the food and the orange drink was empty, no one to refill until i need stand out there to ask them please to refill it...... no one care about the guests, they have someone cook omelette, but never have a person work there and cook for the guest. 8) they have shuttle bus, but is not every time, is a hour each bus..... it not really work for us!!!! 9) it is way far away go to ladies market and walk around 20 mins go to Mongkok. if you like to walk.... go ahead!!! 10) At the night time and mid-night, lobby always have many chinese peoples/guests, sit in the small lobby.... no idea for that at mid-night time!!! 11) One more thing, we were checking out and the give us a bill, charge us HKD$55 local call....... WHAT THE HECK!!!! seriously???? we never stay in hong kong's hotel, they charge the local call service. this hotel charge HKD$5 each call!!!! Hell Nooooo, and no one tell me that!!! i told her.... where is the manege. it was bad time for us.... i wont go this hotel again!!! we did have a great time in hong kong before until we stay in this hotel...... ugly room with very bad hotel service, it is a bad time & so so so Terrible!!!! i need to share with you all..... this is not a hotel!!!! is a Boutique Hotel. dont make the name to fool you!!! MUST TO CHECK UR BOOKING" POLICY..... it not all reservation has free cancel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Ana V
Reviews.Content: 1. Breakfast was just okay. Maybe next time they would offer more variety (sausages were served everyday), 2. Rooms were clean, housekeeping made sure everything was spic and span. Free water was replenished daily. 3. It's our first time to stay in that area of Hong Kong and we didn't have a hard time navigating. Mtr was near enough, lots of cabs, the shuttle bus stops at 3 convenient locations, we discovered new malls, and it was easier getting to Disneyland. 4. There are lots of restaurants, convenience stores, a bakery, a mini grocery across the street. 5. Staff were helpful, specially the shuttle bus drivers. 6. Wifi connection was great in the rooms, dining area and lobby; you could even access it from inside the bus, while waiting to leave. 7. Elevators were fast enough, and when when they were full, we were directed to the service elevator. 8. Booked through the website and customer service was commendable, they answered ALL my emails really quick, they tried to accommodate our requests, sent a welcome email. 9. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “our honeymoon trip in hongkong”
Reviews.Author: Donramon01
Reviews.Content: we had a great time here in hongkong! food, shopping area was pretty good! we had a good stay also on our hotel, we had a nice room and the service was pretty awesome! even the Guest Service Manager Mr. Yannick Lau assist me himself with the things i need to print for our check in luggage on our way home.. such a great guy! hope to come back soon here in hongkong, and i will make sure i will be back in the same hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Arlene M
Reviews.Content: Location and Transport: I checked out Transport Department site of Hong Kong to look for a bus that will take me from Olympic Station to the Hotel (31B) but I never actually boarded it because the station is close to the hotel. The distance is really walkable to think that I'm not fond of walking. If you didn't catch the free coach from the hotel and you're going to Tsim Sha Tsui, there's a minibus in Chui Wui Street that would take you directly to Canton Road (and back to the hotel) for less than HKD5. We never really needed internet since we bought a sim with internet access (with an app that helps us which route to take). I'm sure there's also one for mongkok. There's also a bus in Plaza Hollywood (near Nan Lian Garden) that stops at this hotel. Room: Don't expect a lot regarding the size(It's Hong Kong and you'll have to pay at least thrice as much to get twice the room size in other hotel) but we didn't have any problem with it. Our luggage fits comfortably in the window sill. We really appreciate that after a long day of traveling, a wonderful lobby, a clean room and nice view welcomed us. The towels and complimentary water are replaced everyday. There's a socket converter available in the drawer that we used to charge our cellphones. It's free to use but there's a HKD20 fee if you decide to bring it with you. We didn't hear noise in our floor even if we're near the elevator. Service: The staff are really helpful when we arrived. They speak english fluently and clears it out for me when they've noticed that I didn't understand them. The supervisor (sorry i forgot here name) was really nice to warned us that there will be a noise in the 16th floor until 6pm because of the on-going construction. But we usually come home after 9pm. The check-in and check out was a breeze. Food: Kinda bland. I wish they offer more western choices which I am used to. I found myself eating sausages and hash browns/potato wedges for my 2 day stay. My friend who was with me enjoyed the dimsum/dumplings they've offered. I think this is an area of improvement. Then again it's free. I'll definitely book this hotel again the next time I'm in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Will definitely return again.”
Reviews.Author: Teosher
Reviews.Content: Excellent service provided by the hotel staff. I want to compliment the staff at conceige by the name of Cathy Cheung. She speaks great English and mandarin which makes communication so much easy. She accommodated to our room request as well. I like the location as it's near to eateries with reasonable prices. There is a 24 HR Mac opposite the hotel. There is a nice dessert shop called Noble nearby that opens till 1am. Many restaurants close at 12am so take note to go there by 11pm if u want to have a meal. The hotel staff are always ready to open doors for us. One even help us to flag a taxi n inform the driver where to bring us. Hotel is near to Olyimpian city which has like suntec city of spore. I saw food republic food court there. There are restaurants too. Free shuttle service available every hour. Overall I will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service albeit small-sized room”
Reviews.Author: thegohtravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cosmo Mongkok in February 2012. From the airport, i took the airport express (i was using Octopus Card, just board it when it arrives, payment of fare is only made when arrived at destination) to Tsing Yi, where i followed the signage and took the MTR to Olympic, everything is in the same building. Upon reaching Olympic, look for the board that shows directions to various places, look for Cosmo Mongkok, this should lead you to a covered walkway which branches out to a T junction, with a tall building in front of you, staircase to bus terminal on your left and walkway to a building on your right. Walk down the ramp beside the staircase on your left and walk along the covered walkway. Walk straight till the end of the walkway, it should be a 5-10min walk, you will find yourself facing a staircase down to the road level in front of you, on your right should be an overhead bridge. Cross the overhead bridge and take the lift/staircase to the road level. Walk right ahead after coming out of the lift/ from stairs and turn right into the first street. Walk straight till you see McDonalds and right across the road from McDonalds is Cosmo Mongkok. The whole walk takes around 15min. The hotel mentioned that the walk should be just around 5-7min, it is actually true as there is a shortcut, which is to cut across the tall building near Olympics. But this is only viable during the business hour of the building. Service provided by the front desk counter and the bellboys was exemplary. The bellboy literally glided across the lobby just to make sure that he got hold of my luggage! There was a queue at the counters when i arrived for check-in, but the manager-in-charge attended to me by asking for my passport and confirmation letter while i was still in the queue, hence, when it was my turn, the key was ready and all they need was my signature. No time wasted! However, i was rather disappointed when i entered the room (Room Comfort) as it was really small, but given that it is Hong Kong, it was also somewhat expected. The sound proofing in the room was not good, as i was awakened by children running along the corridor and the noise generated. This, however, did not pose as a big issue to me. There is a shuttle bus service provided by the hotel, but it is always full. I used the map printed at the back of the card slot and made my way to Mongkok by foot. It was a 15-20min walk, but i enjoyed it as i got to pass by the markets, streets and the shops that the locals frequent. I even bought pork ribs from the market area for breakfast, it was delicious and cheap! For travellers travelling with family members or friends, the bathroom may not provide enough privacy as there will be a 5cm gap between the sliding door and the partially frosted glass wall of the bathroom even if the door is completely closed. To make things worse, the room is lined with mirrors, which allows one to see around blind corners. On the other hand, the glass wall of the bathroom, which is not frosted at the top and bottom, should not pose as a problem while one is showering as the steam from the shower will cloud out the non-frosted parts. I did not experience any long wait for the lift. I made use of the third lift on the lift as well, which speed up the waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Cute & stylish”
Reviews.Author: Layla M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there on the 26th of May for 2 nights, we landed in Hong Kong around 9am and got to the hotel in about 30mins. The hotel on the outside doesn't look to clever, but as soon as you walk into it, its simply beautiful! The check in time is at 2 so we had over 4 hours to spend doing nothing, but they offered us a room to have over night with a big price-tag of 660 Hong Kong dollars on top of our paid bill, we declined the offer and walked around our surroundings for a while. The streets surrounding the hotel are not very nice to look at and the smell was terrible! We finally managed to pop in to our hotel room about 1, it was beautiful, we paid for a superior room and I'm glad that we did, the views were stunning! The room itself was very stylish and modern, it was small but ideal and cute for us. The room was very clean and tidy and the staff were very helpful and brought all of our bags in and out of the room, the bed was very comfortable and the shower was amazing! it's just what you need after a long flight! We ate at the hotel twice, which was a nice little Italian place on the 1st floor, the food was decently priced, but the drinks were quite expensive, we also used the gym, it was very small but clean and modern and good to kill some time. overall I would stay at this hotel again and I would love to see a few more sights of Hong Kong as it was a beautiful place but not including the terrible smells!! i hope this information helped :)

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Claudia K
Reviews.Content: My trip to HK was 4/21 to 5/6, stayed @ Cosmo from 4/21 to 5/3 & moved to a 4-star TST hotel for the remaining days. The stay @ Cosmo was super pleasant - extremely helpful and friendly staff from front desk all the way to housekeeping service. The room (on 16th floor )was very clean (although bit small but space efficiently used) and modern, with huge window & electronic blinds. Hotel located just 10 mins walking distance away from Mongkok MTR station. Bonus is free wi-fi service in lobby. Honestly, if comparing Cosmo w/ the other 4-star TST hotel I stayed in, I would definitely recommend Cosmo in all aspects!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! Friendly Staffs, Nice Location, Clean Room and free shuttle bus”
Reviews.Author: Aris C
Reviews.Content: We were went to Hong Kong on 23-25 May 2012 for little trip with my mom, my sister and my boyfriend. We booked 2 rooms - family and standard room. The family room is really nice - queen size bed and 2 twin beds and the bathroom is big size with all equipment e.g. iPod docking, LCD TV, microwave, welcome fruit. But the standard room are very small but yet well layout. It's only fit for people who plan to stay out most of the day and come back to sleep. If you plan to stay and chill in the room, this room type is not recommended. The staffs are very friendly. Breakfast are little bit boring with not much menu. The hotel has free shuttle bus to MTR Mongkok, Tshim sha sui and Kowloon airport express but depart every hour. So, you have to plan the time quite good otherwise you will have to wait.
