The hotel locate opposite McDonald's and local restaurant. We tried to go for local restaurant there as well they have english menu and taste good but they speak very little english. The hotel can walk from MTR Olympic station and take about 5 mins. Overall, we had a fun shopping time in Hong Kong and will come back to stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Liz T
Reviews.Content: My family of husband, 2 adult children and myself stayed for 3 nights in March 2012. We enjoyed everything about our stay. The rooms are small (this is Hong Kong after all) but very compact and great use of available space. Very clean. My daughter and I shared a twin room and enjoyed the relative roominess of the ensuite (nice big shower cubicle, good lighting), and the view of the city skyline from the large window. Desk staff were very accomodating and friendly; the shuttle bus is a brilliant idea; the greeting by the concierge was really appreciated and made us feel very welcome. The foyer is spacious, with lots of seating and space for luggage. The location is excellent - close to transport , and lots of eating options nearby. We'd recommend it to anybody. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: bangkokreviewer
Reviews.Content: Paid 75 USD per nite for this hotel. Great solid value. New hotel. (1) I wiped everything down with a disinfectant towelettes and everything came out spotless so I know the room was clean. (2) Good basis channels on TV as well. (3) Free bottled water and the bathroom was small but really clean also. (4) Very helpful staff. In terms of getting to the hotel from the airport, cheapest way is the E21 bus and getting off at the college on Cherry Street - it is hard to figure out the stop if you don't speak cantonese - but i got lucky and there was someone on the bus who spoke english. It took an hour but costs only 13HKD. Some minor cons: (1) 10 minutes at least from nearest subway stop. Not centrally located tourist area but more local - with Mcdonald's and 7-11 nearby. (2) free wifi only in the lobby - appreciated the plug transformer in the room which allowed u to use us plugs in honking - that was a nice touch. (3) small reception desk Overall would recommend highly - especially at under 100 usd.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minnie5757
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Cosmo with my husband and was very pleased with the hotel. Staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. Olympic mtr is only a short walk away so made it very easy to get about. Rooms were clean smart and a great view out of the window. Loved waking each morning and pressing the button for the electric blind to get a great early morning view. Breakfast was good and once again staff good. Only thing that stopped me giving it a five rating is the fact that there is insufficient lifts and at times the wait was long. Will definately be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nicely designed room”
Reviews.Author: Dewenn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Cosmo for 3 nights. With the value, the comfort room considered spacious compared to some other hotels in Kowloon. The decor was excellently done up, making use of every corner of the room to place the essential furniture and fittings for hotel guest's use. The staff's service was excellent especially the bell boy. He greeted us and answered us patiently if we've any questions. Many eateries are also available near the hotel. Mongkok station is about 15mins walk to the hotel. As we were not very familar with the streets in Mongkok, we took quite some time to walk back to the hotel. Although free shuttle bus is provided by the hotel to and fro the mongkok station at an hour interval, the bus will go to other locations (Tim sha shui & kowloon) before back to hotel. Unless the guests do not mind the half an hour (est. if there's no traffic) ride back to the hotel, would suggest to spend about HK$20 on taxi for a 5 mins ride instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people”
Reviews.Author: Dennis K
Reviews.Content: Service: Staff is extremely courteous, opening doors, smiling and answering any questions. Room: Room was small but hey it's Hong Kong. The room was decently clean but the carpet was slightly stained due to the fact they put in residential carpet instead of commercial hotel carpet. I am in the flooring business. Ceramic tile in shower had a little mineral build up and some stains. Bed and pillows were nice and firm. Plenty of tv stations to watch on lcd tv. Mini fridge to store some beer and water. Small safe in room to secure valuables. You get two bottles of water free everyday. The only thing that bugged me was the bathroom is built into the room with frosted glass. Air conditioning unit was buggy the entire time I stayed at the hotel. They sent an engineer to fix the unit and got rid of smell coming out of the unit but control unit would make this buzzing sound at random times. Kind of weird when your just with your mom. Location: It's a bit of a walk to Mongkok station mtr but they have a shuttle bus that leaves every hour that's goes to langham place then to tsim sha tsui then to Kowloon station then back to hotel. My mom couldn't do the walk so we cabbed it all over the place. Thank god cabs are cheap in hong kong. Wifi is free in the lobby or its 15 us dollars a day in your room. Fine hotel if you can make the walk to the mtr station but not the best for older people who do not walk well. 95 us dollars a day is a great value for hong kong. I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just a tad small...”
Reviews.Author: linneristic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in May 2012. Service: Service was very good. I received help immediately from the concierge and the bellboy. We wanted to try some of the more 'local' dishes around the area and asked the staff at the lobby for recommendation and they weren't wrong. Excellent "youtiao" for breakfast at a HK style cafe and restaurant. The name escapes me but ask the staff and they should be able to direct you. Location: Free shuttle bus that go to Langham Place and other malls or brief walk to Langham Place and Ladies Market. Not too bad! Rooms: The washrooms are slightly see through - kind of awkward when travelling with your parents! The washroom partition are 'frosted' so you can't see every detail of the person and what they are doing in the washroom BUT you can definitely see their shadow. If you are uncomfortable with that then maybe this is not the best hotel for you. The room is VERY small. It's not "uncomfortable" but definitely small. I don't think it could have gotten any smaller. This also makes it awkward, when you are trying not to see what the other person is doing in the washroom... Free WIFI in the lobby. There is WIFI in the rooms but you have to pay. Overall: For the price and location, it was not bad... Depending on how many people I travel with next, I may stay at this location again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mem0wy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a few of my university friends and we really enjoyed the stay here. The rooms are very comfortable and especially the service is great. I unfortunately got some of my property stolen in Hong Kong and the hotel service did everything to support me and get the case reported to the police (thank you very much Yannick Lau!). The hotel is also very close to the downtown area and just a few minutes away to walk to the great night market! If you look for a affordable and comfortable place to stay in HK, go to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Next time you check in, ask their staff to go through all the items in the room, or else...”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night this past week while on a business trip to Hong Kong. The location is ok; close to Olympic station and even though there was some renovation going on, the lobby was still clean and tidy. Couldn't say the same for the room as the bathroom wasn't what I would consider sanitary or properly cleaned as there was some rusty watermarks on the bottom part of the toilet. Being a frequent business traveler to HK and China, I bring my own outlet adapters just in case there isn't a compatible outlet in the room or I don't want to go through the hassle of borrowing one from the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised that they had one included in the room and understood perfectly that they had a noticed taped to the adapter saying that if you took it, you would have to pay HKD$20 (or something) for it. I used it and left it on the outlet knowing that the hotel staff would check for it and it would be easier for them to see the item right there. The bed was comfortable and the AC wasn't too loud that one couldn't fall asleep. But around midnight there was this smell of Durian fruit coming from the AC and boy it was annoying. I didn't bother calling the front desk though because I was very sleepy and once I fell asleep, I didn't notice the pungent scent as much. On the small desk they had two bottles of water, complimentary, but I didn't drink them as I brought my own. And then there was the culprit which leads to the review title. It was a small can of Pringles chips. I didn't even bother to touch it as 1) I bring my own snacks, some soda crackers on all my trips, and 2) I know that these items always cost a fortune and of course, there was a small yellow post-it that said HKD$20. The next morning, I ate some crackers and got ready to check out; I planned to have breakfast at the McD's across the street. During checkout, the receptionist (polite young lady) asked me to wait while they checked the room. No problem, but then I overhead the conversation coming from the walkie-talkie (I'm a native speaker of Mandarin and understand some Cantonese). The staff that checked the room said I opened the can of chips and ate just a little, not all of it, just a little. The receptionist said that I ate the chips and wanted me to pay. I was very unhappy. I didn't eat it, didn't even touch it and told them so. But they said I did and wanted me to pay. I asked the receptionist to call the staff down or either I could go upstairs and rebuff their accusation. I further explained, that if I were to eat that can of chips, given the exorbitant price, I would darn well finish it and take the can as a souvenir. In the end, after much arguing, the receptionist said it was ok. As I was quite pissed then, I told her that it is very unwise to lose a customer over a can of chips, and that it precisely what they have done. Next time I'm traveling to HK, I will be sure to avoid Cosmo Mong Kok, and their sister hotels Comso Hotel HK and Cosmopolitan Hotel HK. I will also advise any travelers that if you're staying at these hotels, when you're checking into your room, have a hotel staff go through all the stuff in the room with you using a checklist and note that items such as towels, hangers, whatever drinks are in the fridge, snacks and bottled waters that are out in the open are there/unused! Because you never know! If there is something missing in the room that you don't know of, like an electrical outlet adapter that was supposed to be there but wasn't, or an empty soda can in the fridge that you didn't even bother opening, and if it's your bad luck that the person who stayed in the room before you twisted open a non-complimentary bottle of water but didn't drink any of it, when you check out, they'll accuse you of eating/drinking/taking those and charge you for it!

Reviews.Title: “Recomended”
Reviews.Author: Corey C
Reviews.Content: Staying at the cosmo hotel was more than amazing the service was excellent and all staff more than willing to help out in some kind of way..there is a gym that provied everything needed, all rooms provide air-con at 10 degrees witch you deffently need and want the beds are suprizingly comfy, super amazing shower with megga size head never running out of hot water. Would deffently recomend this hotel i give it 4 star xxxx Any enquires contact number Yannick Lau 88 tai kok tsui road, kowloon, hong kong D:852 3987 2124 F:852 3987 2299 email: gsm@cosmomongkok.com.hk

Reviews.Title: “"Highly Recommended"”
Reviews.Author: Stripey7
Reviews.Content: After a fair bit of research on the net and seeing mostly good reviews on TripAdvisor I chose to book the Cosmo for my wife and I's 4 night stay in Hong Kong. Booking via the hotels own website meant I could pay with my debit card (a lot of the other booking sites only allow credit cards) and avail to several promos they were offering. The free breakfast that was part of the superior room package was great, a big selection to suit all tastes and a perfect start to a days sightseeing! I e-mailed them in advance, requesting a room on a high floor with views of the City, 26th floor was perfect! We weren't going to be checking in till 7 or 8pm so again, an e-mail to the Cosmo gained us a later than normal check-out time when we were eventually leaving. A lot of these offers only come with booking through the official hotel website, best prices there too. The room (superior) was wonderful, not massive but well designed making full use of the mirrors to give the impression of more space. All the staff that we came across were more than helpful and very friendly. As my title says "highly recommended"!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Taylor M
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the Cosmo! The breakfast in the morning was great and the room was very modern. The staff were friendly and helpful with any questions we had about the city. They even had a free shuttle that takes you to different areas in kowloon. It's walking distance to the ladies market where they sell a variety of different products such as purses, t-shirts and souvenirs. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Internet policies”
Reviews.Author: windyhabour
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in March at hotel web site for stay in May for 4 nights & payed quite a high rate as compared to current rates.To add insult to injury was told because I did not book in May had to pay for internet in Room when most hotels in HK offer free internet in rooms.Can anyone make sense of this hotels internet policy.Rooms tiny & out of the way location long walk to Mongkok area.For same price there are better alternatives.Will not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Over-Priced and Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Tom_U427
Reviews.Content: I was in China and needed a hotel in Hong Kong for a couple days while we awaited our flight back to USA. I used the hotel computer and went on Asia Rooms site. Of course, Hong Kong hotels can be pricey, and I wanted something reasonably priced, yet nice. The Cosmo Hotel in Kowloon was rated by Asia Rooms as being 4-Star. So I booked it for 3 nights at HKD 2,244. This worked out to about USD $96 per night. We arrived there by taxi and the desk clerk immediately pushed us to take an "Executive Upgrade" that was supposed to include a much nicer room and a grand breakfast buffet. That cost me an extra HKD 330 per night, or about USD $42. We got up to the room and it was the smallest hotel room I've seen in 20 years. Basically, you open the door and there is the bed. No closet and no shelf for suitcases. Small stand-up shower that got the sink area wet when you used it. The next morning we went downstairs for breakfast, and it was a small, mostly Asian food buffet. I ate cold cereal most mornings, except once when I saw the cook and asked for scrambled eggs. The hotel location in Mongkok, Kowloon, is far away from any tourist destination and too far to walk to the metro. The hotel did have a shuttle bus, but it did not travel on a convenient schedule and took you on an almost hour-long tour of Kowloon. The restaurant did have good Italian style food, but it was expensive - I paid about USD $70 for dinner for two, plus a glass of wine - we didn't go back. There is no bar, no swimming pool (but a small gym), no free Internet computer (wi-fi is free in the room if you bring a laptop). In other words, I don't understand how they can claim a 4-Star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Cosmo.”
Reviews.Author: SoMuchFun10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cosmo first week of April 2012. Liked that it was modern, the staff were very friendly, and it was very clean. The rooms unfortunately were very small, we upgraded from a standard room to an executive room but the only difference was the view but it did include breakfast. The location was okay, you will need to take a taxi to the harbour area but luckily taxis are quite easy to find and inexpensive. You are close to local restaurants and convenience stores, so that was nice. Overall, it is a nice hotel and suited our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: talonglang
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! I think this is the most worth it hotel I have ever stayed in Hong Kong. We got the early bird rate and got our rooms at a cheaper rate. A few days before our scheduled check in, I already received an e-mail from them giving us a weather update and asking for confirmation of our check in time. I got several concerns and they responded swiftly and granted my request for a double bed. When we got to the hotel at around 8 a.m. , we were fortunate that we were allowed to check in early as there was already a room available. I loved the scent of the hotel in the lobby. When we got to the room, we were amazed by the glass wall with view. The curtains were electronic and provided a good shade if you want your room to be dark. The bed and pillows were comfortable and clean. The bathroom was small but very strategically located that moving around does not seem to be a problem. The water pressure and heater were also working great! The airconditioner and tv in the room were also working well! But I must say the aisle and area for elevators are so cold. The best feature of the hotel for me is its free shuttle service to and from the Kowloon Station (very convenient transpo to and from the airport), Tsim Sha Tsui area (China Ferry Terminal) and Mong Kok Station (Drop off at Langham Place). Of course you have to be on time, or better be there ten minutes before the scheduled time of the shuttle to make sure you don’t miss it. The shuttle arrives on the drop off points on the dot or earlier. The staff and service should be well commended because they make sure their guests feel special and taken care of. Also, the hotel is very conveniently located in front of Mcdonalds and a lot of other good places to eat. We ate at Dumpling Kitchen across Tai Kok Tsui Road and a very busy Chinese restaurant nearby. Both restaurants served great dumplings and Chinese food, very tasty and authentic!

Reviews.Title: “why coSmO !”
Reviews.Author: Rawincan
Reviews.Content: overall, we are very impressed with this hotel and need to special thanks to 3 of them C = Cost is so good and very reasonable room is very clean and comfortable O = Over expectation and we had a very pleasant stay here S = Super convenience Mcdonald opposite and 7-11 nearby, Olympic MTR is reachable and can connect to major destinations like Ngong Ping, Disney land, central, HK island (no need to jump and change a lot) and if you need to go to mongkok, tsimsajui, yaumatei they have free shuttle service which super convenince only 10 mins M = Meet and greet by hotel management Mr. Andrew Lee, director of room. We need to thank you because he took a special care to us and very helpful for anything we need. Yannick, the manager is very nice because he ask us a feedback which we feel he care about our staying and Ray, is a very helpful and always smile! O = Only this one which we will return and will recommend to any people which we know Thank you very much indeed. Rawin + Tuangporn

Reviews.Title: “comment on our stay in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: mk p
Reviews.Content: stay 2 night in the hotel. The staffs are friendly and helpful during our stay here. The services manager is especially is very friendly, he enquired of our needs and our comfort in the hotel. It is noticed that there are not enough seats in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “worth the value”
Reviews.Author: ivy-limps
Reviews.Content: my stay in this hotel was pleasant. Staffs are helpful and attentive at all times. Surrounding by nice HK foods, hence you dont need to waste time to search for those famous/ commercialized restaurant which is packed with people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: BayviewBeachResortPg
Reviews.Content: I chose Cosmo because of its location to eateries together with the convenient free shuttle bus service provided. Overall staff service was very good from arrival to departure. Conceirge staff always there to provide every assistance whenever they see guests going in and out of front door espeacially to old people. Housekeeping maid was friendly and always greet guest every morning with a smile and seems to be very happy working. Assistant Front Office Manager Mr. Augustine Cheung deserve to be commented for leading his whole team that gives a good first impression of the hotel when a guest checks-in until checking-out. I would definitely recommend Cosmo to anyone who is looking for a hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Fabian S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very clean and although the rooms are not very big (which is absolutley normal in China) the price-quality ratio is very good. During my stay I had an accident and had to get to the hospital. The staff was very helpful and organized a cab immediately (special thanks to Yannick again). I can only recommend the hotel not at least for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: dcnetworks
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Cosmo Hotel Mongkok for 10 nights. Cosmo Hotel Mongkok is located in Tai Kok Tsui in Kowloon, Hong Kong. You can take a short cab ride from the Kowloon Airport Express Station to the hotel. The approx. cab cost from the station to the hotel is only 5 USD or $40 HKD. Be advised the hotel also offers a free shuttle back to the Kowloon Airport Express Station (this is something good to know). If you need to catch the MTR (subway), you have to walk approximately 10 mins to Mongkok or take a 3 USD cab ride to Mongkok. It can get a bit annoying for some people but I had no problem with it. Upon arrival you will encounter a group of English speaking young staff at check-in. I booked my room directly from the hotel's website and they currently offer a very reasonable 30% discount if you book 30 days in advance. On my first night, I got a free upgrade to one of their suites. The suite is basically double the size of a regular room. After one night, I moved to one of their regular rooms which is ok for one person but I think it could be a little tight for a couple to share. The bed in the suite is much more comfortable than the regular room for sure. After staying in the regular room for one night, I inquired about upgrading my regular room to the suite. The cost according to the check-in staff was $600 HKD a night or approx. $80 a night (the upgrade does include FREE in-room WIFI and free breakfast). I was on vacation so why not? It is worth mentioning that I was only given 1 breakfast ticket per day when their hotel website said the each upgrade includes 2 breakfast tickets. When I inquired about it, I was told my room upgrade is only eligible for 1 breakfast ticket which I thought was odd. Oh well. As mentioned by the other reviewers, there's FREE WIFI in the lobby but it does get crowded at times. The small gym in the hotel is ok...I used it twice. There is no swimming pool in the hotel but there is a prepared food center/market/community center located directly across the street from the hotel and if you have an Octopus card, you can use the in-door community pool for only $2.50 USD. I used the pool one afternoon it was raining outside and it was actually pretty good. Would I stay at the Cosmo Hotel Mongkok again? The answer is YES. If you are looking for a clean, safe, and viable 3 stars hotel located near Mongkok then the Cosmo Hotel Mongkok is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons to consider”
Reviews.Author: cali118
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cosmo Mongkok 22-24 April 2012. Pros : Booking is easy. Personal emails to welcome before arrival. Fast reply to enquiries Limo serives very professional. Well arranged. Arrival , greated by very helpful bell boy. Check in easy . And HK visitor map provided! Room is clean. I stayed in Suite Air Room. Spacious * compared to other HK hotel rooms (typically very small), fruit platter with good selection of fruits Free shuttle bus * not very frequent , first come first serve Bell boy very very helpful. Instally help with luggage even thouI only had 1 hand carry bag. Spacious bathroom Quiet and comfy stay at night - good quality bedlinen Check out fast and easy Cons Location! Location ! Location! not a very centrally located hotel , far from attractions Far from MRT , walk is 10 mins ( I admit I walk very slowly) Breakfast needs a lot improvement. Pricy yet limited selection of food and drinks, not tasty The lobby always crowded with guests , because of the free wifi there Limited interesting shops / tourist attractions around the hotel, there is McDonald's and 7-eleven opposite the hotel. No free mineral water in the room Room service somehow not very personalised eg 2 towels for 3 guests etc

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: susupoohbear
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very friendly and informative. Rooms are fairly small, but that's standard in HK. The rooms are modern and clean, with very comfy bed after an exhasting day out. There is free wifi at the hotel lobby and free land line internet for your laptop. However be warned it can get pretty crowded during the late hours at the lobby for wifi. There is a Mcdonalds across the hotel and few stores down a convenient store for any of your daily needs. The location of the hotel is great. Everything is at walking distance to the buzz of HK, however the hotel is not located in the heart of a busy street that you are swamped by people when you walk down. The main transportation for many tourist will be the MTR ( subway ) which is walking distance, but if your feeling lazy you can also take the hotel free shuttle which can take you to one also. The shuttle also does pick up at at certain locations; ask front desk for shuttle schedule. I had booked this hotel few month in advance and the hotel offered 30% off on bookings made 30 days before check in date. All in all i would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: Gina2611_12
Reviews.Content: The attention to detail at the Hotel Cosmo was fantastic. Sanny greats you at the door everyday with a smile and great advice. All the hotel staff were so attentive. The door is always opened for you, umbrellas given out and good advice to any question you may have. We stayed with a 1 year old and we had a great family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Nibicat
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, lovely room, though quite small if you would be in the room with more than one person, but you are not there anyway, just to sleep:-) Really good beds and shower. Friendly people at reception. Free shuttle is convenient as well. Nearest MTR is about 7 minute walk away (Olympic). This hotel was cheaper than other 4 star hotels in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Littlin
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend & I looked for weeks to find decent accommodation in Hong Kong and eventually we come across the Cosmo Hotel. What you see is what you get, we were on the 14th floor and had a great view, rooms were very modern, clean, nice bathroom, beds were extremely comfortable just want you need after walking around all day :-) The rooms were quite small but overall we were both very happy. I'll be honest we didn't have a lot to do with the staff however when we needed there help about taxis, shuttle bus, checking in they were very helpful. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus which we thought was brilliant, it takes you to various places and cuts out a lot of walking :-) It leaves every half an hour on the dot so make sure you don't miss it :-) . The hotel is in a great location, as you know Hong Kong is such a busy place and even when you walk outside the hotel at 8am in the morning you just get this buzz. Opposite the hotel is a McDonalds and the most fantastic Bakery which you have to try. Everything is within walking distance, 10-15 minutes your in Mongkok shopping area, Ladies Market which you have to go to but make sure you haggle a good price, my boyfriend got so good at it that half the time we got our goods for quarter of the price. The MTR station is about a 10 min walk, the MTR is very easy to use, so convenient, it really does take you from A-B within minutes, very clean. If your in HK for a few days make sure you get an Octopuss card its a lot cheaper and hell of a lot easier, when you have used your last train for your trip take your card back to the help desk and they will give you some money back (cant remember exactly how much). Overall HK is one of the best places I have ever been too, I would jump back on a plane today if I could and I would definitely stay in this hotel again. One thing we loved about this hotel is that its not in the tourist area of Hong Kong which is great because you get to see HK for what it really is, the locals, their way of living, their culture, the food but you do have the option to hop on to the MTR and visit all the touristic areas and you would be there within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great family room”
Reviews.Author: Rajiv_pune27
Reviews.Content: In HK it's difficult to find good hotels that accommodate a family of 4. Cosmo's quad room met our requirement perfectly. The room was spacious, clean and beds were comfortable. It helps that a McDonalds is just opposite the hotel. Hotel runs a shuttle service which is more useful for going to TST rather than for coming back Overall it was a comfortable and value for money stay. Highly recommended for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “a friend indeed”
Reviews.Author: Tony H
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at Cosmo in March - April. Second was when my wife took ill at the airport and needed an operation that night.Though the standard room is quite small, when you are in Hong Kong you are out all day anyway. Just a short walk to the markets and supermarkets are over the road .The staff can't do enough for you, particularly Mr Cheung whose support during a tough time was absolutely priceless. Food from the eatery is quite good. As a base for a cut price shopping tour of Kowloon, I cannot recommend the Cosmo enough. Post Office is just up the road too.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short break”
Reviews.Author: niceguy09
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean, the staff are pleasant, the rooms are really small with the bathroom actually part of the main room with just a frosted glass partition. Its a bit of a way from any tourist areas, but they have a free hotel minibus into Mongkok.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Billson K
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights during a vacation with my wife. Booked almost 2 months in advance and it was cheaper than any other source I checked and I work at a travel agency. Misleading info regarding distance from MTR. A leisurely walk to/from Olympic station takes about 15 mins and not 4 mins as hotel website states. I deliberately timed it and tried VERY brisk walking and it still took us 8 mins. I assume one should be running or at least jogging fast to be able to achieve 4 mins and that’s if you don’t end up getting run over by a car while crossing the streets trying to beat 4 mins. Hotel does provide free shuttle every hour to/from malls with mtr stations as well as the Kowloon station for the airport express. Location is very convenient in the sense that there is a mcdonalds, wellcome, watsons, mannings right across the street as well as a lot of small eateries with varying cuisines all within a few minutes walk from the hotel. Rooms are small but expected for new hotels in HK. You can literally take a shower, brush your teeth and use the toilet at the same time while in the bathroom although I didn't try it myself. Rooms are cleaned every day though it was quite strange when someone knocked on our door one morning to ask if we had any laundry. I like the contemporary design of the rooms. Very bright and with lots of mirrors to make it look bigger than it actually is. There was nowhere to place our luggage though. We had to lay them out on the floor the whole time we stayed there. Walls and door are pretty thin. I could hear people walking past our door all day long. I actually woke up one night because I thought someone was in our room but turned out it was just someone with heavy feet walking past our room. If the room next door is noisy you can also hear them through the wall. Elevators are a rather long wait during peak hours. They have a third lift that they renovated from being a freight elevator but they don't tell you about it unless you ask or already know about it because it's hidden behind a door to the side being previously a service lift. Hotel employees were all very friendly and helpful and spoke and understood english fairly well. The pillows were pretty shallow so I asked for extra pillows and they provided them very quickly. One incident I found rather disappointing was when I called up the operator asking for the reservations hotline for Cathay Pacific and the only answer I got was that she couldn't help me. I would think it was a simple enough task to check online for it but I couldn't do it myself because I didn't have a laptop for this trip. Free wifi only available only at the lobby but very good speed. Overall, a very good hotel except for the misleading info about the MTR station, the noise insulation, and the incident with the operator.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, if you dont mind small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Happyhhx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel, which is located in a busy Area, closed to the train station. The Rooms are very tastefully decorated but are very, very small. Not much space left when travelling with 2 suitcases. It was hard to move around even that we booked the superior room. Also the Mattress was a bit too firm for me, although it had a cushion layer on it. The bathroom is small as well, but the rain shower is great! The view is amazing and hardly any noise traveled up. We had free breakfast, which suited every taste. The Hotel has a free hourly shuttle service to 3 locations, which is very handy. to the ladies market is only a15 minute walk. free WIFI is available in the Lobby or for a fee in the room It is a very small, but new hotel where we would stay again. Staff was friendly and spoke very well english. We booked a month in advance and got a 30 % discount.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest rooms in Asia”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff are very friendly and speak English beautifully. However the rooms you are actually booking are just so small and compact you can barley move around let alone have any privacy. I suggest if booking with this Hotel choose rooms higher than Superior or Orgainic as we had to do a last minute upgrade to a larger room that was suitable.

Reviews.Title: “way too noisy”
Reviews.Author: LplLass
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel from 6th -11th April. having stayed with family in a tiny flat, we were looking foward to staying at the hotel. How disappointed we were. The hotel and rooms themselves were great, the only problem we had were that the other people staying there were forever banging doors and shouting up the corridors to each other at all times of the night, which meant we didn'ty get much sleep. The second night i asked to be moved but when i went back to get our things ready i was told by the maid that the two rooms directly in front, who were making all the noise had checked out and she was now cleaning the room for other guests so we decided to stay in that room....we should've moved, as the next people were just as loud.At one stage i stood by the door and told them to be quiet, this was at 3am!! Overall, the 5 nights iwe stayed there we awful, 1 good sleep in 5 days, only because i turned the air con on full, therefore it drowned out the noise of the doors and people. The people who made the noise were either Phillopinos or Mainland Chinese as i followed them out of the lift one time. One room at 2am,were having a party, the noise was so loud. One thing the hotel could do is put some sort of strip on the door to stop it banging each time it is shut and put families with children on different floors to groups of friends who will obviously come in late and bang doors all night going to each others rooms. Not good stay..Found a hotel, pacific Island for £45....was great hotel with massive rooms and even useed there swimming pool, shouldve stayed there for the 5 days...No door slamming. I wouldnt recommend this Cosmo Hotel unless you were hard of hearing.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natkeam
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after months of searching on the internet, and it was a great. It´s located at walking distance to the main shopping area, including markets and many bus tour stops. They´ve also got a hotel bus with many stops to main attractions which was a lot of help. As in for the hotel, the rooms are pretty small, but we got a room on the last top floor and despite its size it was lovely. If you´re a couple, the best thing is to organize your bags and clothes, and once thats over without things in the way, its actually a really nice size. The room also had these big window looking out with lovely views. The bathrooms is also small, but had a normal shower and a rain like shower too, so after long walks in the city, it was great to come back to this. All in all, id definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family Quad Room = Great !”
Reviews.Author: xginniex
Reviews.Content: I had an almost wonderful stay at Cosmo Hotel Mongkok from 25th - 28th March 2012. Family Quad room is fantastic but how i wish if there is a bathtub in. But i feel the drainage design of the shower area should be further improved. The water never once drained totally. But its just a very minor area. The tv was great in the sense we can rotate it to the direction we preferred but only 1 side of the room is able to view, the other side have to move over to enjoy the program. The only area i was a little upset was the cleaning of the room daily. The day after our first night the rubbish we bag and place on the table was not cleared perhaps they dont know it was rubbish however after our second night the house keeper threw my shoe box away! Was pretty surprised and upset because we have difficulties trying to bring back my shoes without the proper shoebox and my brad new shoelaces were inside. Other than that, everything was great. Location is good, lots of nice food around and never worry about nothing to grab in the middle of night as MacDonald is just opposite. Shuttle bus every hour to Mongkok, Tsim Shatsui and Kowloon which is super convenient but be there to reserve a seat as it can get pretty crowded at times. A hotel I strongly recommend and high chance to choose again if i visiy HongKong.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: UsaMoon
Reviews.Content: I will give the service, location and cleanliness of this hotel an A+. I enjoyed my 3 nights staying here and will definitely recommend it to everybody. The hotel shuttle is very convenience. You can take it to either shopping areas or to the MRT station that links you easily to other places or to the airport. The restaurants close by open at 6:30 am and serve tasty local food. The only draw back is the tiny room - not much space to move around. But, it's Hong Kong! It's a place where you only need a bed to rest after a whole day of non stop activities.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Florence C
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday & anniversary trip to Hong Kong & I have stayed at Cosmo Hotel Mongkok for 5 days between April 4 - 8. A complimentary room upgrade to Cosmorganic room, a bottle of wine & a fruit platter was given by the AFOM Mr. Augustine Cheung as a gift. We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. Free shuttle service to Langham Place, China HK City/Canton Road, Kowloon AEL/ICC/Elements also provided by the Hotel. I look forward to returning to this magical, refreshing city, and being a guest, once again, of this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: MJG30
Reviews.Content: These little compact rooms were great with all of the amenities you need. The location wasn't great but the free bus to different points in Kowloon was helpful but note you need to get to the morning bus early as once all of the seats are full no one else can get on. The hotel had the slowest lifts ever which wouldn't normally be a problem but when your on the 21st floor it got frustrating. They also might want to think about expanding the wi-fi out of just the lobby as everyone ends us just hanging out there.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jj24Singapore
Reviews.Content: I was expecting this hotel to be under rated compared to other 5 star hotels in HK but cosmo surpassed them with flying colors. This hotel is awesome, the decor , the rooms and the service. The concierge were more than happy to open and carry the luggage for each of their guests. We had this trip in celebration of my boyfriend's birthday and we had 4 amazing nights. The FO team prepared a bottle of wine and cake inside the room for us. The room is very cozy and spotless! They provide the outmost 5star like service from the moment i booked the hotel until i stepped out of their hotel door i just can't stop saying WOW. Thank you for the very pleasant stay Mr. Andrew Lee and to your team. Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Superb service!”
Reviews.Author: jenn4592
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four days between April 3 - 6. We had a great experience witht his hotel. The small things that mattered helped make our stay very enjoyable. 1. The doorman always opened the door as we walked in and out of the hotel. The check in process was quick and easy. We were given a room on the 23rd floor. Elevators are slow. 2. Location was convienent. As ppl have indicated we are a 5-10 min walk to Olympic station. The subway is soo big which is why it may take up to 10 mins. For those that complain about the walk, don't be lazy. 3. Lots of restaurants - Mcdonalds across the street, a congee/rice noodle roll restaurant 3 mins away and more restaurants in the vicinity. A &-Eleven nearby. 4. Room - Not surprised it was a small room however most hotels had small rooms. We didn't stay in our hotel room all day which is why it didn't make a difference. Our room were made up every other day bc we opted not to have them made everyday. 5. Wi-Fi - Free only in the lobby unless you pay extra for your room. There are generally a handful of ppl in the lobby using wifi. 6. Checking Out - Quick and smooth. Check out time: 12pm. The manager insisted on loading our bags into our cab. A great service all around. We paid about 180 HKD to the airport. The airport express shuttle is also an alternative way by using the MTR. 7. Free Shuttle bus to Langham Place Hotel/Mall - We could walk to the Langham place in 10-15 mins. We preferred walking as the shuttle runs every hour or so. And it takes more than 15 mins to get home with the drop off/pick ups from other location. We didn't mind the exercise! Gave us a chance to shop at the Olympic centre with a wide variety of shops and restaurants. Overall we would come back to this hotel again. It was good value, no complaints and superb service. Good job Cosmo!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and unique”
Reviews.Author: keds3682
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay with Cosmo Hotel MK since Jan.2012 and still find it's a good place to stay and the staff were helpful and efficient ,close to everything with or w/o transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Central and caters for all your needs!!”
Reviews.Author: Mork001
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights as a family of 7 and the hotel catered for all our needs. Being located in Mongkok, there are 2 MTR stations a short walk from the hotel - Olympic for trains going to Lantau Island and Mongkok to take you everywhere else. There are a variety of restaurants around the hotel and the conceige were very helpful in providing advice n what was suitable. In the street across from the hotel there are a couple of dessert places that make some great traditional and Chinese orientated slants. The rooms are not the biggest but were very comfortable even with 2 children sharing. Amenities were relatively new and sufficient to our requirements. The family suites were great and met our large party needs. The gym was just a treadmill, bike, stepper and some weights (could do with a good clean). We had the buffet breakfast included in our package and it varied a little each day but by day 5 we were over the lack of variety. Overall, we had good service, good location and good place to stay. If I ever go back to Hong Kong, will be definitely be returning to Cosmo Mongkok.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible smell in the guest bath room!!”
Reviews.Author: Y P
Reviews.Content: Although I had reviewed the rating of this hotel to be 3.9 star, this hotel deserves only 3 stars. The neighborhood is not great, and is inconvenient to the MTR or public transportation, although taxi are available. The free shuttle to Mong Kok and Tsim Sha Tsui area only runs every hour by the half hour, such as 9:30am, 10:30am. We want to take the free shuttle to the Kowloon station to board the Airport Express. We were told to leave the luggage with them until the bus arrived. When it arrived, we were told to board the bus first. So we assumed they will load our luggage to the bus automatically. But when the bus started to move, we did not see anyone from the hotel loaded our luggage to the bus. We had to stop the bus driver, and went down the bus to the hotel to load the luggage ourselves. We could have left without our luggage and presumed they will deliver to the Kowloon station. They need to communicate better! When I asked for the deposit back, they said they had torn the credit card copy, but could not give me a copy of the torn credit card charge. I insisted that they made a photo copy and gave me the torn copy with "cancel" for my record, so that I can dispute any charge if they did charge me for the deposit. Worst of all, our room at #717, for 2 nights, 3/28 to 3/30/12, around 11pm to 2am, there was horrible, sewer type of smell in the bath room, either coming from the vent on the ceiling or the drainage near the toilet. The smell was so horrible that I felt dizzy and nauseated, and tried not to go to the bath room around this time. I asked the front desk when we checked out on 3/30/12 if they are cleaning the sewer around this time. The smell is very unacceptable to guest's health!!

Reviews.Title: “But for the room size and internet!!!”
Reviews.Author: psahaye
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently and have very mixed feelings. Hong Kong hotels are expensive and rooms are small. I booked this hotel through expedia thinking this was the best deal available. I realized later on that the hotel website offered better rates with breakfast thrown in. Cosmo hotel is located in Mongkok and is about 7/8 minutes walk to Olympic MTR station and 12 minutes walk to Mongkok station. The area around is not very nice with lots of shops, small restaurants including some Thai restaurants close by. There is a McDonalds right opposite that is not upto normal standards. I had booked what is called a Superior room and I was told it is about 21 sq. meters in size. That seemed to be a decent size. What I did not know that the area included closet, a work desk and the washroom with only a shower area. A rain shower was a nice touch. There was no place or stool to keep the bags. Free internet is available in hotel lobby but if you use it in the room, it costs HK$132 per day and if you use two devices (a laptop and a smart phone for example), the cost will be double. Local calls are charged at HK$5 per call upto 30 minutes. Iron and ironing board are available on request. There is a restaurant that I did not use. Now what made my stay pleasant was their very helpful staff, concierge,bell desk and house keeping. All I needed was to ask and they would do their best to help. Their English was reasonably good. The hotel has a shuttle service to some important MTR stations like Mongkok, Kowloon and also to Hong Kong China ferry. The rooms are clean and comfortable despite their size. The lighting is good and they have night blind with electrical controls next to bed and an ergonomic desk. I had great help from Ashley Cheung in Reservations and Augustine Cheung, the Front Office Manager were a great help. Augustine asked me about my stay when I checked out and promised to do his best to iron out the wrinkles and said that a new and improved website will soon offer more rooms with better sizes. A somewhat bigger room with free internet will certainly bring me back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Choose this hotel in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: marie w
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Hong Kong, thanks to Cosmo Hotel. Great service 24/7, the personal always did their outmost to make us feel comfortable and to fullfill our wishes. Very nice rooms. Just a couple of meters away from the metro which can take you anywhere in Hong Kong, and only 2 stops away from "the central". Very enjoyable price for our stay, but still exclusive. If you are planning to visit Hong kong, I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: morinomiya
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days and had no major complaints about the room, or the service. The bed was rather short but we were able to work aound it. Anyone over 6 foot tall wouln't be so lucky however. Breakfast was a bit of let-down, and the staff in the restaurant weren't very friendly, but given that we were only in the restaurant for a few minutes each day, it didn't matter much. Close to many fun places and easy to find. Having wi-fi only in the lobby was a bit of a negative for those in need of it, but didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, no free wifi”
Reviews.Author: Joost-en-Claus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine but not great. Pros: rooms are neat and clean, service is friendly, the are sufficient breakfast options. Cons: Reception is slow because of tons of paperwork, rooms are really tiny and wifi is not free in the rooms (it is in the seatingless lobby). Metro is several blocks away. About 30 minutes from the airport by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “CRAMPED, BAD AREA”
Reviews.Author: shq
Reviews.Content: After attending the ASIAN FILM AWARDS/FILMART/HAF events in Hongkong, I decided to stay at the Cosmo Mongkok. Looking at its photos from its website, I got very excited to stay at this hotel. CRAMPED ROOM When I got my room (#618), I was quickly disillusioned and disappointed! The room is cramped (even smaller than the Japanese-style rooms that i have stayed at in Nikko Hotels in SFO), no room for luggage, the bed is right next to the glass toilet - there was not even a full chair to sit on after a long day out! You wouldn't even want to stay inside your room for long because you will feel claustrophobic! I asked to be transferred to another room but they claimed that it was fully booked! Thirty minutes after I grudgingly took out my stuff and toiletries, the front desk calls and says that there was another room at the 20th floor - but it was pretty much the same size and lay-out! Never, ever again will I stay here. BAD AREA The area that you will walk through to get to and from the MTR (both Olympia and MongKok Stations) are crowded and dusty - not safe especially at night. The views from the room is butt ugly so you need to pull down the shades and you end up staring at the few square meters around your bed! BRIGHT SPOT The only bright spot that this hotel can be proud of is their courteous staff - both the front desk and the concierge people. Housekeeping, perhaps because they do not speak English well, is another story. Good thing my father did not come with me on this particular trip. Even if I was alone in this room, I already felt very cramped - two people cannot definitely sleep comfortably in their rooms. Awful!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Danny102
Reviews.Content: As this is our first time staying in Cosmo Hotel, it was a wonderful experience. As our baby girl was very sick, called the reception and the Guest Service Manager by the name of Sanny Chan came to our room and gave us a name card of the clinic that was directly across the hotel. He even went to the extent of visiting me at the clinic to see how my daughter was. Given the level of service rendered by yourself and your team, you would say that we would definitly return to HK again and stay in your hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Make it your last option”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine1705
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Hongkong for several years now and this is the first time I was ever in a cramped room. The website shows amazing photos but the room I have chosen (Cosmorganic) was small even for one person. There was no place to store luggage. My bed was directly beside the shower and toilet glass enclosure. They did not replenish the toiletries on a daily basis (although I always bring my own). The carpet was dirty. If they could not maintain the cream color, they should have chosen a darker shade. I booked way in advance and was the only hotel available then which offered a good rate with buffet breakfast which was a disappointment as well because they served the same thing every single day at the Cinnecita Restaurant. The staff went about their business without smiling. Same thing with the Reception Area. There are just about 2 good things about this hotel - the excellent concierge service and free shuttle transport to either the Langham Place, the Airport Express, the Elements Mall and the Ferry Terminal at the Royal Pacific Tower. This boutique hotel is relatively new but I wouldn't recommend this to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Mongkok is different than Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: baileyfirestone
Reviews.Content: We liked the Cosmo hotel. Some of the wonderful things: - the service (requests to the front desk were quickly and willingly accommodated) - the view from room 1816 - the rainfall shower - the bathroom fixtures were cool - the bakery across the street - the breakfast buffet (although a little pricey it included both western and asian options) - being able to experience the local neighborhood and the nearby Langham Place There were a few things that could have been better: - free Wifi (it was in the lobby and restaurant, but not in the rooms). This meant that the lobby was often packed with guests trying to use their computers. - Small rooms with no storage (we have been in small rooms before and don't bring large luggage, but there were only two small drawers and a few hangers on a hook. it was impossible to unpack. - Carpet stains in room, and the comforter had a small hole in it on the top. - The frosted glass bathroom walls and sliding door were cool, but the door didn't close all of the way, lacking somewhat in privacy By staying in Mongkok, you really get a different sense of Hong Kong than staying on the the island. Much more traditional. Much less modern - except for Langham place. The hotel is doing some remodeling or adding rooms to the property. They are also very interested in feedback. (They encouraged us to post to tripadvisor.) It was a very good value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant service, knowledgeable staff, and clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Vonatzki
Reviews.Content: I love how employees serve their customers. They are pretty much knowledgeable with tourist sites that you could ask them cost-saving tips on how to go there. It is noteworthy to say that every staff understands and speaks English fluently. I remember when checking out that Yannick, one of their staff, gave us a pleasant experience despite the long wait on the queueing line due to number of guests checking in and out. For the con side (well, I don't know if this is a con side really), they have small rooms. However, that is nothing compared to the good things I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: guest54321
Reviews.Content: Overall, i had a nice stay in this hotel; my only complaint is the bathroom. The size is not a problem but there's a smell coming from the drain and I had a hard time flushing the toilet. I think there is not enough water pressure. Besides that, I am very happy with my stay at Cosmo Hotel Mongkok. The hotel shuttle was a big plus, since it wasn't that near the MRT Station. The location is actually nice. There's a Mcdonald's across the street, not to mention, grocery/ convenient stores, bakery, drug stores. The room we booked was small but it was clean and very modern. I just hope there is free wifi in the room so I don't have to go to the lobby for the free wifi. :) The staff are very courteous and helpful giving directions & carrying our luggage. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Good for long stay”
Reviews.Author: Ernesto T
Reviews.Content: We booked an Airline/Hotel package deal, for 17 nights, well in advance of traveling, which made the trip very affordable.Having so much time for one destination,we took it easy, avoiding early morning rush for the elevators and crowded lobby for free WiFi.The hourly,free, shutle-bus to three destinations was very helpful.We had booked a superior room and changed from double to twin, having been used to years of caravaning,and being of average size, helped us to be comfortable in the small room.The first thing we bought was a Octobus Public Travel card and then used MTR rail, buses,and even the iconic Hong Kong City trams. Good to photograph from the top deck up front.Hong Kong bakeries are great value. And don't forget nearby small Islands.

Reviews.Title: “We are a happy guest @ Cosmo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie21939
Reviews.Content: At the beginning, I was so worry the location of the hotel, becoz it was my daughter who book it. And when we arrive, I love the smell of the lobby and the people are friendly & polite. Even though the hotel is not in the heart of the shopping center, they have a shuttle bus that goes around the shopping center and also the city check-in for our convenient. I personally think the shuttle bus is very safe and super dooper convenient ( just follow the bus schedule ). I would advise for all new guest to try this hotel. Promise you will not regret ! Hotel staff are really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Hong Kong secret”
Reviews.Author: Ron F
Reviews.Content: Although small, the rooms are very clean and quite with comfortable beds. From the moment you enter the hotel to the time you leave, you are greeted with a smile and excellent service. Augustine (Asst. Front Office Manager) is a great guy who will make sure you have a pleasant stay. I would recommend purchasing a room with breakfast as the variety is good and the food is very tasty. Internet access from your room is simple, consistent, and inexpensive. The Hotel is within a short walking distance to the Olympic train station as well as colorful Hong Kong markets. Don't miss this well kept secret in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, didn't regret at all!”
Reviews.Author: Kareen L
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite for 5 nights in march 2012. Was at first hesitant cos some reviewers commented it was a tad far from mtr and touristy area, but upon arrival realized all my fears were unfounded! mtr is just 5 min walk for me and my parents and we are lugging 2 young kids in our arms and stroller. 24 HR macs and almost 24 HR supermarket with fresh meat for baby's self cooked meals, small local stalls with fresh veg and fruit, local food shops for a quick bite (the cheese fondue and soya bean shops look immensely popular with locals), bustling streets yet quiet envt once inside the hotel, did i mention the children's playground just across the road? The hotel itself is spanking new and clean, loved my 22nd floor suite with huge windows and a great view of the city and the harbor, although it's much smaller than another suite I stayed in TST prev, the view and cleanliness made up for it. Appreciated the daily free breakfast buffet cos it's difficult lugging along kids to find breakfast outside, and can surf free wifi while eating and also in lobby. Actually even prior to our stay we already had very pleasant experiences working with the staff cos my sis had to make last-min changes to her booking and I also had certain requests to make. and on our last night there, we were surprised yet very impressed when the hotel security called up saying a black bag had been found outside our room, politely asked if it belonged to us, and when we realized yes we had left it there when returning to our room, they promptly took it back up to us. Good vigilance and excellent customer service there!!! Free shuttle bus and courteous staff and no-smoking policy throughout entire hotel = even more plus points! Oh and regarding the numerous reviews on the 2 slow lifts, there is already a new 3rd lift now and all their speeds are pretty satisfactory, didn't have to wait more than a minute anytime! This is overall a Very Very good hotel and I will def be back at the same hotel should I visit HK again!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Stephy Z
Reviews.Content: Service from staff are good, as they are always there to help you in anyways such as carrying luggage, opening door and they always greet you with a smile. There are restaurant or they so call cha cham ting, supermarket, 7-11, pharmacist, and guardian around the around. Convenient to travel around hong kong as they provide free shuttle bus every hour at the hotel to bring you to places like mongkong (shopping district) and other place, beside they will also be at the drop off point every hour to bring to back to the hotel as the tedious shopping. Although rooms are a small, but it is clean and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and the standard is still great!”
Reviews.Author: arch4ngel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cosmo Hotel Mongkok for the second time during a recent trip back to Hong Kong and it was a great experience again. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Seabird21
Reviews.Content: I tend to rely on tripadvisor quite heavily when deciding where to stay and was horrified that reviewers before I travelled were complaining about this hotel. I have to say I had a fabulous stay and was really impressed by staff and facilities. It may be only a 4 star hotel but staff are certainly trying to deliver 5 star service. Every day, staff greeted you, opened doors and tried to help with bags. The rooms were cleaned and serviced daily. Staff offered helpful tips not only on restaurants in the area but also tourist destinations and how to get there with public transport. Who could ask for more? I travelled with family so we hired the Suite Air (2512) and were delighted. The rooms were small (but this is Hong Kong) and had been cleverly designed with mirrors and light wood to feel spacious. My parents had the bedroom, where it didn't feel quite like a western queen size bed, but was very comfortable. The bathroom had a tub, shower and a rain shower from the ceiling as well and was spacious. The only issue was a lack of easily accessible benchspace on which to store 3 people's toiletries. The door was indeed a sliding door with frosted glass which initially freaked me out, but although you could see people's legs to mid shin, nothing else was visible .... and with the tv on nothing else was audible either :) I spent the week sleeping on the sofa bed in the living area. Initially the bed was very firm and I woke with sore joints, but after mentioning this to one of the staff members, the mattress was apparently replaced - not sure exactly what was done, but the sleep quality did improve for the remainder of the trip. It was great having two 'spaces' to spend time in, as we could separate ourselves for a break as required. Free bottles of water (4 per day) was a great touch. The view of the city at night from the windows was fabulous and we couldn't hear any road noirse whatsover. Occasionally you could hear other people arriving to their rooms late at night, but this occurs in most hotels as people forget to keep their voices down in corridors. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was excellent. There was a western component as well as an asian component, so you were spoiled for choice. There tended to be the same range most days, with a few additional variations thrown in for good measure. From an asian perspective there was congee and a variety of dim sum and noodles with sticky rice on weekends. From the western perspective there was cereal, muselei, pastries, salad, cheese/meat, baked beans, sausages/bacon and an omelette/fried egg station. Got us going for the day beautifully. Location of the hotel was good. About 5 minutes walk from Olympic MTR station and perhaps 12 minutes to Nathan Road and the Mongkok MTR which opened up access to the rest of Hong Kong. The hotel also offered a free shuttle every hour to Langham Place (Nathan Rd), the Kowloon train station (airport train check in) and the China Ferry Terminal (ferry to Macau etc). So, all in all, I wouls not only recommend staying at this hotel, I would plan to return next time I was passing through.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that is above my expectation”
Reviews.Author: Michael Y
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel i will definetly stay again if i travel to HK next time, highly recommended to family and friends. Check in staffs are professional and friendly. Lobby staffs are extremely politely and helpful. They greet you everytime you enter and exit the hotel and help you carry heavy shopping bags to the elevator if needed. They as well give you directions and transportation tips. They will help you catch a taxi during traffic hours if needed. Two words describe all: excellent services.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Not exactly good location”
Reviews.Author: Fatangel_am
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that the hotel location is not exactly right in Mongkok center. It is more to the edge of Mongkok area which took me minimum of 15 minutes walk to Mongkok Sation and minimum of 10 minutes walk to Olympic Station. I found a very good promotion on Tripadvisors, offering free daily ABF, free WiFi and 24 hours check in. Nevertheless, there are some hidden cost such as guest have to pay tax for WIFI at HKD 12 per day per device. So if you connect more than 1 device, you will be chagred more than HKD 12 a day. Moreover, the 24 hours check in is only subject to availabilyt. I was told that guest is requested to do the registration at least 3 days in advance and the check out time is subject to availability. So I would suggest everyone to recheck this with the reservation team when the booking is made. Luckily we could have late check out at 15:00 so it was only around 3 hours before we have to go to airport. Free shuttle service to Mongkok and nearby area is very useful but I would recommend guests to come to the bus long before the departure time since it is always full. Also the walking way from Mongkok or from Olympic station to hotel in the night is quiet. Although I think Hong Kong is a very safe place, I still suggest single traveller especially woman to take taxi back to hotel in the night. There is nothing much to talk about the Room, ABF or restaurant. Room is really small with size of approx. 20SQM, small closet and small shower room. Variety of ABF is good but it was the same selection for the whole week I stayed. There are many restaurants nearby for dinner and restaurant closes at around 22:00 daily Overall I still think this hotel is one of the good hotels and would consider coming back again if the offer is right.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault the Cosmo!”
Reviews.Author: jlouise
Reviews.Content: We paid for the standard, basic double bedded room, on the 17th floor, for 4 nights. Yes, it is a bit on the small side, as we believe most rooms in Hong Kong are, unless you pay for an upgrade. But, the room is so well designed that you feel the room is good and bigger. A large window giving good views over the city and gives lots of natural light. Our room was immaculate, clean and modern, with flat screen TV, fridge, safe, A/C, complimentary water, tea and coffee, replenished daily. The shower in the bathroom was the best we have ever used in a hotel!! We found the hotel complimentary mini bus very useful, leaving once an hour and always on time to and from the various locations. The location of the hotel is at the top end of Kowloon, in Mongkok, which was fine for us, giving good and easy accesss to the airport, by the A21 airport bus, just round the corner. The hotel is close to Nathan Road, with an abundance of shops, restaurants and markets. We found the staff happy, friendly and very helpful and we could not have asked for more. We would defintely stay here again! Thank you Cosmo Hotel for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average, at best”
Reviews.Author: eastsidehirise
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels that seems good in reviews and on the web, but when you go there, you quickly teach yourself to lower your expectations... Since this is not a high-end establishment, I will not spend a lot of time bringing your attention to issues that are to be expected. Staff are average. Check-in staff was okay, pleasant enough, but not all of them. Some of them seem only as good as your regular cashier at the check-out. At check-in I was promised a free, guaranteed late check-out, only to find someone calling me on the day of check-out asking why I hadn't vacated the room by noon... to their credit, the problem was quickly rectified and my late check-out was honoured! Good problem resolution! But shouldn't have happened in the first place - gives me the impression there is a communication problem within the hotel. Room was tiny. Clean, but tiny, and clearly losing the 'shine' I assume it once had when it was new. Bed was TINY. I am not a big person by any standard, and the bed was already a *tiny* bit too short for me. Beware if you are a big/tall person! Room had some problem with humidity. I found my papers and passport starting to warp after only two nights. There is a flat screen tv mounted on the wall, small, but with local and international channels, so it was appreciated. The location was average. Safe, and plenty of places to eat around, but at least 15min to the nearest subway station, which involves elevated walkways and lifts/escalators. If you are looking for a cheap and clean place, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo Hotel Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: SiewPeng
Reviews.Content: The location is quite a prime area with lots of food varities and convenience stores; walking distance to MTR and an added value with the transport bus provided to Langham Place; Ferry Terminal; AEL etc. where one can shop, eat and play. Although the room is small but the services provided and ambience is excellent. Recommended to stay in this hotel for those who prefer Free & Easy like us! Cheers Siew Peng

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Abbydelight
Reviews.Content: Check-in and check-out was fast (though not so much smile from front desk staff). Concierge was superb, sensitive and caring. Special thanks to Gary Poon and King Li for their warm services. Gary even helped us to catch a taxi when we asked for direction. Bell assistant helped us with our luggage to our room. When checking out, they took very good care of the luggage, labelled them and asked if I would like the hotel to keep them. When I told them I would take the shuttle to Kowloon Station, the front desk overheard and immediately expedite the room checking to complete the check out. Very efficient! Room was small (this is HK so no big deal), clean and brand new. You will have some space for your luggage, I could keep two big and two small bags in my superior room. Shower was great, though the frosted bathroom wall was a little drawback. Especially if you are sharing room with friends, but I guess the design makes the room looks more spacious. Bed was comfy, the pillow was a litte soft. I asked for a harder one and housekeeping sent me additional pillow. Housekeeping was fast, I asked for additional cloth hangers, they sent it over within 10 minutes. No free in-room internet access, but you could get free wifi in lobby. It would be perfect if there is free wifi in room. Convenient location, bakery, local cafe, Watson, Mannings, supermarket, McD and a few 7-11 within the area, few steps from hotel. My room was facing the school and public garden opposite the hotel, good experience with local lifestyle. MTR was about 10 minutes away, I felt like exit C2 and C5 is nearer than the recommended exit B. Following exit C2 and C5 you will pass by local stores while exit C5 is by paedestrian walkway. Both different scenery and you could try them. Shuttle bus was on-time and efficient. One of the driver (wearing spec) helped us with our luggage when he picked us up from Kowloon Station. He would tell the guests the name of the stop. Very helpful. Reservation and booking also served with courtesy. A thank you note was sent to me after I left the hotel. Overall, I am very satisfied with my stay, will stay there again during my next HK trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and prompt service!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryltay
Reviews.Content: I've stayed with Cosmo for my trip in Hong Kong and I have to say that the service in the hotel is excellent! Prompt and excellent service especially from the concierge team. Nice, friendly and helpful hoteliers ready to offer their service to each and every guest. Well done and I'll definitely return back to the hotel if I were to visit Hong Kong again! Thanks Hugo and his concierge team! :)

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luigi C
Reviews.Content: We took the standard room for our first night. Hotel room was quite small, but were clean. Beds are comfortable to sleep on. Comfort room is extremely small which makes it a little bit too humid when taking the shower. The rooms are equipped with one very small refrigerator. Hotel location is not so good, you have to walk for around 15 mins to get to Olympic MTR station. They provide a free breakfast. The breakfast is good. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. For our second night, we took the family room. It was very spacious and well equipped with facilities like a DVD player, a wireless phone, a radio... etc. The only weird thing about this room is that it has a very large comfort room! And the water sink was too small and low. Though the shower room is quite spacious.. :) For the standard room, overall its nice if you would just want a clean comfortable bed to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Greg A
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean, modern and very helpful staff. I suggest getting the superior room. We only stayed 2 days 27 - 29 Feb 2012 and the staff were extremely helpful. From the Customer Service to door service all were very good, opening doors, carrying luggage helping with places to go etc. Excellent free shuttle service to the MTR (HK train service). We recommend this hotel, Mongkok shows the real Hong Kong and the hotel was all we had expected and more. Great stay, hotel was very good, and most staff excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Daslyn
Reviews.Content: My friends and I really enjoyed our stay in Cosmo Mongkok hotel. We booked Family Quad room and we were given a room on the 25th floor! The view was excellent and the room is very clean. Free wifi in the lobby, free shuttle bus to some places and 5 mins walk to Olympic MTR. All the staffs are well-train, very helpful, polite and alert. We would definitely stay in this hotel again when we are in HK again. Highly recommended to all! Would also like to compliment one of the hotel staff, King Li. He is super helpful and thoughtful. Thank you Cosmo Mongkok Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4/5 STAR overall!”
Reviews.Author: singaporepong
Reviews.Content: We stayed in HK for 4 nights between 21st - 25th Feb 2012. Definitely a great experience. Though the room is quite small, but it looks bigger with the big mirror and spacious bathroom. Below are the comments! 1. Breakfast is so-so ( -0.5 ) 2. We are greeted during our arrival, with the bell boys dashing to open the door and helping us carrying the luggage. 3. Our Quad room is rather spacious, clean and modern layout, located on the 25th storey with a nice scenary. Room is ready when we arrive. 4. Shutter bus service to Ferry terminal and close train stations 5. 24 hrs Macdonalds just across the road 6. Most importantly, good customer service especially by one of the Staff name King Li and his colleagues. We couldn't remember his colleague's name but he is very tall and is as helpful as King Li. Overall, I am very satisfied. I will come back here when I visit HK again :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: RyanKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: Before I arrive the hotel, I already have a great feeling about the hotel. They send us an email to welcome us and inform us the weather condition in Hong Kong and a form for us to fill in our expected check in and out time so that they could arrange a room for us if we need early check it which we need. Room are ready for us @ 11am which is very very nice. Hotel is walking distance to the MTR station, about 10 minutes to Olympic and 15 minutes to Mongkok. Free hotel shuttle bus is provided to pick up and drop of @ Mongkok, Tsim Sha Tsui & Kowloon Station.The room provided is small but very clean. Suitable for couple to stay in as the toilet is not able to be lock and its semi transparent. Breakfast are very good in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to rest your head after a busy day”
Reviews.Author: Annie M
Reviews.Content: At this hotel we got good customer service, a clean room, friendly room staff and a great location. Hong Kong is a busy, bustling cosmopolitan city and if you would rather spend time in your hotel than exploring the fantastic city then don't book this hotel, in fact don't go to Hong Kong. But if you need somewhere to lay your head after a busy day exploring and shopping, with excellent transport links close to several MTR stations, and within easy walking distance of Nathan Road then book this hotel.
