We found the price reasonable, the room is on the small size, but this is Hong Kong and we have stayed in other more expensive hotels and got the same amount of space. The sliding doors to the bathroom are a little strange, but the room is well designed and our shower was powerful and hot. The location is probably the best thing about this hotel. just 10 mins walk from Olympic and well signposted we jumped of the Airport Express at 8am. Of course we couldn't check in early without paying extra, but in what hotel in the world can you do that? Our luggage was looked after and we were shown to the restrooms where we could freshen up. We headed out into the city and when we returned our room was ready for us. This hotel is great if you are the sort of people that want to make the most of the city. We will be staying here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: casey9759949
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, couple with great convenience with its own shuttle bus, chauffeuring you to the nearest MTR station with great connectivity... well, basically everywhere you want to go, either great food or fun destinations, this is definitely a great place to stay. In a nutshell, cosmo mongkok is the centre of fun and exciting hong kong, a place you will find comfort after a-day long adventure; not forgetting prompt, helpful, friendly staff who are ever-ready to provide you with excellent service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly tiny rooms, extremely bad service, totally unreasonable staff”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely small - barely enough space for the beds, the bathrooms have glass walls to save on even more space. There is no bath! Problem with reservation was not solved by staff - they were quite rude about it. I will never ever stay in a cosmo hotel again given what I've experienced in this one.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, expensive rates, lousy service – a place to avoid”
Reviews.Author: Gerd H
Reviews.Content: Do be careful about the hotel – there are SEVERAL Cosmo hotels described here. I travel a lot, in Europe, USA and Asia. Generally, I am polite and accept a lot of things. This time though, I can not do anything else than warn you to do any booking at the Cosmo Hotel, Mongkok, Hongkong, located 88 Tai Kok Tsui road, Kowloon. Why would I say that? They have 5 different room categories, where the suites are the same in size and only differ in the usage (families, single). The room I booked is the 3rd biggest room, and when you see Superior, Executive and then on top of that “Cosmorganic”, you say “WOW” at the first view of their website. When you see the rates and compare them with other hotels, you’ll also say that the hotel must be impressive (since there are hotels with better rates available), as is their website. BUT: - if you are more clever than I was, you check not only the description provided at the pricing section, but go further down and click on the description of the rooms. IF you are clever then with imagination, you may figure out that 20sqm are NOT as big as one would think in the first place, since – that does INCLUDE the bathroom size. So, the room itself has 20sqm MINUS the bathroom, it’s barely more that a bed plus a bit floor space. And yes, indeed I did NOT mention any place where you can store your luggage, or your clothes, since there hardly is any. - Your clothes have to stay in your luggage that you place on the small place at the window, where in the picture at their website the guy sits. That is the ONLY place besides the floor where you HAVE a place for it. Then there is a small hanger for 6 shirts, a safe, and a small box for your underwear. That’s it. If you do travel with family (I heard that some people do that), you are screwed. A second luggage? Well, there is of course the desk, you can use that, right. Or the floor, but then you have to tip-toe around your luggage to get to the bed. - The bath – well, stylish, it is, no doubt. But – do you REALLY want a bathroom that consists of glass (although it’s smoked), where the door does not really fit tidily, and where you share all the noises that usually occur when using a bathroom? I mean, I might not mind when travelling alone, but – again, some people do book a room with a kingsize bed not only to be used as a room for one person… - Ah – yes, the bed. Kingsize, I mentioned, right? I explicitly asked for it, and I got it confirmed while checking in. Well, I am an average European guy, 1.80m and about 85kg, wearing size L. I made a picture of that bed – check that out. I put my shirt on it for reference – the arms are hanging OFF the side of the KINGSIZE bed! Have you ever, EVER, seen a kingsize bed like this? Well, I for sure have not, except here…When I lay my 1.80m flat on that bed, my feet are OFF the bed while my head touches the headboard. I am sure even Asians do have a different understanding of kingsize… - And – the cleanliness of the room. Ok, I admit, Asians are small by default, no offense intended (I like Asians and work with them a lot). But – the …hmm, you can not call it a locker, or closet, it’s more a wardrobe space thing with no door. Anyway – the top of that piece CAN be cleaned, so usually there is no need to keep the dust there, like they do. In lack of space, I tried to place there the cozy cover of the KINGSIZE bed, and was not able to avoid my sneezing – almost a kilo of dust came down then (at least it felt like that) – please check the picture, just for fun (taken AFTER the dust already came down, so that is what’s still left there). Well, nothing really to worry about – I mean, the floor itself was not too clean either. Creamy white in general, it had several dark spots on it, that usually would have been removed at any other hotel I was so far. Not here though. The ultimate fun comes when you try to get a good rate and do not read and understand their terms and conditions. In every other hotel I was before, it was of course also the policy to provide better rates the earlier you book. But here, their rate do mean that, if you book the early bird rate with 30% discount, they REALLY mean that this has to be paid upfront (30 days actually), AND is NOT refundable, even when you booked for 30 days and need to check out after 3 days due to unexpected business needs. The whole money is then meant to be lost. Although I had some of such bookings made in the past at other hotels, I was every time able to rearrange things when there was a need, and pay only for the time I stayed. Mostly even with the agreed rate, some times with the higher daily rate that you would get when booking the same day. Then – additional services can be e.g. WiFi access. Most hotels I know provide WiFi access free of charge. Cosmo on the other hand does not. They charge depending on your booking. It might be the full charge of 132 HKD, or just the service charge of the internet company. Just in the lobby they have a free WiFi access. So – well, after all, I may mention that the hotel has some good sides too, as unexpected as it is. They have a free shuttle going every hour from the hotel to different places (MTR station,City centre). The staff is friendly too. The breakfast buffet is fairly good if you stay not too long, and the lobby is clean. Do NOT check though the restrooms that are close to the restaurant – you may have some hard times keeping your breakfast to yourself, since the time I checked them (3 times during my stay), they were as dirty as on a train station (ok, there are good train stations, but I guess you know what I’m talking about, right?). Even the airport ones are in better shape than the ones here. It might be a temporary problem, but given my experience with the dust I somehow doubt that… Soo – if you STILL book this hotel, you can not say you have not been warned, and I wish you a pleasant stay nonetheless…

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a Hong Kong stopover”
Reviews.Author: Riever
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here on a stopover and found it very comfortable. The rooms are small - not unusual for cities, but have been really well designed to make the most of the space. The staff were very helpful and friendly and we used the shuttle bus for getting back and forth to the Star Ferry and MTR. I would certainly use it again visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service bad location”
Reviews.Author: Frozensage
Reviews.Content: Firstly the positives. Customer service was quite good. There were always someone at the lobby helping with carrying luggages and opening doors. Upon arrival, our bags were carried up to our room. There are free internet at the lobby, hence there are always alot of ppl sitting there using their ipad and laptops. Rooms were quite modern and adequate in size for HK. Bathroom could have used abit more ventilation as you can smell the moldiness when you first open the glass door. Now for the negatives. The hotel is located next to a highway/freeway. And you can hear the traffic well into the night. We were there for 3 nights. First night we stayed on level 13 and I could not sleep with the constant noise. The other 2 nights we moved to level 21, still you could hear the sound though not as bad. For some reason there were vibration noises coming from the wall behind the bed so that also ruined my sleep in the morning. The hotel is on the fringe of Mongkok, so to get to Mongkok MTR you have to walk for about 10-15min through narrow streets. Let's just say the route isn't very scenic. There is a shuttle bus you can take every hour which drops you off at Langham Monkok but if you miss it then it's a long wait. If you do alot of shopping, then it's not one of those hotel where you can easily come back to drop off your bags take a breather before continuing. Also didn't find alot of cafes around the area, like you would expect in other parts of HK. There is a McDonald across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cerberus01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, staff very helpful and couldn't do enough for you. We asked for a room with a view and were given the top floor which offered great views of the city. Room was very small but excellently designed to make it feel bigger. The most comfortable bed I have slept in for a long time which made for really good sleep. The use of the courtesy bus also came in handy too, to get to us down to the harbour. Hotel staff also happy to store our luggage on the last day until late evening, so we were able to enjoy the day without having the hassle of taking it with us. There is one issue with the room, not for us but I could see it being a problem for others. The design of the bathroom has a sliding front door which even when closed doesn't shut tight. Therefore because of the mirrors in the room, whoever you are sharing with, will be able to see you if you are making use of the toilet. Quite funny for us but might be difficult if staying with someone you are not comfortable with sharing those personal moments with. I have one real issue with the hotel, it charges you for wifi, not a small charge but a ridiculous 130 HKD a day which is crazy. Most hotels now offer free wifi or at a small charge not a crazy amount like this. They do offer free wifi in the lobby but this is overcrowded and there was never any available seating so isn't very user friendly. Such a shame they are being so greedy, nobody minds a token charge but 130HKD that's outrageous. Good points, room design, bed, staff and location Bad points, wifi charge is unbelievable, room size if being picky

Reviews.Title: “Very uncomfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: MelANDBrucey
Reviews.Content: Receplion staff were helpful but there english needs to improve. The rooms are very tiny and we had no where to lay down our suitcases. The beds we're so uncomfortable I woke with a sore back everyday. It was freezing when we went and we had to go on a waiting list for a heater, not every room has them. The restaurant was nice enough but the staff were very rude. There must have been complaints as the managers were on for the last few days we stayed. The breakfast is advertised as opening from 7am til 10.30am but at 10am all the eggs are packed away and none of the food or juices are replenished. It is only a 10 min walk to the train station and there is a great shopping centre near by called Olympic park. Overall it wasn't too bad but I will be staying somewhere different next time I visit hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “good location and good deal for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Terence_Hill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and were overall very happy. The hotel is in a very convenient location in Mongkok and you have an 7/11 and loads of restaurants directly next to the hotel. The ladies market and Nathan road can be reached by foot in approx. 20min. The hotel also offers a free bus shuttle to the shopping mall Lanham Place and to Olympic, we never used it though. Wireless Internet in the lobby is free which was a very convenient service. The staff is very kind and helpful. Our room was on the 26th floor, with the hotel being full, it sometimes could take a bit for the elevator to come. The room itself was very nice and very spacious (for Hong Kong), the bed very comfortable. Some people might mind that the bathroom does not allow you full privacy (see photo). We would definitively stay there again provided that the price per night during the requested time is reasonable, as this time we paid for the 4 nights around 411 Eur which was a good deal for Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo Mongkok - a mid-price hotel with five star service”
Reviews.Author: archipelago
Reviews.Content: The Cosmo Mongkok in many ways is a typical mid-price Hong Kong hotel but we were taken aback by the terrific service we received from hotel staff. It started even before we arrived. Sampling regional Chinese cooking was a focus of our trip. We used the excellent openrice.com restaurant review site and Michelin ratings to try to find Hong Kong restaurants which offered exceptionally good food while avoiding the over-elaborate, overpriced big hotel restaurants. Some of these Michelin rated restaurants are so popular that reservations need to be made days or weeks in advance. Further, we found that it was very difficult for English speakers to make reservations. Cantonese-only restaurant staff who answered our calls hung up when we called to make a reservation. We repeatedly pestered the Cosmo staff to make our reservations. They were fantastic, making all the reservations we requested and, when we were unable to get the reservations we wanted, they followed up to be sure that we got an alternative. When we checked into the hotel the staff worriedly recalled that we did not have a reservation for dinner on a particular night. Then, when I thought I had lost my passport, Cosmo staff sprang into action. They sent a staff member to accompany me to the restaurants at which we had dined, they got me information on the U.S. consulate in Hong Kong and filing a report with the Mongkok police station. Fortunately, my passport turned up in my traveling companions room but I learned a lesson about how dire the consequences are for losing a passport. One could be stuck in a foreign country for many days or even weeks trying to get get replacement travel documents through the sclerotic consular procedures. In short, I can't imagine that you could get better, more personalized service at the Peninsula for $500 a night than you get at the Cosmo Mongkok for $100. The Cosmo rooms are small as is typical for Hong Kong hotels, but they are very well designed to maximize the space. You'll pay about $90USD for a basic room at the Cosmo. We did quite a bit of research before we came to Hong Kong and visited several other economy hotels while we were in Hong Kong. Even booking a room at a guesthouse in Chungking Mansions or Sincerity will not save you that much money over staying at the Cosmo. The Cosmo is one of the best deals in Hong Kong. There is the matter of location. If you stay in Tsim Sha Tsui (TST), getting to top restaurants and tourist attractions is easier. You'll be able to stroll from your hotel to restaurants, museums and other attractions. That's a definite plus for TST hotels. The Cosmo tries to address this with a free shuttle bus. We ended up taking taxis or Hong Kong's fabulous subways. Hong Kong taxis are fairly cheap, about $40HKD from the Cosmo to TST. In reality, we found the Mongkok district itself appealing. It's a genuine working, bustling section of traditional Hong Kong, not a giant tourist trap. The area around the hotel, Ivy Street in particular, is a really nice neighborhood with some good restaurants. One of our favorite restaurants, One Dim Sum in Prince Edward, a long walk north of the hotel, must be one of the least expensive Michelin 1* restaurants anywhere. Three of us had a feast there for $135HKD, about 10% of what two of us paid for lunch at the upscale Sun Tung Luk -- and much more fun. Shopping for bargains in Mongkok is fun. It's not a long walk to the colorful Monk Kok shopping streets; sports shoe street, ladies market, and the computer and camera stores of Sai Yeung Choi Street. You'll find better bargains here than you will at the overpriced shops in TST. This is where the locals shop for bargains. I can't believe you'll not be satisfied with your stay at the Cosmo.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tracy69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at 3 different hotels during our trip and the concierge staff at this hotel were by far the most helpful and friendlist we came across - always there to open the door for us no matter what time of the day or night it was and very obliging. Location is not very close to main shopping area - Mongkok, quite a walk from the hotel. Shuttle bus runs every hour from the hotel up until about 10.30pm so very convenient although more stops/pick ups would have been good and on two occasions we had to get a taxi as the bus was full. Walk to Olympic MTR station not 4 minutes as stated on website - more like 15 minutes. Room was nice, modern and clean but very small and could not walk between the twin beds we had. Bathroom/toilet showed some wear considering website stated it opened mid 2010 and shower curtain not sufficient to prevent water from going all over the floor. Lack of hanging space for clothes was a problem. There is only one restaurant (Roman cuisine) and most items on room service menu are not available if you go down to the restaurant to 'eat in'. This is also where breakfast is served and staff at restaurant not at all friendly. We arrived 45 minutes are breakfast opened and there were empty dishes and when we asked if there was any bacon (as there was a dish with a sign showing bacon) we were told we were too late and the bacon was finished! However the next morning we were quite late arriving for breakfast yet there was bacon in the dish. Also asked for marmalade on our last morning at the hotel (which had been available all the other days) and were told that 'what we have is in the dish'. Very disappointing attitude from staff. McDonalds and 7-11 across the road but not much else in close vicinity. Apart from rude restaurant staff and small room, overall hotel cleanliness and concierge staff wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shermianz
Reviews.Content: Spent weeks on tripadvisor before deciding on Cosmo Hotel Mongkok. It was the few hotel within my budget with a MTR within 5-10mins walk. It also provides shuttle bus to mongkok and kowloon airport express station so it's real convenient! Actually, Mongkok is also within a walkable distance away.. 15mins? if you know how to walk or just use google map! Room was small but no complaints about it since most hotels in HK have small rooms.. bed is comfy with a good view at 19th storey. Complimentary breakfast was provided as well, the variety was not bad.. good enough to fill your tummies before u head out for some shopping/sight-seeing before brunch. 7-11 and McDonald's are just a min away from the hotel.The staff were very friendly as well. Most probably, I'll return to Cosmo Hotel Mongkok if I visit HK again.

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Sam_SPhils
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and everything was just perfect. We were upgraded to suite upon arrival and the staff was very helpful. They understood English quite well. The suite was spacious, clean and new. There's a tub in the bathroom, two flatscreen TV's and a very comfy and cozy bed. Not to mention a beautiful view. The wi-fi though is not free inside the room. Although you can use it for free in the lobby downstairs. It didn't really matter to us. The neighborhood is quiet since it's not in the metro area. But everything you need is just around the corner. There's a 711 in front, lots of authentic and very affordable HK dimsum and dumplings restaurants, grocery stores and even McDonald's. Overall, our stay was very lovely and we will definitely come back the next time we're in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: GordonandMichael
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location in the heart of Mongkok and easy to find from the Olympic metro station. Check in was quick and efficient. Good buffet breakfast included in the price. The rooms are small though with very little hanging or drawer space. But what space there was was well used and quirkily designed. This is Hong Kong afterall and with space at a premium, you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: The staff were very supportive and helpful as we went to Hong Kong urgently for personal reasons. The rooms were well maintained, bright and cheerful as were the services staff and reception staff. Highly recommended for people who have never been to Hong Kong before.

Reviews.Title: “Not so near, not so far, but the shuttle bus helps”
Reviews.Author: spiderpua
Reviews.Content: Overall pleasant stay. Hotel is located not very near the main road (Nathan Road), but its within walking distance of about 15 mins. Road can get rather quiet in the late night(about 11pm). Some nice local restaurants along the way to Nathan Road during the evening. Very convenient shuttle bus service, that plies between Langham Place, Canton Road(China Macau Ferry terminal), Kowloon MTR(City check in) and back again to hotel. Only 1 hiccup being that the front desk lady wanted to charge me for a bottle of water from the minibar that had been opened. But it was not touched by me, the look from her face did not seem that she beleived me as she said to me again that housekeeping had checked and it was opened. Anyhow they did a rebate on that, and it was settled. Concierge were wonderful and very attentive. They would come to you like hawks the moment they saw you with a luggage bag. Which i found good. Most front desk not very smiley except for a girl named Kathy or Kathey which had a smiley face. Overall fantastic for a 3star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Rachel L
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 5 night stay with my partner in the beginning of January 2012. Prior to our arrival, i emailed the hotel regarding my request to have a room above level 18 and away from the elevator. All of these requests were met and we even had a room with a lovely view. The room may not be exceptionally big, but it was really really cosy. In comparison to many other hotels in Mongkok, this was a real treat. Not forgetting that the interior design of the room is modern, comfortable and the brilliant use of mirrors gave the illusion of a larger room. The bed was really comfortable except for the fact that it was a little short. i could toss and turn during the night and wake up with my feet dangling off the bed. The pillows were a little too flat and soft but the hotel staffs were really accommodating in our requests for extra pillows. There may be no heating in the room however that wasn't much of an issue. (We are not talking about snowing countries here). The blanket was really really thick, soft and comfy. Kept us so snug and warm within. The bathroom was extremely clean and the shower head was strong and powerful. It was an enjoyment returning 'home' to stand under the powerful shower head blasting hot soothing water after a whole day of exploring in chilly temperature. Housekeeping staffs were friendly and service was good. The staffs in the hotel are pretty helpful and polite compared to majority of the hk population. A first time traveller might want to note that in hong kong, unless you can speak fluent cantonese, most people on the streets are rather impatient to help with directions. Many times, we were shouted at ,in cantonese, by shop owners. Therefore, the hotel staffs service standards are really commendable. Olympic Station is actually not a very short walk away from the hotel. I would recommend everyone to walk to mongkok because its just a mere 10 minutes walk away and 3 minutes drive away. If you dislike walking, you can take a taxi to mongkok station at a small price of 18 to 20(peak/off-peak hour) hong kong dollars. which is very very cheap! The hotel is surround by housing estates, 24 hrs convenience shops (7-11), small eateries(open till 3am) and supermarkets. I really really love staying in this district. It is a refreshing change from staying in hustling and bustling districts such as mongkok and TST. The human traffic is crazy. This hotel is extremely value for money as it is difficult to find hotel with such standards at such price. One of the few reasons why i had such fond memories in hong kong is due to this awesome hotel! I am already planning my next trip to hong kong and i am definitely returning again! i hope i will be able to get the same room as i did for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Waikee
Reviews.Content: We requested a room on the upper floor and away from the elevator and that was exactly what we got. While the standard room is small, we found it to be efficient and functional but the bathroom was not designed with privacy in mind. Couples are okay. There is an in room charge for internet but the hotel lobby has free internet connection but it does get crowded and lobby furniture arrangement is funky. The hotel is good 10 minutes walk to the nearest MTR station but the hotel offeres free shuttle to Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui. There are numerous eateries around the hotel and a 24 hour McDonald opposite. The hotel services are good and everybody has a smile to greet you. Next time we're in Hong Kong we'll stay here again. Well done, Cosmo Mongkok!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean but a little off location”
Reviews.Author: C H
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights at Cosmo Mongkok in January 2012. We stayed in a family Quad room, the room is not big, however, the design and layout make use of most spaces. There is even a pull-out half table. There is no chair in the room except for a little makeup stool. The beds are comfortable, lighting and air-conditioning and ventilation is not bad. The shower room is big, there is no tub but a big walk-in shower stall that can fit four at the same time. It is funny that the sink in the bathroom is ridulous small compare to the size of the bathroom; it is installed very low and is designed for small children. Ceiling in the room is high. There is a 30-inch flat screen Olivia TV, quality not good. Location of the hotel is a little off, the shuttle bus is once every hour. It is a good 10 minutes walk to major transportation linesand MTR. May be that's why the price of this hotel is lower than comparable ones in better location. Our deal came with a buffet breakfast which was decent. A mixture of Chinese and western breakfast. If you don't mind the location, this hotel provide good value for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, nice and clean, location ok”
Reviews.Author: giraffez
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Superior Twin Room. Room is small as expected, just enough to put two luggage, one beside the window panel and one on the suitcase rack. Room had ceiling to floor windows with electronic controlled blinds which was pretty cool. Decor was modern, bed was firm and comfy. Bathroom only had shower which was okay for me as I don't use bathtubs. The one thing i didn't like is the shower pressure, it was very soft.... too soft for a nice hot shower at the end of a long walking day. And the shower lock that holds the shower handle I think was broken so we couldn't adjust the height, it just kept sliding down. Hairdryer pressure was soft as well so if this bothers you, bring your own. The staff are young and helpful and attire is well presented. Room had free bottled water. No wifi in the room and even if you brought a sim card (which is dirt cheap), you can't access it within the room - lobby and restaurant had free wifi. I purchased a HKD48 sim card (paid HK38 - had a HKD10 voucher when i brought the HK airport express travel pass) - the card had HKD48 and had a HKD10 free top up plus 30 min free wifi session. I was in HK for 5 days and made many many local calls, had HKD20+ left when i left HK (and i didn't even end up using the top up card) My room came with complementary breakfast, the selection wasn't huge and flashy but the quality was surprisingly good. There was an omelete station but no chef to be found to make it on some days. Our clothes also smell like the kitchen after dining in the restaurant. We had a light breakfast so we could sample the HK food! A lot of chit chat between the waiters when they had nothing to do which could seem quite unprofessional however, they were quick to clear the tables (but not too quick with refills). The hotel has free hourly shuttle buses that takes you to Mongkok station, tsim tsa tsui, kowloon airport express station. These buses are usually packed full in the morning so be quick to go down as once the bus is full, they will not allow you onto the bus. I think it would be good if the hotel would provide the shuttle every half hour knowing that a lot of people miss out on the buses in the mornings. Nevertheless, Olympic station is about a 8 minute walk away (not 4 mins) and Mongkok is quite a bit of distance away. A taxi ride to Mong Kok is roughly HKD20 + HKD5 per luggage. Beware that around 3-4pm, taxi drivers may refuse to take you because of the short distance... I found out this is the time they change shifts. Olympic station also has a massive shopping mall with a cinema. There are several 24 hour convenience store around, two supermarkets and plenty of restaurants. A good congee place is just across the road. Very very very slow elevators as many people have mentioned - its true! Quite an expensive hotel but hotels in HK are expensive. But overall a good hotel

Reviews.Title: ““Simple and Convienient"”
Reviews.Author: yngamie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Mongkok centre and an MTR station with about 10minutes walk. Lots of local food stalls, restaurant, pharmacy and pretty convienient. Friendly and welcoming staff. Free internet in the lobby area but runnning quite slow. Room was pretty small but neat. Only thing i don't like was the bedsheet seems quite dusty><

Reviews.Title: “everything you need for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: DavidGHooper
Reviews.Content: Having come in from Bangkok, where hotels are very reasonable, Hong Kong is expensive. The hotel we used to stay at is now £200 (US$300) per night. We had to be in the Kowloon area and we spotted this one at about US110 per night. It was a mixture of pleasure and business. Again compared to BKK , the room was very small, with a standard double bed, we joked that the room is the same size as the bed in BKK (not quite true). But it had everything, it was fantastically laid out. Had all IT tools you could ask for. The shower was best I have had for years. Again if small shower cubicle compared to some. Breakfast was, business like rather than a great experience. It had a good business lounge which had everything you could need. The staff were very friendly and professional. At least 50% of the guests were of Chinese origin, which is how it should be. We will be back to HK again in April and will definitely be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “No free luggauge storage, won't come again”
Reviews.Author: Donna R
Reviews.Content: I had stayed there last year with pleasant experience, free luggage storage and daily free newspaper. However, I stayed there once again this year and wanted to leave a luggage until I come back in 25 days and stay there again. This time I was asked to pay luggauge storage fee hk$30 per day without prior notice or any clear notification around hotel. I was shocked by this unreasonable request and luckily I have friends in hk to keep my luggauge but it should be nightmare for visitor who has no choice to pay. By the way, I was waken up by the noise of tv from my neighbor in the middle of night due to the thin wall. Next day I complaint to the receptionist but she just asked me to call the front desk when it happened again without any proper assistance, e.g. To leave message to that tenant to keep quiet at night. That is really terrible for traveller whose sleeping is interrupted in the middle of night and not able to sleep again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luiluiyeng
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with restaurants and supermarket around, good shuttle bus service with super friendly bus driver, speedy internet speed but only available at the lobby, will be perfect if room got free wifi. clean and good view from room.lobby staffs are friendly and effective too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Techboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the cheaper places in Hong Kong. We payed $125 per night by booking directly though the hotel website which included a 25% discount for advance and prepaid booking. It's not technically in Mongkok but Tai Kok Tsui area. Couldn't check in right away as our room wasn't ready yet, there are many local restaurants around the hotel. Had free wifi internet access but still need to pay $12HKD service charge. When I checked in I misheard the reception and thought it was $120 HKD service charge to use wifi in the room, so didn't use it the first few days. Wifi was good in the room with no access issue. Since this is such a small amount the hotel should just incur the service charge. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from Olympic Station and 15 minutes from Mongkok Station. The staff were friendly and helpful. Stayed in a superior with two single beds. The rooms are small but that's expected for the price you pay in Hong Kong. TV had a good selection of channels with Egnlish, Cantonese and Mandarin. We had a room on the 20th floor (technically 17th) with a nice view of the mountains. Discovered that one of the bedsheets had a stain on it which housekeeping promptly replaced. Didn't find the lifts to be too long of a wait. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not likely to return”
Reviews.Author: K G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cosmo Mong Kok for New Years Eve. I had previously emailed the hotel and requested a room as high as possible and away from the elevator (I'm a light sleeper), as well as my bed preference. Needless to say, I was on a low floor, directly opposite to the elevator, and without my preferred bed type; I didn't sleep well due to the elevated roadway under my window. Oh, and the hotel is currently under renovation. It took several calls to Housekeeping to ensure that my room was properly refreshed each day with towels and water. While other posters commented that the MTR was close by, I would disagree. There are many other hotels in Kowloon that are much closer to the MTR. There are several odd turns required to get to Mong Kok MTR, and walking to Olympic MTR at night didn't feel as safe (less people around). I made two local phone calls, which ended up costing me 10 HKD (5 HKD each). It wasn't that this was expensive, but it was moreso the principle that I was charged for a local phone call. It left a bad taste at check out, especially after waiting for one of two elevators that service 285 hotel rooms on 27 floors. The staff were friendly and helpful with directions. No complaints there. If you are looking for a hotel with breakfast and you don't mind a little noise and location isn't really important, the Cosmo Mong Kok is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - slow lift”
Reviews.Author: WfromSingapore
Reviews.Content: Location is good with an MTR station close by. There are lots of places to eat near by and it does not take you long to get where other places in Hong Kong. It was supposed to have a 24 hour gym but this was out of action when we went there. Rooms were clean and large enough without being exceptionally comfortable. The biggest complaint are the lifts. There are 2 lifts and they are very very slow. If you stay there you need to plan in advance when you wish to traverse from your floor to the lobby and vice versa.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: fishman732
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 4 people. Excellent service and good impression upon check-in as the Front Desk Mgr briefed me the facilities provided and popular location and direction. New and room look cosy and clean. The room space fully optimized and modern setting. Room facilities are excellent, except for the sink in the bathroom, is abit small, although the bathroom has more than suffiicient space for a larger sink.

Reviews.Title: “New and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yeo G
Reviews.Content: New hotel location not very convenient but a lot of eatery around. I booked cosmorganic room hoping that it can accommodate myself, my husband and my 5 year old kid. I email and personally call the hotel reservation dept to ask for a king size bed. However the staff was not diplomatic and told that room can only accommodate max 2 persons so I have to book another room for 3 of us. I was so shocked as when I stay In other hotel, the hotel will let me have extra bed for my kid without charge. They insisted that it's their policy and that I should have read the terms before booking. But my kid is only 5 years old? When I finally reach the hotel they gave me a queen size bed and insist that it was a king size bed. When confronted they say that they don't have king size bed. I don't even have the good quality slippers as stated in the website for Cosmorganic room. I felt even more cheated when I found out that my friend who has booked 2 standard room was upgraded to studio air by the hotel automatically. Meaning Cosmorganic room is not exclusive for the price paid. I must say that the bellboys are very helpful, polite and after leaving the hotel, I can still remember the attitude possessed by the reservation dept. hope that hotel could train staff to be diplomatic when handling customer and not be bound by policy. I will try other hotel in future. This is my 2nd trip to hk in 2011. My first trip with icon hotel is a big contrast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and new”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_travel
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD... The hotel is a newer property so its not bad. Was sharing the room with my parents so had a suite on the 25th floor. The sofa-bed is pretty comfy and there is a flat screen tv in the living room and bedroom. There is a very small eating area but I guess it is a good size room in land scarce HK. TV selections is great and there is a great view of the surrounding area since we are so high up. Furnishing are modern and minimalistics. The bathing tub is built into the floor so your feet kind of step downward when you go in. The rainshower and showerhead are not bad although the bathroom glass door cannot seemed to close 100 percent. The staff are nice and they try to accomodate your questions THE AVERAGE Buffet breakfast was included. While selection is ok, it did not change much over the 3 days I was there. The shuttle service was nice. However, Olympic Station is a couple of blocks away but that does make it convenient to go to places like Disneyland and Tung Chong. Also, it is easy to get to Mongkok main area (langham place shopping centre and ladies market) on foot (abt 10 min walk) or cab (abt HK20, the meter never even jumped at all) THE BAD the lifts are always packed. Only 2 lifts and it is a hassle to get down or up. Internet connections is only free in the lobby and apparently, the hotel package did not include internet in the room and in a place like HK where there are quite a few places with wifi, this seemed rather harsh. And I got issues with the locations as I feel that being that far away from the MTR is just totally inconvenient, especially when you can't get the cab Conclusion: Not a bad hotel if it fits your budget. You have to love to stay in a 'local' area. And if you dont mind walking a fair distance to MTR or know how to take the mini buses... then this is a good fit.

Reviews.Title: “good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: lim002
Reviews.Content: Stay twice during recent asian trip. very satisfied with services.Bell boys very helpful. However, frontdesk personels and breakfast hostesses were very robotic. No smiles or welcome good-mornings or thank yous. Need to train them to smile a little.

Reviews.Title: “Good for any purpose”
Reviews.Author: deiredre
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel two times, 4 nights per visit. Receptions and crews are friendly and good at English. Room was not spacious but but clean and new. Amenity was also had. it was harsh that network access was charged. Mongkok area is not the best place for sightseers, but the area was opened over night so it would convenient. breakfast was not so good but not bad. Generally speaking, this hotel would be good for any purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Newer Hotel, Large Rooms for HK, Far from Train”
Reviews.Author: CrabisGOOD
Reviews.Content: Overall, I really enjoyed our stay at the Cosmo Hotel because the hotel itself is newer. The service is good and the rooms were pretty big for HK standards. I never had a chance to try out the restaurant food, but I heard you cannot sit in there if you don't order something. There are a lot of cheap eats outside the hotel, which is good when you need to grab something on the go, but the food was just ok. It definitely wasn't the amazing flavor that I heard about in HK. I love Cantonese style Chinese food too! There's a McDonald's across the street too for your morning coffee. It's really strong. The value of the price paid was very reasonable and there is a free shuttle that takes you to the Mongkok train station. My real complaints are... -The wifi was only free in the lobby and very expensive in the rooms. - The shuttle filled up very fast and often there wasn't enough room for us. They don't allow standing. -The location of the hotel is at least a 15-20 minute fast paced walk from any train station. This makes it hard if you are traveling with someone older. - The carpets were vacuumed and cleaned, but there were a lot of stains on the floor. Also there was a cockroach in one of our 4 rooms. Overall based on value, cleanliness, and service, I would recommend the hotel for a younger groups who don't mind the walk.

Reviews.Title: “New and Clean”
Reviews.Author: PCTKL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite on the 27th floor for seven nights. The suite had a double bed and two sofa beds, definitely big enough for my family of two adults and two children. We also had an excellent, unblocked view from our ceiling height window. Breakfast was nothing to shout about but staff were friendly and service was prompt. Housekeeping was especially helpful too. They could really use an additional lift though, the lifts were always packed during the peak hours. We were lucky to be on the uppermost floor and always had an empty lift on our floor. The walk from the nearest Olympia MTR station was about 8-10 minutes. However, it was mostly a covered walkway. The hotel is conveniently located near shops, restaurants, McDonald and convenience stores. Generally, my family is happy with our stay and will surely return to this hotel during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Riversight
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and myself stayed at Cosmo Mongkok from 4-8 Dec. We had a high floor smoke-free superior room. The room was clean and had a nice ambience. The full height windows also offered a pleasant view of the surroundings. Service was in general prompt and professional. The staff were accomodating to our request to have a baby cot in the room and our 1 year-old daughter slept reasonably well in it. The Olympic MTR Station is within a 10-min walk. For families with young children like ours, you may wish to take advantage of the hotel's shuttle bus service to get to the more convenient Mong Kok MTR and shopping districts. Overall, our stay was a pleasant experience and we will definitely consider Cosmo again next time.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: ranjit s
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the service and the room size as well as the location given the price i paid the room was above my expectionService was very good as well as the food and the bed was like sleeping on air.the whole hotel has a very fresh smell.most important the staff were very polite and helpfull need heip,just e-mail to agustine cheung assistant front office manager,she is always goes all the way to help all the guest.dont be fool by the size of the hotel from the outside,its whats on the inside that counts.ranjit singh room 1801.thank you cosmo thank you very very much.

Reviews.Title: “Worth for the value”
Reviews.Author: NicTF
Reviews.Content: This trip to Hong Kong was a family vacay and we stayed there for 3 nights. My hubby and I stayed in their standard room which is rather small and just nice for couple. Small bathroom as well; but thanks to their powerful shower which soothe away the tiredness. Big window unfortunately facing the opposite building which is too closed. Thus, the blind was down whole day. My sis and family stayed in their suite which consists of one double bed and two single beds. Spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 kids. Big bathroom but come with a small vanity, weird design! 27 floors with 2 lifts ain't enough. You tend to wait longer during peak hour. The staff are helpful and friendly. Fast check-in and check-out; however, the girls at front desk could have more smiles on their face. It is definitely more than 4 mins walk from Olympic station to the hotel. However, the pedestrian bridge which link almost all the way is a plus point. Shuttle bus always on time. There are plenty of food outlets and convenience stores around. A 24-hr McDonald's which is just across the road, sweep away your homesick. Yes, I do believe McDonald's has become the international cuisine - a home meal for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: Tons36
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 4 days. Limo pick up booked from the hotel arrived on time. The staff at the hotel upon arriving were very accomodating. Concierge was very helpful on helping us book our tour for the next day despite the last minute reservations and suggested great locations to go to. The room was very clean with all basic amenities including an ipod dock. Room wifi can be purchased and free at the lobby and restaurants. Location is very safe and close to the olympic MTR station, ladies night market, temple market and plenty of night life in the area. Would surely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “My Trip”
Reviews.Author: Anthony A
Reviews.Content: My trip to Cosmo was a great trip. The Hotel is one of the best I have been to. It is very close to the Olympic MTR and still walking distance to Mongkok MTR. All the employees make you feel welcomed, and cant speak highly enough of this place. There are only a few issues with the hotel. 1. Beds too small - I am 6'4" and I had my calf's over the edge of the bed. 2. Beds too hard - Every morning my GF and I woke up with a sore bed, honestly we couldn't wait until we got back to our own beds back home. 3. Lift too slow - It would be a good idea to make the lifts faster or have 1 lift for people between level 1 and 10 and the other lift for customers between 11 and 24 (inc Ground and Restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deanten
Reviews.Content: We stayed in twin room at the end of November, booking through the official hotel website. Yes, rooms are on the small side, but they are well-fitted and very groovy with great views. We had the buffet breakfast every morning on our 5 night stay and food of high quality with both western and chinese food plus beautiful fresh fruit. At 88HKD, it was great value. Mongkok is not far from anything, and the free shuttle is a great bonus, even at the end when you need to get to Kowloon Airport Express Line (Plus you can check-in at Kowloon Airport Express for your flight before you get on the train - saves doing it at HK airport - great idea). We ate every night in Mongkok area and found cheap, lovely eateries. Staff were very friendly/courteous and helpful - not always the case at some hotels. The lifts could take some time to arrive, as there are only two, but not really a major problem. There are plenty of shops across the road, including pharmacy, plus supermarket for snacks and cheap beer. We would certainly stay here again and recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: moneko
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is fairly new. It's somewhat close by a Olympic subway station (about 10 minutes walk). They do have shuttle bus to major subway stations. The shuttles run every hour or so. The room is a little small for the money I paid however. Even tho it's a little further away from the major Mongkok area, there are plenty of local small eateries around the hotel. If those places are not your taste, there is a McDonald's right in front. One thing that pisses me off is that when I book this hotel, they claims to have free internet access. However, when I'm inside my room, the wifi is locked and the LAN needs to paid in order to go online. I called the reception for the price, and the lady said it's going to be HKD$12 for 24 hours. After I went for lunch and came back to the reception and ask for the price again, they told me that it's HKD$140 for 24 hours. I ended up not paying for the internet because no one can tell me the correct answer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: HelloKitty0603
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and I have a wonderful stay during my trip to hong kong. The Wifi line at the lobby is fast. Friendly staff and the hotel provides free shuttle service to most of the mtr station. But the hotel only has 2 elevators which has limited space, so if in that morning a group of customers need to check out then you'll need to wait 10-15 minutes to get a ride. But overall I'll like to stay here again for my future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: hhejjas
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our honeymoon and we were quite satisfied with the Cosmo Hotel. The location is a little farther away, but we found everything in Hong Kong to be in walking distance, plus the hotel offers a free shuttle hourly I believe. There is lots to do and see nearby, and public transportation is great in this city. The hotel rooms are small, but nothing uncommon in Asia. The front staff were helpful and friendly also. We found the rooms to be clean and comfortable and liked the blackout style curtains and little reading lights attached to the headboard. There is no free internet in the rooms which is a bit of a nuisance, however, in the lobby you do have free access. It can be busy there, but we never had too much trouble finding a seat. There is also a 24 hour McDonalds across the street, which is convenient if you are hungry at odd hours.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable to a Fault”
Reviews.Author: firewatch
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely, the view was amazing, and the free buffet breakfast made my day. It was easy to walk to Olympic Station and the mall at Langham Place. But while the staff was perfect in a robotic way, I wish they had been a little more human. I understand that check-in doesn't start until 2, but when you see a guest waiting for an hour beforehand wouldn't it be nice to say "your room is ready now" at some point? At one breakfast a staff member interrupted my meal to demand my meal coupon -- which I'd just given to her co-worker. Nitpicky, but I just got a cold, inflexible vibe in general. Again, everything that mattered was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Convenient & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: fruittie
Reviews.Content: Location: It's approx 10-20mins walk from the hotel to the nearest Olympic MTR. walk across the road to Mcdonalds, past Mannings (Guardian) store and you'll be at the start of the bridge walkway. after that, its a breeze. To get to Mongkok for Ladies Market, its bus 18, just 2mins front of the hotel or 2mins towards the left side of the hotel. although the return trip is just 3 bus stops away from mongkok (take the bus 18 across Langham Palace, Mongkok Market), the route to mongkok from the hotel may take about 15stops as it goes thru the neighbourhood area. but really, its so convenient if you don't wanna walk to the MTR. There are restaurants all over the area beside the hotel, 7-eleven, 24hour cafe, mcdonalds, pizza & western food restaurant and a grocery store. Room: Comfort Room was clean, the housekeeping does that everyday too, mine was on the 25th floor, its quiet enough not to hear televisions from other guests but you can hear them chatting when they walk past. (encountered noisy families) toiletries from towels, shower gel & body lotions, tooth brushes, paste etc were provided. the room had wifi router which you could plug your laptop to using the lan cable provided. my room had an ipod/iphone speaker which you can plug your iphone to, very nice touch. mini refrigerator, safe with complimentary water. the room had a good view with automated blinds that you can keep close for privacy. i would think a couple with luggages may find the comfort room small as the walkable areas in the room may be blocked if you place the luggage on the floor. the bed was comfortable and lush. the room i had didn't have a closet. so comfort room would be good for single travelers Service: Staff could speak english, cantonese, mandarin I'm not sure about other languages, their service was prompt and good. Finally, yes, i would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “quad room review”
Reviews.Author: k0h
Reviews.Content: I did not read abt their quad room review thus give it a try for my family of 4. It was excellent and spacious and is exactly what we wanted. A double bed and 2 single bed. Mr Augustine and his team were very helpful and thoughtful thru our stay. Mr Augustine attend to our need and send little gift for the children personally and tat make their days. The shuttle bus is useful but is not a problem to hail as cab if u miss e bus. Food is everywhere around e hotel. I will come back and recommend to my friends. Well done

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but with some improvement needed”
Reviews.Author: meisiang
Reviews.Content: Generally, it was a pleasant stay here for 5 nights, but with some minor dissatisfaction. Here's my experience: Pros: ------ Location: It is not really near to MTR station. But hotel does provide shuttle bus hourly from hotel to Langham Place (near mongkok station) and few other places. Even if you miss the bus, you can always take a cab to & fro Mongkok station for HKD20, to & fro Tsim Sha Tsui for about HKD30-40 which is quite reasonable. Nothing much happening nearby but you won't have problem looking for food or 7-11 nearby, and McDonald 24-hours is just right opposite. Room: Although the room size is not that big, but it was clean and modern. The room is bright enough during day time with the wide glass windows. The thing i like the most is the shower. Room service does not include changing new bed sheet and linen daily by default, it is upon request but it shouldn't be any problem. Service: Front desk service is ok. Concierge staff were more friendly and helpful. Value: Booked this hotel 1 month earlier via their official website with 30% off for early bird promotion which save me a lot. But this promotion is not entitle for any cancellation, full payment has to be made upon booking, so make sure your trip is confirmed before choosing this promotion. Cons: ------- Location: Overall is ok with shuttle bus and taxi. But it would be better if the frequency of shuttle bus can increase from hourly to half hourly. Value: Using wifi in room are required to pay HKD12 for service tax per day per device (your phone/tablet/laptop) upon check out, but using wifi in lobby is free of charge. Most of the time, lobby is pack. Service: I requested 2 rooms at same floor during booking and it was confirmed via email from customer service. However, when we check in, we were given 2 rooms in separate floor instead during first night. Reason given was no room available. Apart from that, room service done is not standard daily. Sometimes no water and floor mat after room service, and I have to request manually to get it. I would say it is not really consistent as it only happened to 1 of our room while the other was ok. * The only unpleasant experience was during check out, they actually charge us for 7 login on certain day, which is impossible as we only used 1 phone for browsing for that day. The staff insist that was our usage and suspect that we use wifi with other phone or laptop and want us to pay. After showing the proof of our iphone's mac address, and some argument went on, the staff finally waived the extra charges for us. That's the only thing we are not really satisfied about. So please check your wifi usage when check out before paying blindly. Room: It will be nice if the room is bigger. Anyway, still a good hotel and still recommended for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean & nice with modern design”
Reviews.Author: BaliDriver
Reviews.Content: Before moved to Cosmo Hotel, i was staying in Royal Pacific. Compare with Royal Pacific Hotel, this hotel is 100% smoke free. Good thing about this hotel is :- 1. hotel provided the free shuttle services to the important stops 2. clean and tidy 3. front desk service is friendly However, the room is very small, esp the bathroom which i think only slim people can fit into the shower place. The sound proof is kind of bad as we can hear people talking very clearly from the room or even when you are walking along the corridor. If you are travel with family , please take the family suite. In terms of location, nothing much around that area. You can grab your food at the street opposite the hotels but don't expect something very fancy but there is one nice porridge restaurant (sifu) which is located along the path towards to the Olympic MRT station. The nearest MRT station is Olympic station, which is just about 7 mins walk from the hotel. This station is reside in the same MRT path to the Big Buddha and Disneyland located at Lantau Island without any interchanging station is required. Generally, it's still a recommended hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: kwokpeng
Reviews.Content: Very well decorated, but the price of S$250 a night was on the high side.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms in good location at affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: Lipany
Reviews.Content: Location: Good location in Mongkok, with Olympic MTR station only 5-10 mins walk. From there it is only 2 stops to Hong Kong station. For Ladies Market you can take a longer walk of 20 mins or simply catch a taxi at HKD 20. There is 24hrs McDonalds and a few shops and restaurants across the street as well. Rooms: I have booked a twin room with a colleague on a business trip. I think it is the smallest room I have ever stayed in. I guess the pictures speak for themselves. Two single beds with a small gap between and in front, so it enables you to walk around, but that's it. Dont bring more than 2 pieces of luggage or anything else, as there is definitely no space for this. The wardrobe is according to the size of the room, so for a weekend stay is fine, but anything longer will be big challenge. The bathroom is small too, while taking the shower you need to be careful not to open the curtain as with every move it might be the case. The bathroom is divided from the room by glass (this seems to be current trend in HK). Not much privacy if you are sharing with a colleague and in addition, even if you close the door, this still leave good gap, so your partner / colleague can hear and see everything by as good as no effort. TV has a few channels, one with decent movies and a couple of news channels in English. Little fridge and water kettle come handy. Service and cleanliness: The cleanliness of the hotel and rooms is however very good. The main lobby has a pleasant scent and the rooms are clean. I have accidentally spilled coffee in the room and the hotel wanted to charge me for cleaning the carpet. They do take this seriously. I have managed to get away without paying, but be careful as upon checkout they first check the room, before closing your bill. Hmmm,.... Bed linen and towels were clean, but towels would need soon replacement as they getting pretty thin. Service? Haven't experienced much of this, as I have spent most of the time out of the hotel, but the check-in was relatively fast (not too much friendliness though) and the check-out took ages (also due to the above mentioned). Restaurants: Haven't used. Overall: The hotel is not a bad option, if you are not spending any time in your hotel room and come here only to take a shower and sleep. I have paid HKD 3200 for 2 nights, which is definitely more than I was planning to spend, but this was over busy period in Hong Kong. I guess, price around HKD 1000 per night would be more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slersh
Reviews.Content: I booked the room very early and got a very good discount of 30%. My friend and I requested for a high floor room with good city view, but we got a room on the 8th floor (still with a decent view). Love the big windows which lets natural light shines through and the mirrors which help to make the small deluxe room looks more spacious and chic. We stayed four nights from 5-9 Nov and I am pretty happy with the hotel, especially the customer service. The staff are attentive and provide excellent customer service experience. They email to welcome you to HK the week before you fly, and even after you come back home, they drop you an email to thank you for your stay. While staying there, the staff at the concierge were attentive in helping us with our luggages, calling for taxis, opening the hotel lobby doors for us, and even taxi doors though we arrived a little off the main door of the hotel late at night. The only bane is that we faced a problem with the shower and had a difficult time explaining in English to them. But once they got it, the counter staff immediately deployed housekeeping to help and the problem was resolved in no time. Impressive. Some pros and cons of the hotel (more pros than cons): Pros: - Clean, chic and comfortable room - Cosmopolitan bath with rain shower head - Free and fast WIFI at hotel lobby - Free hourly shuttle service between hotel to Mongkok's Langham Place Mall, China Ferry Terminal (direct access to Macau) at Tsim Sha Shui, and Kowloon. - 24hour McDonald's and a small Vanguard supermarket across the street; very convenient. - Several restaurants around the area Cons: - The 5-10mins walk from Olympic MTR (Exit B) to the hotel is a major turn-off, especially when you are dead tired from a whole day out or if you lugged many shopping bags back. However, the walk is via a sheltered foot bridge and rather nice to take a slow stroll on - There is a HKD 12 charge per 24hours use of WIFI for each electronic device in the room, which was highlighted to us upfront but was miscommunicated as a one-time charge, but luckily we clarified and know it was a per day charge. This service should be made free to all staying guests. - The bathroom's glass door is too transparent and could be tinted to make it opaque. - More hangers could be provided and pillows were too soft for me to sleep comfortably

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Cosmo Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: ksl71
Reviews.Content: I was there from 4 -7 Nov 2011. Overall the hotel was quite satisfied except for the Hotel Lobby was too warm, air-con was not powerful enough at the lobby to accommodate large crowd at the lobby. The staffs were quite helpful, and I personally like the shuttle bus sevices which takes us to the mongkok station, and even tho w/o the shuttle bus the nearest mtr station is Olympic which is just abt 10 mins walk. We had a deluxe room but it's not too big, the wardrobe was an open concept wardrobe which only allows you to hang abt 4pcs of clothes, they have given us a sewing kit but w/o scissor; there was no plates for the teacups or for us to contain our food in the room. There was 2 lifts sevicing the 27 floors, it was too slow and at times the lift was too pack w guests and we had to wait for another probably 5-10 mins for the next empty lift.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Charmedshirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed for nine nights in this hotel. Location is fabulous as it's surrounded with delicious food stall, everything is within reach. MTR station is about 10 minutes walk away, macdonald is just across the street, and hotel provide shuttle bus to other MTR stations. For a 4 stars hotel the price is really reasonable and room comes with beautiful views. My boyfriend and i never fail to say good morning and good night to Hong Kong during our stay there. Wifi connection provided at the lobby is fast and staff are friendly and polite. If i ever get to go back to Hong Kong again, which i think i will, i will for sure book cosmo mongkok again.

Reviews.Title: “OK to stay”
Reviews.Author: Michelle C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very small but liveable. ok to stay but the location is very inconvenient. The closest MTR is about 10-15 minutes walk away...pretty annoying when you've done a few hours of shopping and walking already, especially when the weather is hot and humid!!! However, catching a taxi is another option...not that expensive at all. WiFi is not for free...it states complimentary first 24hrs but NOPE...not true!! We had 2 iPads and both logged on in the same room number and was charged twice $12HKD x2...not expensive however, felt cheated. The only thumbs up were the staff....very helpful and nice to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “Basic. Good staff. Clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: sssshhhh80
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights whilst travelling by myself in Hong Kong after my friend had gone home. It is a little out of the way, and the walk from Olympic MTR station was a little uncomfortable the first time. It is surrounded by some run down buildings, but show me a place in HK that isn't!! But once I had checked in I felt very comfortable and safe. The shuttle bus runs every hour looping from the hotel to Mong Kok station, TST, Kowloon, and back. Admittedly, in the peak times, a couple of people might have missed out on places on the bus, but as long as you go there a few minutes early, you were assured a spot. And, in HK, taxis are so cheap, it shouldn't be a bother. The rooms are small, but it is HK. Everything that needed to be there was there, and in good working order, so no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “@ Cosmo Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: aman2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nites.. It was a small cosy stay experience with Cosmo MongKok.. The rooms are rather small, with additional of 1 big luggage placed in the room, there ain't much space left for walking around.. However, it is totally understandable for Hong Kong standard. The staffs are friendly, when we approached them to ask for directions.. There is also bus shutter for guests to a few shopping malls & Mong Kok train station which is a plus point.. - Suggestion to Cosmo : Maybe can increase the trips of buses as currently is 45min interval per trip and the mini bus is rather small for guests who are carrying a few bulky luggages to the train station (Kowloon).. Location wise is good, as it is located in the cross junction, whereby there are Macdonald, Supermart, Watson & some local food restaurants available.. Overall, the services are good.. Will stay there if we are going to Hong Kong again. :)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: lypinternational
Reviews.Content: october 2011, stayed at cosmo for ten days with small child, staff are fantastic, we really appreciated their extra service when we needed it, front desk staff Augustine went out of his way to provide extra service, concierge has free hk maps and boundless hk knowledge which they are happy to share, will be returning to this hotel, location is easy walk to olympic mrt and amongst plenty of local restaurants, great place to base yourself in hk, opposite small playground for kids, hotel has own free shuttle bus

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable small room and high price”
Reviews.Author: Jack D
Reviews.Content: I went to Hong Kong and decided to stay in Cosmo Hotel as photos in website look like a normal hotel, but I was really disappointed to pay HKD1150 foo a small room 3x4 meters included toilet. Position is quite convenient but shuttle bus service has not frequent schedule and moreover, shuttle is small and often not enough for all guests that need to wait 1 hour for next shuttle or go by taxi. Internet is only in lobby and it's funny to see in night time all guest set down on the floor as not enough seat for everybody need to check internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality Hotel with Excellent Service at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Tommy111111
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Cosmo Hotel Mongkok to anyone travelling and staying in Hongkong. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, in Oct and another 4 nights in Nov 2011. The rooms are reasonably sized for the price compared to other hotels in Hongkong. The rooms, bathroom, toilet and wash basin area are good sized, clean and well maintained. The decor looks quiet new. The staff are very friendly, helpful and polite. They speak english very well compared to some smaller hotels. The best service this hotel provides is the FREE shuttle bus that runs hourly and stops at the following stops: - The Hotel - Mongkok station (Langham Place) - China Hongkong Ferry Terminal - Kowloon Station (express train to airport) We booked online through the Cosmo Mongkok hotel's webiste. By booking in advance on their website, you can get good early bird discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo Kowloon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandyNowra
Reviews.Content: The Cosmo is in a ideal location, near Olympic MTR station and is a short walk to the Mongkok shopping area. The regular, free shuttle bus to the ferry terminal, the Airport Express Station and the shopping centres came in very handy, especially getting back at night. The rooms are clean but very small, and the view from our room on the 27th floor was fantastic at night. The staff were friendly and helpful. There was a great little bakery just across the road, along with a small supermarket. We had the best dim sum at a local restaurant, which was recommended by staff, in the New Kowloon Plaza, just down the road. Would definately stay there again, even though its not in the heart of Kowloon, it was a quiet, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: tinamiranda
Reviews.Content: I just want to share our experience in terms of travelling from the airport to this hotel, and from the hotel to the other parts of Hongkong. Basically, this is our third time in hongkong and we are quite dependent on our MTR octopus card. For new travelers to Hongkong, I would still recommend for you to buy the MTR Octopus card to save on money and hassle of getting coins to buy the single journey card. Okay, here is the guide: 1. For those who are extremely dependent on the MTR and are not carrying too many luggage, what you can do is just take the Airport Express Train and get off the Tsing Yi station. There is a connecting train there going to the Olympic Station, which you need to take. When you reach Olympic, get off the train and ask where is Harbour Green (it's like a condominium type building that has a network of walkways). Just take this walkway until you reach the bridge/exit to Ivy Street. Basically, this walk from the Olympic Station up to the exit of the walkway would be around 5-10 minutes depending on your walking. Upon reaching the exit, just go down the stairs (or take the lift) until you reach ground level. Walk forward Ivy street. You'll pass by some Thai restaurants, a 7-11, a MacDonald's. By the time you reach MacDonald's, you'll definitely see Cosmo. 2. You can also take the Airport Express Train. Then get off Kowloon station. Cosmo Hotel Shuttle goes there at an hour's interval. You just have to coordinate with the hotel the exact time when the shuttle bus would be there and ask them the pick up point. Anyway, the Kowloon Station has a lot of shops so you could just go around and shop awhile while waiting for the bus. The staff at Cosmo hotel are generally polite and kind. I appreciate their punctuality and fast service. If asked, whether I'll stay at Cosmo again, I probably will because of the good service, however traveling from the hotel to other parts of the city is quite a challenge. 1. You could take the MTR and reach prime destinations from the Olympic Station. 2. You could take the Cosmo Shuttle which goes around the city and has strategic drop off points: The Langham Place (where you could go to for your MongKok shopping; The China City Harbour (where the China Ferry Terminal going to Macau is) (this is also a good place to shop because of the many outlet stores); and the Kowloon Station (which is connected to shopping outlets). 3. If you like walking, you can walk to MongKok's Fa Yuen (Sporting Goods Market) in 15-30 minutes. 4. There is also a huge shopping mall at the Olympic Station which is called the Olympian.

Reviews.Title: “3 star boutique hotel with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: ksleong
Reviews.Content: Last month, I stayed at Cosmo Mongkok Hotel for 5 days 4 nights. I book a 'free and easy' trip (flight & Accommodation & airport transfer) from my travel agent. It includes free half day city tour. I was booked initially for a 4 star hotel in Mongkok area but it was fully booked and I settled for Cosmos Mongkok. This is not my first time to Hongkong - been there many times in the past many years. But I must say that Cosmos gave me, my wife and my teenage son a wonderful experience from start to the end. Unfortunately, the gym was closed for renovation and did not have the chance to try it out and include in the review. Cosmos is a new boutique hotel, about one year old. We arrived at the hotel close to midnight. The concierge staff were waiting at the door to welcome us and carried out luggage up to the room. The registration was speedy. I guess there were not many guests checking in at that time. The room was a very pleasant surprise. When we booked the hotel, we emphasized to the travel agent that we wanted a 'big' room that can sleep three and can hold 3 x 28" big luggage bag (for shopping spree). We were given a 'family room' - a queen size bed plus a small living room area that can accommodate a double sofa bed. The living room is cleverly partitioned by a swivel 42" LCD TV(I think it is 42") to get some privacy. My wife & I took the queen and my son took the sofa bed. By HK hotel standard, the space that we have gotten is very generous for a 3 star boutique hotel. It would be the space of a junior suite in a 5 star hotel. I understand later from the chambermaid that there are limited number of family room and they are always full. I peeped into one of the empty standard room and found that the extra space that I have gotten is the living area and the large space in front of the entrance. Also, my toilet and bath is very much bigger than the standard room. Another reason why the room is 'big' is that it caters to the physically challenged as well. There is ample space for wheelchair to move around and the toilet can accommodate a wheel chair comfortably. The only downside is that the wash basin is very tiny - meant for the wheelchair user to reach. Other than that every thing is fine. The decor is cosy as expected of a boutique hotel. The rooms and sheets are clean. You have to pay for wi-fi in the room. However, there is a promotion for free wi-fi in the room if you book your room online. Not to worry if the promotion is over. There is free wi-fi at the lobby. The lobby can get crowded as many guests would gather there to make use of the free wi-fi. So, bring along your netbook, notebook, smartphone and tablet. The hotel is located at the corner of the main road and side road. There is a 24 hours Mcdonald right across the road. There are several local eateries along the side road that operate till late in the night. For those who cannot read Chinese, there are photos of the food in the menu for foreigners. Ask for the English menu and confirm the food price and write it down to avoid any disputes when you are settling the bill. Basically the eateries are used to having foreigners and they are all generally honest - unlike in some other countries, Also, the eateries are manned by younger folks that can speak English. There are 2 x 24 hours 7-11 convenience store nearby - one on the main road and one near the eateries. Because of the regular car and human traffic along both roads, it is safe to move around even late at night. In the daytime, there are a few mini-marts around the hotel. So, no worries of getting hungry or thirsty at any time of the day or night. The nearest MTR station is about 15 mins walk. Cosmos provides regular shuttle bus to downtown shopping district. So, you don't have to really walk to the MTR. There are 3 stops points. Stop at sky 100 (currently the latest tallest building in HK) for luxury shopping and visit the observation tower. You get a very good 360 degree view of the whole HK. You can rent the commentary device that gives a good description of the various landmark. Another stop is the China Ferry Terminal Mall where you can catch the ferry to Macau or Zuhai. There are several branded factory outlets there. Before I forget, every Friday night, there is a laser show at the waterfront. It is a synchorisation of music, lights and laser by the many waterfront buildings. You can catch the half hour show along the Victoria Harbour or Avenue of Stars. It starts at 8 pm. Coming back to Cosmos, the concierge staff are very alert always looking out guests coming in and out of the hotel. They will always smile and greet you and hold the doors for you. They are always ready to wave down a taxi for you if you require one. I ordered some boxes of HK 'wife' biscuits to be delivered to Cosmos. The Concierge kept them for me and left a note in my room to pick up the purchase from the Conciergie.
