The Concierge Manager King Li (or it is Ling?) assisted me in placing order for US$ 100 worth of HK sour snacks with the vendor. I handed the HK$ equivalent to King to pass it to the Vendor. He was very professional and the order was duly delivered to the hotel with a proper receipt from the vendor. Credos to King and his team! Keep it up. There are 2 famous local chain restaurants near Cosmos. One is the popular Chinese 'tim-sum; chain and the other is the popular roast goose restaurant chain Chan Kee - both are 'must try' Chinese delicacies. The Chinese tim sum chain called 'Toh Hiang' (my own linguistic translation) does not have an English name. The restaurant is just 2 buildings away located at Old Kowloon Plaza (if I am not wrong). The tim sum and al carte menu are popular with the locals. You should try it if you have not eaten tim-sum before. For those who have eaten tim sum, you will find that their quality of food is still good and consistent. For roast goose, please steer clear of the touristy overpriced Yung Kee. I will write a review of my bad experience with Yung Kee shortly. Chan Kee was recommended to me by my HK office colleague. I asked her where do locals go for roast goose. She recommended Chan Kee to me and she was absolutely right! The standard of roast goose is good crisp pn the outside and tender on the inside. So good that I ordered one takeaway goose to take home and I hand carried the goose up the plane. Please check your customs regulations before you bring any cooked fowl home. My family had a wonderful 5 days 4 nights stay at Cosmos Mongkok plus good shopping and fine food. I would highly recommend Cosmos but make sure you secure a family room booking if you are travelling with your family.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms poor location”
Reviews.Author: rebecca m
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week with a group, we had single, twin and family rooms. hotel has free shuttle bus from airport, it went around in a circle between hotel, tsimshatsui city centre and airport every hour or so. located in a poorer dirty part of city, plenty of cheap restaurants, convenient shops just opposite the road, MTR station was 15 minutes walk away, bit far in hongkong standard. hotel decor was model clean and fresh. lobby was small but uncluttered, shinny and clean. staffs were very friendly and helpful. one of us was slightly ill and stayed in, reception staff offered to call room every couple of hours to check up, followed by calling my mobile to report condition, really warm and helpful. single and twin rooms were tiny, no room for guests, amenities was basic but sufficient. bathroom has frosted glass wall, clean but way too small, comfortable bed. family room was the best, giant window with superb city view, spacious with funky decor and beautiful lighting, big tv, ipod docking station, free internet, bathroom was huge and beautifully done. very good standard for an urban hotel. never tried bar or restaurant so can't tell.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Hong Kong...glad we chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelexec2002
Reviews.Content: The staff...are amazing!!!! We have stayed at this hotel for the last 9 days. The rooms take a bit of getting used to. Easy access to all HK attractions. Here are some tips.. 1. Free wifi in lobby. 2. Take local bus 2E to temple street markets. (great bargain shopping) 3. McDonalds across the street 4. Do the PEAK TRAM...amazing views of HK. 5. you can walk to the MTR olympic station (subway) and very easy to navigate to any destination 6. you can take the "airport express" train from HK international airport to Kowloon station...then you can take a short cab ride (30HK dollars...$6 US). 7. English is widely spoken in most major attractions/hotels. 8. get money from a bank machine...NOT at the airport. 9. Highly recommend a trip to MACAU. This is the gambling mecca of Asia. Easy access by ferry. cost os about 50.00 return. ask the hotel concierge. 10. Ask the concierge for a "hotel card" that has the address of the hotel so that you can just show the cab driver to get back...they don't speak english and do not accept credit cards. 11. Highly reccomend getting suites made...amazing deals 250.00 us $ for a custom made suit. email me for details. enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Casto M. Ignacio”
Reviews.Author: cmignacio
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hong Kong about four times and it was my first with Cosmo Hotel MongKok, and am pleased with our stay. The rooms were small as expected, but for the tours we had to do to include Macau, who needs a big room anyway. The hotel is clean, good location for our purpose and and most of all very accommodating and helpful lobby staff. They have free shuttle that stops to points where we most preferred to go to in HK, big savings in taking taxi cabs. I realized late that there was free wifi at the hotel lobby, Internet in the room is charged service fee per unit

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: genleorus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cosmo Mongkok from Oct 22 to Oct 25 in a Comfort twin-bedded room. The room is small (which is quite common in HK) but it is more than sufficient if you are only looking for a place to sleep. The room is modern, simple and clean. They have all the small items you might need like hair-dryer, LAN cable, adapter…etc. The best feature of the room? The bay window! The bay is a great storage area for your bags. But it would be great if they can look into more “storage space” on the walls. Maybe some hooks for coat/ clothes? The glass wardrobe is very small. On the other hand, the pillow is too soft. I need two to get a better sleep. The glass toilet door can be a bit “revealing” due to a small gap between the door and the glass wall. Otherwise, I like the rain shower and the powerful water pressure. There is an Italian restaurant on the 2nd floor. I cannot remember the name but it was a 1 star Michelin restaurant or was it 2 stars? Other than that, the gym is under renovation. No other facility I can think of. Location wise, it is in the middle of a housing estate (Tai Kok Tsui). The hotel is not exactly very near to the MTR station. It will take around 5- 7 min to get to Olympic MTR station. And around 13- 15 min to Mongkok MTR. The hotel provides a free hourly shuttle bus to Mongkok MTR, the Kowloon Airport Express station and this shopping center in TST. Since the hotel is in the vicinity of Mongkok area, there are more than enough restaurants and shops to occupy you the whole day. And if you want a shopping mall, Olympic City is just beside Olympic MTR station and Langham Place is just beside Mongkok MTR station. There is a 24hr Mac just across the hotel and there are a number of eateries, supermarkets, pharmacies and convenience stores around the hotel. But all in all, I enjoyed my stay in Cosmo Mongkok.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Scott N
Reviews.Content: I love visiting Hong Kong and each time I have stayed at different hotels in Mongkok. Mongkok is a great area to stay in and one gets to see a side of Hong Kong that is full of character and is really alive. I stayed at the Cosmo for three nights in a standard room and the room was clean, tidy and have everything you need for a short stay. Sure the room wasn't huge but then I wasn't expecting that. The staff were really friendly and helpful and there is free wifi in the lobby. I didn't use the shuttle but it is an easy 10 minute walk to Olympic Station and you can also walk to Mongkok station. So getting around and back to the hotel wasn't a problem and the area seems safe enough. The only downside I found was the noise. Located on the intersection of two busy roads the noise of traffic etc was pretty constant and my room was on the 9th floor. The TV's are wall-mounted so depending on the people in the rooms next to yours you may hear their television etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Ann W
Reviews.Content: I booked the Cosmos on line for my first visit to Hong Kong and enjoyed the room and service very much. My second visit, the hotel was full so stayed at another and couldn't wait to get back in the Cosmo. The location is great and they have a wonderful free shuttle service to major destinations. The customer service is exceptional. The restaurant "Cine Citta" is also an added plus. I would recommend d this hotel to anyone visiting Hong Kong. Thanks for making my visit so wonderful. Ann

Reviews.Title: “Neat,Nice and tidy.”
Reviews.Author: Dee B
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Served our purpose very well. Stayed on 21st floor and got a nice view of the sea, town and mountains. All services are very prompt and very friendly staff. Shuttle bus is very convenient and stops at most VIP spots including Air port express station.Walking distance to Mongkok city area where Ladies market, Argyle centre, Langham place and many more. We booked our breakfast and it was a beautiful spread from fresh fruit to stir fry noodles. If you book it try to get there when it's not busy or you'd miss out on yummy hot omelets. Person who cooks them, disappear when it's busy. By the way there is a Mc donalds right in front of it too. Rooms get cleaned every day and two complimentary water bottles that we found very useful. They refill coffee but not tea. Bathroom sliding door doesn't close properly so you have to be mindful not to look at the mirror walls. Remember to leave air conditioner on when you use it and it make the air flow pretty good so no smells. We spent 7 lovely days and we found prices pretty reasonable. They have online booking deals and you'll save a lot on those deals. Communication was amazingly great with booking and we even received a weather update before we arrived. I'd highly recommend it as a lovely neat hotel to have a relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “No reason not to stay”
Reviews.Author: CosmopolitanHotelHK
Reviews.Content: My trip to Hong Kong has been so amazing and the hotel accommodation has contributed a great part. I booked Cosmo Hotel Mongkok through their website which has a good deal as Best Rate Guarantee and for 4-night stay or more they got this special 18% discount which is a top up bargain. I am more of a tense person and I just want to make sure everthing is set and done so I emailed the hotel personnel quite a few times before the journey is set off. All of the communications make a very impressive experience, all of them responded in a timely manner, very polite and informative, you can tell they walk all the miles to make sure you get the exact information and even more.   Upon arrival, warm welcome was extended by Mr Cheung and Mr Lau the managers, they made sure I got the right room (I requested on high floors non-smoking) and they both talked very politely, to an extent I felt like a queen!! The room is very clean, tidy nearly spotless, and very bright. Though I bit small in size, I'd rather say I feel intimate and happy with the space I have. I have to say congratulations to the hotel management as they have great staff and even the room attendants speak good english. Their restaurant is also a good choice but they also got hell lot of local restaurants around the area for good-for-money dining. This is the hotel surrounded by the most number of eateries I ever visited.   All in all I love this hotel very much and don't see any reason why I am not staying with them again.

Reviews.Title: “My only choice if I go to Hong Kong again!”
Reviews.Author: seissa
Reviews.Content: I booked my family and myself an Executive Suite at Cosmo Mongkok after hearing a good review from a friend. I'm glad to say that I was not disappointed. From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I was greeted with impeccable service which really was the highlight of my trip. Check in was a breeze, Ms Sophia Jung was wonderful and even suggested some attractions that I could visit. Every staff was courteous from the chambermaids to the bell boys. Even though the hotel wasn't located at a stones throw from Any MTR (Olympic Station still seems far), the free shuttle service was so convenient, I literally scheduled my plans according to the bus! It goes to all the important places and was so punctual. The Suite was although small, it was warm and cosy for my family. Only downside was the rather small selection for the buffet breakfast and the slow rides with the lifts (after all, there were only 2 lifts to serve 20 odd floors). No comment on the Internet service as I was on unlimitd 3G service with a prepaid SIM. In conclusion, the stay was great and it's a great place to stay in! Would definitely return should I go to HK again!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: eunice2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Overall experience is good except the MTR is a bit far from the hotel. As I have 2 young children, the 6-7mins of walk can be quite tedious especially when it rains. Although the hotel provides hourly shuttle bus, the bus quite often full during peak hour (from 11am-2pm), besides, the drop off points are not near the MTR (bus stops at shopping mall instead), u will need some walking if u wanna connect to other places by MTR. Therefore, most of the time we didn't take the free shuttle bus but a local mini bus located just opposite the corner of the road to TST MTR station and it costs HK$4.40 only. Most of their staffs are friendly except their shuttle bus driver. Reluctant to explain and guide us when we asked for direction. When we checked in the hotel, we noticed few dirty spot on the toilet floor and some hairs on the bed sheet. Not very happy to see that. However informed the housekeeping the next day and they have changed my bed sheet & apologised to us but the dirty spots still remained there until we checked out. Anyway. we used the floor mat to cover it, so it wasn't affect us much. The superior Room is just nice for 2 adults and 2 young toddlers below 6. The bed is small, therefore, if your kids are above 6, you will be having problem with a good night sleep. The hotel is surrounded with many eateries and convenient shops e.g. Manning, Watson and & 7Eleven. Near the manning shop, there is a porridge restaurant (see photo attached) which serves good variety of porridge & soya bean. Price is reasonable & place is clean too. We love the porridge there.

Reviews.Title: “If you love being in the middle of it all...”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideJanpo
Reviews.Content: We decided to not to stay on HK island and glad we didn't. We arrived very early morning after our flight and our room was available at 11 am. This hotel is in the middle of real china- lots of small cafes and many things in a short walking distance. The free shuttle from the hotel gets you to the rail stations (which are very efficient and easy to use). The staff were efficient, the room was clean (and small, but no smaller than an 'Ibis" room). We had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: TSUEY SHIANG N
Reviews.Content: Cosmo hotel provide a 5 star sevice. Hotel staffs are very friendly & helpful... They provide an excellent service during typhoon on 29/09 My family are happy and enjoy to stay in Cosmo

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: michelw88
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its promotional price and it was in Kowloon. The hotel was a little further from the main street than I had expected: it's about a 15-minute walk to Nathan Road and the shopping area, while I had thought to be there in less than 5. We took the hotel shuttle (counter B12) from the airport, that was a great decision: it was very convenient, dropped us off right at the hotel, and I doubt we would have found it if we would have searched for it ourselves. The hotel room is small as pointed out by others (but average sized if I compare it to other hotel rooms I have seen in HK), I can imagine that would be a problem for overweighted people, but for us it was fine. The room has lots of mirrors, making it feel bigger. The bathroom door was from glass, so if I hadn't been travelling as a couple, I would have considered that very inconvenient. The staff was helpful and friendly, the hotel was modern and clean. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean little place near Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: Astello39
Reviews.Content: Decided to check this hotel out since there was an ongoing promotion and was new then. The hotel's location is not fantastic although the train station is not far off and you can find local food and the supermarket nearby. The main Mongkok shopping area is about a 15mins walk away. The rooms are bright and clean but hardly enough space for our luggage or to move around. The bathroom is clean but very small too. Although hotels in Hong Kong are generally small, this one is tiny. Service is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeBronJ6
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel overall, but this one had it's pro's and con's. I'll start off with the good, definitely good value, and top of the line service. The staff was very courteous and accommodating, and to me this is very important when you stay at any hotel. My dis-likes were more aesthetic than anything . My shower floor had a little gap where you can see the bare floor which to me was a small irritation but it was not the end of the world. Even though they had a convenient shuttle, it's not a walkable hotel. Which to me is key because if your out 2 AM, you can only rely on a taxi to get back, which may not apply to everyone but just a heads up to someone who plans on partying late and hoping to get back in a reasonable fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel'd and Dime'd”
Reviews.Author: Roger_Smith_Jr
Reviews.Content: My issue is that I felt nickel'd and dime'd for everything. I booked my stay online and my room came with wifi access, but I had to pay a 10% fee to use the 'free' internet. I also had to extend my stay for a day and booked the extra day from the front desk. Because I booked that extra day at the front desk, that night's stay didn't come with internet access, but the days that I booked online came with 'free' internet. The room was small, and there was a smell. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great staff! great service!”
Reviews.Author: girfriend000
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my husband in sept 13-17, 2011. we are both satisfied with this hotel we got what we needed in a tiny, compact space. the space of the room is just enough for me and my hubby. what we really love about this hotel is the service of their staff they are helpful and they always greet their guests with a smile. the bus drivers are friendly and they always smile. we love this hotel because its simple and the service here is wonderful. the staff here are well trained and educated. only downside is they had to tell us that the gym is under renovation when we booked the room but anyway, we went to hong kong for a holiday and not for working-out. the service here is great! i will surely come back here and i will even recommend this hotel to my friends and relatives who are planning to go to hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel, but location isn't the best!”
Reviews.Author: aniceglassofred
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. Hotel is very clean and modern, staff very welcoming and can't do enough for you. I had requested two rooms close to each other and on a high floor and I was given exactly that. I had breakfast in the hotel and it was very nice, especially the fresh fruits, but would like to see an addition of Hong Kong Dishes such as Fresh Noodles, otherwise can't complain! My room was small but very cozy and modern, View from my room was not good but from my friends was great so request room with a view next time! Concierge staff always on hand to give advise and were knowledgeable and helpful. Free shuttle was useful but always full so if it leaves at 10.30am make sure you are on it at 10.15am. I would mark hotel down on 2 items: 1. Location. Location isn't great. Around hotel there are plenty of places to get food and supermarkets but if you want to travel outside area it is at least 15 min walk to the nearest MTR. Hotel does provide shuttle taking you to near an MTR but really prefer to have one within walking distance. 2. Internet. This is crazy. I booked room with Internet included so was surprised to see so many charges of my room bill for Internet use. I was told that my room did include internet but I have to pay "Internet Tax". This was HK$12 every time I connected, i know its not a large amount but it adds up and really I feel cheated. Shame on you, please sort this as you have a lovely hotel and doing this will just annoy people and leave them with negative impression.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly service, lovely clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpha5723
Reviews.Content: When we checked in our room was initially in front of the elevator and after calling the front desk straight away to request a change, they sent someone up immediately to take our luggages to the 25th floor and the view was amazing! So bright and so lovely! Having travelled to Hong Kong twice before I was already aware of the standard small sizes of property including their hotels so the size did not surprise me and it wasn't an issue. My partner and I stayed for five nights in a double room and found the space very adequate for two large luggages and another small one; and though the size of the rooms may seem small, Cosmo have done a very good job at utilising the space that they have e.g. bench under the window for luggage space. The bathroom was not big enough for two people to be inside, and the shower was not very well lit, but again, I thought they did the best they could with the space and the bathroom had all ammenities- all the basics plus extras like makeup remover pads. The location was a TAD far from the center of things, but the free shuttle and efficient MTR (train) system was very convenient- and if you miss a bus it costs about AUD 2.50 to get to Mongkok! Other services- free wifi in the lobby (not in the rooms), fitness room open 24 hours. I can't comment on the breakfast, but food is so cheap in Hong Kong, I personally preferred trying out all the small local eateries surrounding the hotel. The service was fantastic from the front desk to the cleaning staff, everyone was incredibly friendly and very willing to help out- I was in the gym at 2am and a staff came in to help me turn on the a/c! I absolutely loved my stay here, it was a lovely hotel and I would definitely recommend to people who don't want to be constantly stuck in the middle of all the noise and bustle, though still no longer than a 5-10 min bus/cab ride away from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful views and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: deliporo
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the Cosmo Hotel due to a mix-up where I had to book a room someplace in Hong Kong ASAP. I honestly wasn't expecting much because of the rushed booking and especially because of the great rates (if you stay longer than 4 days, you get better rates), but I was pleasantly surprised by the hospitality of the staff (especially guest relations director Sophia Jung, who helped me out on many occasions, and is lovely) and with my room. People often complain about rooms being small in city hotels, but one has to keep in mind that in Hong Kong, where space is particularly expensive getting a room larger than a closet at such a decent price is a good fortune, and actually a room in London would not be much larger, but triple the price. My room was quite large, and I was happy with the size, however. I was welcomed to a plate of fruit when I arrived, and complimentary bottled water every day, and the bathroom had a lot of nice little touches like toothbrushes and lovely smelling soap and other toiletries. The breakfast buffet consists of both western food and Asian dim sum (which I enjoyed a lot) and was included in the price of the room. The shuttle service the hotel freely provides is helpful in getting around most of Hong Kong, but I usually prefered walking, as Mong Kok station, as well as Langham shopping place are about 10 minutes away. I was provided with a map and Sophia asked me what I wanted to see and promptly marked those locations on the map for me. I warmly recommend Cosmo Hotel, especially because if you're in the area you get to see a different sight of Hong Kong. Many westerners hang out close to the sea or Central and other tourist spots and mingle only with other westerners, but if you go a few hundred meters inland, there is a lot more to be discovered. I will definitely return to this hotel next time I'm in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean”
Reviews.Author: vishalsaneja
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights and here is the pros and cons cons 1 small rooms 2 smallest bathrooms 3 no place to keep luggage 4 no free internet in the room. 5 no free breakfast pros 1 neat,clean rooms, 2 good staff specially cristina on front desk. 3 close to mtr ,shopping ,fastfood ,hotels 4 free bus to kowloon and langham mall

Reviews.Title: “The Cosmos Mongkok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: assertivecreativity
Reviews.Content: I would like to send you a personal thank you to the staff of this hotel for being so hospitable during my stay at the hotel. Everyone was very accommodating and I felt I was at the best place in all of Hong Kong!! When I do come back I will seek those good rates in the Cosmo Hotel Mongkok and look forward to another stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “"Great service from start to finish!"”
Reviews.Author: happy v
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant experience from inquiring, booking, staying in this hotel.... even until departure. All my inquiries were promptly attended to and when we were about to book, they took the time to call me. We initially booked this since the rate is within our budget but the service, cleanliness and accessibility is beyond our expectations. Room is a little smaller than usual, usually expected in HK hotels, but the modern and good design made the stay comfortable. The only gripe i have is that the water from the shower splashes even outside the bathroom door .... this could easily be remedied by a longer shower curtain (hope the managers can do something about this). Not a major issue for me but could've been avoided. Would be visiting HK again early January and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends. Looking forward to another pleasant stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place but far”
Reviews.Author: Mitch K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place for 5D2N. The staff was very friendly and some of them could converse in English. The rooms were very clean. We were there early but the hotel was unable to give us a room to rest as check in was after 1pm. There was 6 of us and we booked 3 rooms. They gave us rooms on the 5th, 7th and 22nd. It wasn't very convenient for us but it was bearable. The hotel was probably very packed for the weekend as we it was quite noisy in the morning. People shouting and running at the hallway. I also noted that they used simmons mattress. I called for room service for towels and bathroom slippers. There was no problem faced. There was free shuttle services from hotel to Mongkok, Kowloon and TST. I missed the mini bus twice as it was full. In my opinion,the walk to the MTR was not very near. I think there would be better hotels at this rate that is near the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: Great service, fantastic staff esp yannick who looked after me, great position in the city very close to all ameanities. Lovely rooms, very clean and the air con in the room is top notch. All in all a great hotel at a fantastic price

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: KangoMooBear
Reviews.Content: stayed 6 nights with my girlfriend.. once again, no expectation of HK small rooms... Service at Front Office was so-so only; because when they asked for incidental charges; they suddenly decided to collect full payment instead. Was abit shocked but did not bother to much and paid accordingly. during our 4 day, the heater is not working.. maintaince came pretty fast and solve the issue. There was two morning where our level was so noisy because of some oversea performance staying on the same floor, screaming and shouting at the hallway.. Friend called reception for assistance - fast action taken. Restaurent food is ok~ Location is okay too.. walkable distance to Langham place and mongkok area.. but nearest MTR is not on the red line which I find it not so convi. relatively new hotel and is very clean and neat~

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jtanggz
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent as we were new to the place, the customer service personnels gave their best advices and recommendations to the places which we are interested in. They gave extra value added services even in the middle of the night. The rooms were cosy and the scenery we experience in the hotel gives us a clear bird eye view of the Mongkok area.

Reviews.Title: “Will Go Again!”
Reviews.Author: DMC697
Reviews.Content: Forget what people say about small rooms; this is Hong Kong! Compared to a lot of places in the area, the Cosmo's rooms are decently-sized. The hotel was brand new and I was impressed with the standard of my room. It was stylish, spotlessly clean, and quiet. The toilet and shower are in a glassed-in alcove that can feel a little revealing, so some guests might feel a little awkward if they're not on good terms with their traveling companion. I can't comment on the restaurant or the breakfast, as I ate elsewhere. The location is pretty good. Olympic MTR station is just 5 minutes away and if you're energetic, you can walk to the more useful Mong kok station, and Nathan Road, in less than 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very New & Convenience Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanprida
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days and found out that the place was so nice & easy access to other attraction places. The room was very clean. The staffs were so very helpful & friendly. The hotel provided shuttle bus to in town shopping area which was so convenience. There were plenty of local restaurant around the hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient Hotel for Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Sean_JOO
Reviews.Content: For the business trip to HK, I stayed this hotel for a week. I would like to say about this hotel that; 1. It’s not expensive hotel considering its location and facilities of hotel (nice & clear room, gym, etc.) 2. Hotel staffs are so nice. It was the first time for me to visit HK. Concierge informed me of many places I have lunch and dinner. Every time they got me a taxi and told me the estimated taxi fare. 3. If you are Korean or Japanese, please find Sophia Jung (I’m not sure about her name) at the lobby. She is incredibly nice and she can speak Korea, English, and Japanese. Definitely you will get lots of helps from her as I did 4. Around the hotel, there are four convenience stores. So you don’t have to worry about the hunger in mid-night. Also, I went to Yeh Lam Kwok Restaurant and Korea restaurant (beside of YLK Restaurant). Their food would be good for everyone from all around the world. I hope this would be helpful for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, good value”
Reviews.Author: Gipsymoth
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the Cosmo Kowlong; Augustine and the rest of the staff have been very attentive and caring, although a little tight the room was cozy with very nice design. breakfast was god and with plenty of choices. Location in lively Kowloong was more appropriate than we excepted and the shuttle service to the airport express and more attractions was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy our stay!”
Reviews.Author: JaslineTay
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Cosmo Mongkok from 16th Aug til 20 Aug 2011 Despite being far from all activities - the busy street of Mongkok, the scheduled shuttle bus service from Hotel to Mongkok was very efficient and this help us to get to all destination very fast and easy. The staff there was very friendly, on one night, we will like to get onto the internet however, we will met with some problems. Andy Tse, Guest Relationship Manager was very helpful and stay to try to help us get connected. Besides, during one night my mum got a cut from the glass that they provide and they quickly came over to provide 1st aid to my mum and change away the glass. Do note that those transparent glasses can't hold hot water, it break when my mum pours hot water and cut my mum's finger, the ones that are white made of ceramic are better. Despite the pros, there are a few cons as well: 1. Internet Service - though we book the room through their website for internet access we still need to pay HK$12 for admin charges for 24 hours usage 2. Lifts - there are only 2 lifts hence, during peak hours it is almost impossible to get back to the rooms, we have to wait for quite some time to get up and down. 3. The pillows are too thin & soft, need to use the cushion provided to make it higher.... Despite that, we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons (in summary)”
Reviews.Author: kiat_tan
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Wonderful Service by the Concierge team 2. Well decorated modern rooms 3. Water pressure is good. 4. Situated in a relatively good location. (in-between Oylmpic and Mongkok MTR) 5. Free shuttle bus available to Mongkok MTR, Macau Ferry Terminal, Kowloon Airport express. Cons: 1. We requested for a double room made through travel agency more than 2months ago but Cosmo could not concede to our request. A simply "overbooked" reply and their policy to travel agency for such request is subjected to availability. Process should be better streamlined as such request are important to the guest. It should not just limit servicing request and booking made direct through the hotel website. 2. Limited TV channels 3. The design of the basin easily cause water to splash onto self. 4. The lift system has to improve its efficiency. (I have no suggestion on how thou) 5. Rooms near the lift might get a bit noisy (depends on the other guests) 6. The pillows are too soft. Note: Thanks Mr Augustine for his patience, understanding, excellent customer service and place us on the next priority for the double bed room the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad yet not very good..”
Reviews.Author: Jam_Queenie
Reviews.Content: Staff are pretty friendly and helpful however rigid on extending complimentary service such as late check out. Location is near to MTR and they do provide free shuttlebus to a few place. Negative point is, there all alot of China tourist and this irritate me. Talk loudly and taking off their shoes in the lobby, gross!!! Overall, if u have extra cash may like to reconsider other hotel otherwise, what u pay is what u got..,

Reviews.Title: “We were satisfied with the overall service”
Reviews.Author: Sarahjane002
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Cosmo hotel was a pleasant one. We found that the service staff were friendly and very helpful especially those from the concierge. Price- The price of the hotel is affordable though you may get a much bigger room for the same price in Guangzhou. Facilities- The hotel has a free shuttle service to selected MRT stations which makes it really convenient to commute to and from the hotel to different locations. The gym was a plus as most hotel within the same price range in HK does not have a gym. We wish to however express regret that though the overall service was up to par, front desk needs to be friendlier. We were greeted by front office personnel who didn't seem like they enjoyed their job/was having a bad day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern decoration with good services”
Reviews.Author: Claudia186225
Reviews.Content: I was staying in the hotel for 2 months. Everything went well. Although the room that I was in is a bit small, but the hotel is fully decorated with a modern taste so that the space is "enlarged" by installing transparent glass doors and mirrors. Good room service as well. I used internet, laundry and free shuttle bus services provided by the hotel. Internet connection was fast. I particularly the free shuttle bus services as it could take you to 3 main shopping areas around the hotel in Kowloon. One day I consulted about an internet connection error occurred in my room. They sent a staff, Yannick Lau to my room to solve the problem within a minute I put down the phone. Excellent result for the service. I would highly recommend this hotel to you if you want to stay in Hong Kong and hope you enjoy the stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in the Hotel.. We will be back!=)”
Reviews.Author: Cherry0504
Reviews.Content: Relatively New Hotel, Clean and refreshing. Facilities are not bad and customer service Excellent. Staff are friendly especially Yannick and the concierge service counter.conveient place, near olympic MTR. they have shuttle bus to a few places that area TOurist Spots, Such as MongKOK langham place and even kowloon station where there is airport EXpress. Strongly recommended..=) we will be back

Reviews.Title: “3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: The Cosmo Hotel in Mongkok was very clean and modern. Each room offered a clean and modern design. The breakfast at their restaurant was ok. The fitness room had some machines. However, the benefits advertised on their website was not given to us during our stay. There were many positives such as the friendly service from the housekeeping staff with their daily good mornings as I walked through the hall. The rooms were clean and comfortable but I was unhappy with the front desk mostly. When I checked their website in June, the website advertised things about having an executive lounge included with rooms above the Executive and free internet for one computer. The room I booked was the Studio Air. Their Studio Air page, at the time, was the exact same thing as the Suite Air! However... knowing that the Studio Air was obvious between the Executive, which does not exist anymore, and Suite Air... I was sure that those were included. After checking in... I was not given anything. Even the still advertised free use of a notebook and iPad was not given to us when we asked. Even though the Executive Lounge was not included... we were able to see how horrible it was with the door left ajar. There wasn't anything inside at all and no working staff was to be found. Other than those things... the Cosmo Hotel is still a decent hotel. My stay was enjoyable but I don't believe that the things mentioned will be a problem anymore. Their free shuttle was good too. Apparently the IT department decided to change their website with the right information after our stay.

Reviews.Title: “cheaters please avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lingaraj
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel checking the reviews but it was a complete dissapointment rooms exteremely tiny bath room tinyto add to my problems i had ordered for a drink as it was my anniversary which turned into a disaster. My mistake the drink fell on the carpet,next day i was informed that i had to meet the manager in lobby he informed that i should pay the entire money gor the carpet HKD 2000 which was rediculos else he will call the cops and he had money as security deposit. Then afer 2 hrs of arguing he said i have to pay 50% and the rest will be paid by them its only cheating tourist as we do not have a choice i do not want any travellers to face similar problems as i did pls avoid there are plent better at similiar price in Mongkok

Reviews.Title: “Clean room with nice view”
Reviews.Author: maythamhuimei
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Cosmo for 5 nights, we stayed at the 19th floor. At first, we are given twin room, but the staff was willing to help us change to a double room the next day when there is empty room. Twin room is a bit cramp with very little walking place. The rooms are clean with good view overseeing the mountains. Staffs are helpful and always with a smile. There is shuttle bus service going to langham place at mongkok, china hk city/ ferry terminal at tsim sha tsiu (going to macau route), kowloon station which leads to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: NomadAnnabella
Reviews.Content: The stay at Cosmo mongkok was comfortable. Friendly staff and great location! Since the hotel is the city center rooms are small but clean (not much of a view though...many tall building close to it). Though the MTR station is not close, the hotel has a shuttle bus which runs through out the day on an hourly basis. Tip: Make sure you are early for the shuttle during peak hours since there tends to be quite a crowd waiting for it. We opted for the taxis...since they are affordable in HK. Taxis are available right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good service & nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Irene_4484
Reviews.Content: The service is great... Staffs are friendly and helpful.. Keep up the good work.. Free shuttle bus to the nearby Langham place, TST & Kowloon station @ every hr.. Room Rate is acceptable and room size is big enough for 2 pax.. Bad points are the toilet is semi-transparent and the toilet door cannot be fully closed.. Will be better if can provide with free wifi in room or @ lobby.. Overall a happy stay..

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo Kowloon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shufen81
Reviews.Content: Staff are very friendly and it is location near Olympic mtr. Room are quite small but is very clean. The number of seat near the front desk should increase. Two sofa seat is really not enough during the peak hours, like checking in/out.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: oldfoxtraveller
Reviews.Content: The Cosmo is a pretty new, very clean hotel conveniently located near the Mongkok shopping area and with a free shuttle bus to shopping and the Airport Express train. Although the room was small, it was well appointed and quiet and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I would certainly go back to this hotel next time I'm in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimmyG10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of May and the beginning of June on two separate occasions. The only downside to the hotel is the size of the rooms. They are very compact! BUT .... if you only want somewhere to sleep at night they're perfect. The hotel is situated in an ideal location, close to amazing shopping centres and local transportation. The hotel provides a free, regular shuttle service to shopping centres and bus and MTR stations. It's ideally situated if you want to go to Hong Kong itself or pop over the border to China. It's a very clean and well laid out hotel and I can't praise the staff highly enough. Every one of them is polite, helpful and friendly. I will certainly be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Room in The middle of the City”
Reviews.Author: biofresh
Reviews.Content: No regret, No question but the staffs are slightly not not friendly but overall they are helpful. Rooms are small as I took 7 members to stay in 3 rooms for 5 days 4 night solely in this hotel. Room service are superb and cleaning service are good. Toilet are just nice for a 100kg fatty like me!! Place is good as very near to Olympic MTR station which is just 5 minute work and also near Olympic mall which basic shopping can be done. Food are easily to get as all situated is a walking distance. Convinence in going to Mongkok nightmarket and jade market also digital street which I got my SLR lences CHEAP!! Best to mention I forgotten to take my h/p charger which they call me back to get it. VERY honours!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyhalik
Reviews.Content: the room we booked was not very big but if you are not big the space will be enough, we did not spend any time in the room apart from the sleep at night. very comfortable beds, safe, tea/coffee make, amazing shower (great water pressure), not too many tv channels.around 7 min walk to the underground, free shuttle every hour, but taxi are very cheap. not too much around but most important was the fact that mcdonalds is opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views!”
Reviews.Author: Leigh1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a stopover from London to Brisbane. Friendly staff, great location (close to ladies Market and Metro station) views from room were incredible! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It is TINY!”
Reviews.Author: sun_loverKS
Reviews.Content: Pros - Location is good. Near to MTR, walking distance to Mongkok Shopping area, and free shuttle to Mongkok, Kowloon and the Macau ferry terminal. Service is good too. Cons - Room is absolutely the tinest I have seen! No room to walk and no space to hang clothes or stuff. The bathroom is even tinier! With barely enough space to bend down if you drop something. No meant for guests who are bigger built.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: chrislo222
Reviews.Content: Relatively new hotel located quite a distance from the nearest MTR station and shopping centre (approx. 10+ minutes walk). The hotel does offer free shuttle bus to Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui, so that's a plus. Pleasant and helpful hotel staff. Was turned off by the the strong "fragrance" in the hotel lobby. What I did not expect was the extremely TINY rooms! There's literally no space for one to maneuver around at all...let alone to open up a suitcase. Cleanliness is average, could be better. The beds are quite comfy. There are not many decent restaurants around. For the price they charge, I guess it's considered decent. However, if given a choice, I would not stay here the next time we visit in light of the above.

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely Cosmotic!”
Reviews.Author: Wesleytam
Reviews.Content: A mid range level hotel at Kowloon area, in between of Olympic Station and Mongkok Station. The nearest station is at Olympic and can travel by walk for around 7-10 minutes. The community in the area have an 24-hr Mc Donalds, a 7-eleven and some chinese stores. night time in this area is dull... there is nothing much except those 24-hrs store. in summary, here are the pro's and Cons - Pros: 1. Room is very nice. Modern and stylistic, especially the toilet. 2. A nice picture window with automatic curtain blinds. 3. Complimentary water everyday. 4. Receptionist has a nice outfit. Cons: 1. No wireless internet, but have LAN access for internet. 2. No night life in the area. 3. Baggage area is at the service parking with cages, but still safe. Overall, i can book again to this hotel if i have money thou... :P

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages.”
Reviews.Author: neerajbalwani
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel but not enough space in lobby to get seated very small rooms but what a friendly staff with a desire to help always waiting for you in the lobby to serve you with a smile excellent is small word for there service in lobby. Food was ok but not a single dish Indian now about location if you are a tourist I will not recommend but if you are a business traveller then its Ok.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms, but a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: its_december
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stellar by website, and on arrival lives up to expectations, with a dramatic double-height entrance and huge chandelier. The staff (in kooky uniforms) are very friendly and have good English). There's no two ways about it, the room was small. For £700 (8 nights), I had expected a little more room to manoeuvre. The bed could only be accessed comfortably from one side. Staying for a week was not thoroughly catered-for, as there was nowhere to store our cases. For the price, I had also expected breakfast, but it was an extra $110 each, and the staff in the dining room were curt, the food unexceptional. There was a small fridge stocked with the basics. There was a TV with a football channel, which pleased him, but not much else in English (but we weren't on the other side of the world to watch the telly). The bathroom was enclosed by a curved glass wall with a sliding door. The novelty of this coupled with the excessive mirrors (presumably to enlarge the 'feel' of the space; in reality meant you could see each other on the toilet, even with the door closed, from anywhere in the room) wore off after about 3 hours. The shower was lovely, with a giant head which meant the water fell like rain. There was also a good safe in the room (not that it was really required). There was a horrible smell from the drains, but maybe this was room-specific. We should have complained, but were unsure that our problem would translate without seeming rude. On the first night, I asked for an ice bucket, to which the porter said 'yes, certainly', but it failed to materialise. We also got a rather rude phone call from housekeeping asking if we were ever going to go outside so they could clean up our room. On the last night, we even received a wake-up call we hadn't asked for at 8am, which wasn't great, as we planned to sleep til just before check-out, as we returned from Macau the night before at around 3am. The hotel lobby and lifts/corridors were superbly decorated and fanatically clean, but I did find a peanut under the bed (not ours), which put me off a bit. The nearest metro is Olympic City, which is about 6 mins away, and there are some great restaurants (McDonalds aside) locally. We also found a good bar with lots of display cabinets with turtles in! Easy walking distance from Mong Kok station past interesting local food markets, and also a short walk from Golden Computer Arcade & market environs (including vendors of both jade and goldfish). In all, the hotel was in a good location to see the more exciting side of local life. It's not such a far walk from the metro, and the pavements are slightly less frenetic than the more popular tourist areas. This also means you can find a variety of cheap local chow. The room wasn't big, but we didn't go to stay in the room. Another couple of square feet and it would have been good for a week. Standard rooms are more suitable for executives - if you're staying any longer, I'd recommend the next size up. I think it was expensive, but we booked late, and it's not that pricey compared to other hotels locally.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: The outstanding service from the staff impressed me. I have to admit I was pretty disappointed by the room sizes, but I finally adapted to this for a short overnight stay. I had never heard of this hotel until my company booked it. Upon arrival, I found the location to be adequate, close enough to manage where I wanted to go. But the service attitude of the staff made my day. Check in was fast, professional and friendly. Waits for the two elevators proved to be long most of the time. The room......wow, so surprised at tiny size for a newly opened hotel. I was really disappointed when I arrived, but I became accustomed to this and for one person this was ok. Similar to some other HK hotels, but did not expect for new place. The bed could only be accessed from one side and the TV was wall mounted to make some room. The decor was well done to offset the tiny space and I decided I could cope for short term visit. I had two disappointments. I set the temperature for 28 to try and warm up the chilly room, but discovered it was colder. I finally decided the heat was broken and called for help. They sent a space heater and I later learned from other reviews that apparently the hotel does not have heat!. For 10 months this is fine. I am very disappointed that this is not somehow high lighted when you arrive to check in or in the room. Other shock was the new building under construction outside my window. On 23rd floor, I was look at the faces of the workers and they were noisy. I tried to sleep in on Saturday, but the workers had other plans for me. Overall - for the price I paid (HKD 1000+) I was not impressed with no heat, and construction noise. Also a HKD $120 charge for internet was also too much for my tolerance. If I could pick a room on other side of building , get a lower price (this room and location seems to be ok for me at HKD 600 range inclusive of internet ) and of course avoid the cold weather days , maybe I would come back for a short stay. The staff try really hard to make you welcome and go out of their way to help.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: jorge27
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel, clean, modern, staff is exceptionally great. The rooms are quite small ( pretend you're on a cruise) There was a problem...no heat, just AC, and it was not that warm outside. Best bet is to take the train from airport to kowloon station, then a cab ( costs 4$) The hotel has a shuttle to kowloon station, and you can check in your luggage there...it's perfect! The shopping in the area is great, as are the local restaurants. It's a short subway ride to hong kong island from mong kok station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: davedmd
Reviews.Content: If you want to get away from the crowds of downtown this is a nice location. There are local restaurants, markets and McD's across the street. A 5 minute walk and you will be in Olympic Mall with some great Food courts. The only problem with this place is they forgot to include Heating in the A?C unit in each room and you need to ask for a heater when it gets cold outside. The rooms are tight and if you are a heavy or extra large overweight person you my be uncomfortable otherwise we loved the modern new decor and comfort of the room. Internet is not included and very expensive and breakfast is not cheap but the local dinning options are great and thier free shutle drops you off at the MTR station or downtown in about 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Wonderful Staff & Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: bubbie67
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and stayed for 6 nights. As it was our first time in this hotel, did not know what to expect. To our very pleasant surprise, the staff at reception were extremely pleasant and helpful. We were also taken up with the helpfulness of the concierge staff. All of them were always ready to answer any questions and provided us with accurate information. Though the room was rather small, the hotel staff members made the stay very enjoyable and we would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends. Another plus point is the location. Across the location is a variety of amentities and McDonalds. It is also about a 15 to 20 minutes walk to the Ladies Market and a pleasant walk to the Jade Market. Taking a taxi is also easy and not very expensive. So if you are thinking about a trip to Hong Kong, do give this hotel serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Good and getting better”
Reviews.Author: TokyoGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Cosmo Kowloon three times since it opened and i must say they are really improving. On my first stay service was uneven and some of the hotel's facilities weren't completed. Now things are pretty good: I was warmly greeted at reception, more facilities are open and staff are more with it in terms of the service aspect. The food at this hotel is very good and I saw a few local families eating there even though they don't stay at the hotel. The outdoor bar area was a nice place for end of day beers (although maybe too warm in summer). The location is actually really good. you can walk to Nathan road in 10 minutes and it is pretty near the bird market, ladies market etc. Also the Olympic shopping center and Olympic MTR station are very close; therefore Central and Hong Kong Island are also less than 20 minutes away. The rooms are small, no question, but the price is really cheap especially for Hong Kong. Overall this is a good hotel that represents very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise - definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: cb0079
Reviews.Content: I booked the Cosmo Kowloon on otel at the rate of around 63 EUR per night which was cheap compared to other offers when I had to book at the last minute. The hotel is not at the very heart of the tourist hot spots, but also not too far away. It takes about 10 minutes walk to Nathan road (and Mongkok Road) and some street markets. The hotel lobby has a pretty impressive high ceiling and is clad in white marble. There are lots of attendants standing by opening the door for you and offering to bring your luggage to the room. Didn't expect that for that price. Upon check-in, I received a free upgrade to their Executive Floor. The room itself is pretty small (maybe 10 sqm or 100 sq ft) and has a queen size bed that is only accessible from one side (or the bottom), the other side is at the wall to the bathroom. Speaking of bathroom, it is a little corner just beside the door with a glass wall and glass-sliding door to the room (don't worry, the glass is partially sand-blasted, so your travel companion won't actually see you). The room is cleverly laid out. There is space for a large suitcase on the window bench (with a decent view over Hong Kong Skyscrapers and very good blinds for a good sleep) and there is also a little working desk. Internet access from the room costs HKD 30 for one hour, HKD 60 for 3 hours or HKD 120 for a full day. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and if I get a similar rate, I may stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with good facilities and Awesome Food”
Reviews.Author: Rajat289
Reviews.Content: THe Cosmo Kawloon Hotel is one of the most clean hotel I have ever seen. The best part is the smoke free atmosphere. Cleanliness and room services are very nice. Lunch and Dinner specially if you are vegeterian like me is very nice... Overall I had a fab 9 day stay there.

Reviews.Title: “blah”
Reviews.Author: probativev
Reviews.Content: Stayed fo 3 nights and will be checking out of this place in a few hours. first night I arrived past midnight and they put me on the 11th floor. Room had 2 beds and was tiny. I was by myself in the room and didn't need the extra bed. The window sill serves as luggage storage space or counter, but there were 3 strands of long hair there. I didn't touch that part of the room area, and was grossed out. Bathroom had a sewage smell. "desk" area" if you could call it that, was so small. Bathroom was tiny. No sink counter space. Absolutely no space for personnal toiletries if you're a woman forget about where you can put your make up. Housekeeping starts a 7am and they were SOOOO noisy. I complaint about the hair and noise and they moved me up to the 22nd floor, which is a better room with one double bed. Better desk space, and a pretty great view of the city. Bathroom had less of a sewage pipe smell (still a bit there though). Housekeeping starts about 9am on this higher floor. Still VERY noisy once they start, so if you stay here, you better not be looking for decent sleep-ins. Location is not convenient. Many blocks away from MTR. Ok if you come from places where you're used to walking a lot. But since I had a lot of errands to run, I don't have time for that and took taxis a lot. Fitness center is still being built. Elevators are small and very sloooooow. They hotel website claims they guaranteed the lowest internet rate but Expedia has cheaper rates. This Cosmo is affiliated with the Cosmo on the HK side. The 2 are at vastly different locations. Hotel staff was generally very nice. Still, for the same price, I'd recommend the Park Hotel or Butterfly on the Prat in Tsim Tsa Tsui. Same poor qualities but much much better locations.
